column5: 50cl bottle from Tesco's. Medium white head. Clear golden pour. Light bitterness

Bottle. Pours a clear golden colour with a thin white head and soft carbonation. Aroma of biscuit,lemon                                                                              ,hint of lime and soft grassy hops. Taste is similar with initial bitterness moving to a soft fruity hops finish. Nice easy drinking ale.

Bottle from Beer Central                                                                         ,Sheffield. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet                          ,malty and light hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Dry and light bitter finish. 171018

Bottle from Beer Central                                                                         ,Sheffield. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are grass,malt                                                                                                                                    ,hops,fruits and has a light bitter finish.

Bottle. Pale Yellowy Gold in colour. Hoppy; floral hops. Fruity; citrus orange. Malty; sweet malts, caramel. Good hop/fruit/malt balance. Fairly sweet with slight bitterness in the dry finish. Easy drinking. (2010-07)
Pours amber from 500ml bottle. Hints of straw, grapefruit, lime. Strange smell though..

Butelka 500ml prosto z browaru. Zloty kolor,piana biala dosc obfita,opada szybko do obreczy. W aromacie dominuja cytrusowe nuty. W smaku cytrusy ,chlebowy posmak i dosc duza goryczka na finiszu. Dziwny posmak ni to drewna, ni to ziarna..ogolnie pozytywnie

Sampled from a bottle from the brewery. Golden colour with a thin, white head. Aroma of biscuit and citrus. Taste of light malts and a good flavour of lime and grapefruit from the hops. A nice Golden Ale.
Half pint at Red Deer, Sheffield. Low carbonation; well balanced; long, bitter finish.
Enjoyable 50cl bottle bought from asda in Wakefield. Pleasant pale ale. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tasted this in the Last Post, Paisley (JDW) in April 2000. Cask, handpump dispense. Clear pale amber in colour with a thin white head. Slight whif of citric lemon peel in the vanishing aroma. thin watery mouthfeel and poor lacing. Pale malts give a short digestive biscuit base with tart citric fruit notes of weak grapefruit and lemon. Dusty notes from the hop resins builds up in intensity to give a strong metallic ringing tone in the long aftertaste. Finish is too astringent with no body at all. A poor Golden Ale.
Cask at the Three Horseshoes, Morley, Derby - a Marstons house Clear gold with a creamy white head; easy to drink, light body, hoppy and slightly citrus. Plain and unexciting.
Bottle from Tesco (a while ago) Amber coloured reasonably pleasant hoppy bitter.

1. Cask Handpump at the Penny Black, Northwich (JDW) 03/06/2002 Clear golden coloured with some sour fruit flavour. Full malt finish. 2. Bottle 05/04/2004 Amber coloured hoppy and slightly citrus flavour. Some dryness in a lasting malt finish.
Cask Conditioned at JDW Banbury. Golden beer with no head. Sweetly malted beer, with a juicyfruit background, like a cheap flavouring in sweets. Dty hoppy foreground saves the day. Average fare.
Bottled. Golden colour – barely carbonated. Mostly malt. Another average beer from the ridiculously long list of bottled ales that Marston’s produce.
Rather too flat looking beer, but its malty and hoppy freshness makes this beer worth trying.
Bottled version. Little aroma, faint malty flavour and a dry uneventful finish.

I think I had this beer under 4 different names during one day in Nottingham! They were all quite good though and included the word "gold". Well-hopped, highly floral, straight golden brew wearing a full white head. Pleasant, almost tartish, lemony aromas that have a certain perfumey quality to them. Soft bready and grainy background. Grows quite dry and firmly bitter. A fine, fresh and tasty offering at this low ABV.

Cask @ The Pembury Tavern, Hackney. Pours a clear pale golden color with a small white head. Fruity malty honey aroma with hoppy hints. Sweet malty hoppy flavor with some hints of citrus. Has a sweet malty and bitter finish.

Cask conditioned at The Newshouse, Nottingham. Pale gold with white head. Light session beer, easy and thirst quenching. light malts with a touch of grassy green hop. Sharp and crispy on the finish. Reasonable. Earlier Rating: 1/17/2004 Total Score: 3.2 Cask conditioned at The Vat & Fiddle, Nottingham. Light brown beer with thick head. This is very tricky, as it is badged differently at certain pubs, this example was called Meadow Gold. A low malted, hoppy, refreshing bitter. Dry and bitter on the finish.
Aroma had loads of grassy hop with a hint of citrus. Taste was similar dry super sessionable.

Half pint gravity fed at the Battersea Beer Festival, a clear golden amber with a filmy white head. A strong fruit hop aroma. A good bitter palate all the way through the swallow, imparting hoppy fruit flavours.
[Cask from The Three Judges] Gold, minimal head. Floral, piney aroma, toasty with a hint of caramel. Light, peach notes on the palate, dry hoppy.
Handpump in Commercial Inn, Dunfermline. A very refreshing pint on a warm day.

Cask at Rook and Gaskill Inn, York: Aroma of crips hops. blond color. nice crisp hoppy and friuty flavor. thin palate. Pretty nice. Not as nice as harvest pale... kind of the poor mans version but still nice
[Cask at GBBF] Clear golden. Light citric hops dominate the nose. Medium sweet and light bodied with rounded, somewhat soapy mouthfeel. Pleasant notes of sparkling orange juice. Medium bitterness.
Cask Handpump at the Vat & Fiddle, Nottingham 17/07/2004 (As Meadows Gold) Golden coloured and hoppy with some sour fruit flavour. Pleasant creamy malt finish.
Robe dorée, fine mousse. Nez peu typé sur des notes de banane et de céréales. Bouche épicée qui manque de fraîcheur et de complexité. Un blanche à oublier

Robe laiteuse très trouble, mousse fort correcte, blanche et assez fine. Nez épicé, avec du poivre, très aromatique ! Une pointe citronnée aussi. En bouche, du grain cru, on sent le froment, pointe acidulée, citronnée, légère. Un goût de levure et de coriandre. Typée blanche, mais avec une originalité certaine, due à ce côté épicé étonnant. Facile à boire, légère, agréable.

Loved it. Reminded me of a good old fashioned German wheat beer. Haze for days in the glass. Small thin head once settled. Hardly any aroma which concerned me at first. Mouth feel was nice, downed well, no bitterness.....massive fruity flavours, banana instantly springs to mind. Purchased online, literally off the hop, but ill be going back for more. If you like your wheat beers...then youll need a 4 pack in the fridge...weekly. Very nice beer.

Mousse blanche très carbonique partant rapidement, robe jaune pâle voilée par la levure. Très bel arôme, mélange d’agrumes, orange et citron, ainsi qu’une pointe de cannelle. A la dégustation c’est très doux, l’orange et le citron sont bien présents, la pointe d’épice et la cannelle sont légers. C’est une très belle blanche aromatique, elle manque un peu de corps pour tenir sur la longueur, cependant elle ne peut cacher son caractère artisanal, et sa spécificité. Une belle réussite pour cette brasserie. Dégustée en 75 Cl DLUO 03 2017

Bottled 330ml (BB 01/2017Saveur Biere) Hazy orange color, small white head. Riped banana and grain in the nose. Medium-bodied. Banana, orange peel, bubblegum, not much spiceyness. Watery finish. Boring.

75cl bottle at home. Now this is a pleasantly looking wheat beer! Very, very hazy, lemon yellow to light brown colour, with on top a thin fizzy, white collar full of carbon. The aromas are very light and subtle - a bit of a shame - but I noticed some herbs, wheat and earth. Maybe some dough too. The taste has little malts, bitterness, lots of fresh lemon water, some citrus zeste and the lemon sourness, herbs. A touch of black pepper as well, yet this features should be maxed. So less water and more pepper notes could make this an excellent white!

330ml bottle. Hazy, pink-ish, faint golden colour with small, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Herbal and fruity aroma, notes of sage, hints of orange. Taste is minimally sweet wheaty, fruity and herbal, notes of sage, some orange, unspecific fruitiness overall, a tart touch as well; slightly watery.

Bottle 33cl. Cloudy yellow straw color, small frothy white head, mostly diminishing to a thin yeasty layer, light lacing; wheat aroma, yeast, dough, some citrus, cardamum, taste medium sweet, light sour, wheaty, dough, bit fruity; light body, watery yeasty texture, soft carbonation, aftertaste light sweet, yeasty, spicy notes; overall a bit bland and yeast too dominant but nevertheless a decent witbier.
330ml bottle from Estaminet’t Kasteelhof, drunk at home following a beer festival to send me to sleep. Pours a lovely hazy yellow with pleasant lemon aroma. Creamy, wheaty mouthfeel. Nice wit.

Bottle shared at Kasteelhof - Cassel, France. Pours cloudy, pale yellow with a fine, white cream head. The nose holds pale, bready malts with lightly tangy citrus. Light sweet flavor with slight paper notes, dough, hay. Light bodied with average carbonation. Clean finish if slightly bland, with a bit more dough and paper. Meh, OK.

[50cl bottle from a local corner shop at 6.8% ABV] A hazy amber pour with light carbonation; sweet dessert apple aroma with some yeast; rather a lot of tannin in the mouth with bittersweet fruit; and a much sweeter finish.

Box @ Anchor Inn, High Offley, Staffordshire one of the last remaining parlour pubs in England. Pours an expected cloudy yellow, aroma is pure fruit, funk, orchard must. Taste continues, lightly sour with a nice pure fruit sweetness and light acidic tang. Decent.

I word eloquenty describes this cider:disgusting! When the barman slipped out the back to get the cider; I didn’t realize he was filling my glass with urine. My taste buds hurt from the pain of this cider!
nice for a strong scrumpy bottle from morrisons refreshing when cold would recommend to anyone who ia into cider

19/2/2019. Bottle from Asda, Ipswich. Pours very slightly hazy yellow gold with a short lasting white head. Aroma of sweet apple juice. Quite heavy sweetness, minimal bitter/tartness. Moderate body, sticky texture, average carbonation. Sweet finish. Too sweet for me.
Decent ok cider. Looks Nice. Hazy yellow color. Fine apple flavor and a quite mild oak touch. Pleasant acidity. [Bottle from Nisa Local (Bayswater) - Paddington in London, England]
My least favourite drink I’ve had, strong flavour that doesn’t taste great. I would definitely choose a more traditional cider
Draught. Unclear yellow color with no head. Aroma is apple candy, custard, earthy funk. Taste is earthy. A bit mealy mouthfeel, flat. A decent Scrumpy.

Cask half pint at The Lamplighter, St. Helier. Still and strong cider, hazy yellow colour. Flavour mid between dry and sweet, both flavour and aroma have distinct notes of cider apples, oak and sulphites.
I like the flat scrumpy one not the fizzy one. It's cloudy, looks like urine but will get you on your back after 3/4 pints! Definitely a favourite of mine due to the crisp apple aroma and tastex
Yum; beautiful rubyness; nutty aroma, nice head with everlasting lace. Became enriched with warming. Best Maumee has to offer (which wasn't much)
A very pretty red/orange in color with a sweet, alcohol nose to it. Nutty, roast flavor over a maple syrup sweetness. Noticable alcohol taste, not but obtrusive. Nice beer.

everything good i know about toledo ohio can be summed up in two words: maumee bay. a great brewpub in a historic building, decorated with a decent beer can collection and buckeye beer brewerania. cute wait staff generally rated about 3.6. i got the doppelbock in a growler: poured saddle brown, a fluffy head so big in a pint glass that a british pub patron would feel cheated. malty, maple aroma. quite sweet, brown sugar. nice body, generous hop. powerful in alcohol, but not as pungently "bocky" as spaten optimator. in fact, much smoother and more quaffable. tasty, respectable brew, but you'll want something hoppy next.
Pours a light amber (not red). Hop/cat pee aroma. Bland, papery flavor. Don’t waste your money/time

Carbonation should be on the side of a milk carton; virtually nonexistent. Mouthfeel was watery and milky. Some hop bitterness surfaces in the finish, but it is a feckless attempt at gaining my attention. Not much in the flavor department; flavoids on strike. Overall, rather disappointing. No nutty roastiness; no sweetness; no rich malt flavors; nor crisply bitter hoppy notes. Just an unbalanced, watery, uncarbonated, boring beer. I feel ashamed to bash it so hard, but I'm being honest.
Pretty standard. Golden pour. Nose and taste is floral bitter malt. Rated 5/19/04
POurs clear with notes of bread on the nose. It shows a decent amount of crisp malt and hops with a clean finish.

Undated bottle from American Beer Distributors consumed on 9/25/06. Crystal clear, filtered/pasteurized/force carbonated. Still, a rosy peach-copper body is true enough to style and the white head while not particularly well-retained, laces quite resiliently and is maintained at partial-cover. Initially, a very hoppy nose shows off dusty saaz hops, but very aromatic and quite crisp and straw-like as well. Spiciness on the end, and a touch of light honey and dough. Not too much crisp yeast either. Way too much sugar in the flavor, bready, doughy and with a sagging, artificially carbonated texture. Bitterness perks up at the very beginning but is quickly washed out by pale sugars, wateriness and hay flavored hops. Poorly balanced, there is no crisp yeast bite at the end of my bottle. Gets watery very quickly. No alcohol noted.

Found this at some crappy bodega on 14th st. Aroma has that traditional light saaz smell, but I think this was old b/c it had some slight skunkiness to it. Flavor was light sweet malt with some breadiness and a decent hop flavor and bitterness. Pretty cleand and crisp finish but may have been a bit past its prime. Not as good as Staropramen.
Excellent eurolager aroma, but it kinda went downhill from there. Cereal, metallic and malty flavors. Ditto on the finish. Green bottle, lousy label.
Very Smooth,the flavor is great, no aftertaste,I like it....................
An ordinary, light, watery, fizzy lager. Nothing special...................
Came across this at a hole in the wall liquor store in St. Louis. Booze, booze, and more booze. Appearance is the only thing going for it. Felt slick on the tongue.

Listen guys and gals. This is not such a terrible beer. It won’t put hair on your chest, but it is a Sleeman’s after all. Let’s get real here. A light taste to quench your thirst without the strong after taste. So here’s to you all as I take sip of my Sleeman’s Clear.
This beer was amazing. I would definately buy it again for .87$ USD, but I had to pay almost a dollar. Tased gud 2, had one wif mah grammah.
24oz can. Golden pour, thin white fizz. Chopped onion aroma, it will make you cry. Sulfuric Acid presence?? Some corn, some apple. Flavor of sweet fruits, some apple juice. Brutal! 14 march 09

Date: March 14, 2009 Mode: Bottle Source: Ticker Tasting Appearance: hazy dark yellow, fine white head, bits of drippy lace Aroma: light malt aroma, touch of cereal, light floral hops, mostly dry, bit of green apple Flavor: sweet apple flavor, touch of granny smith tartness, light cereal sweetness, light balancing bitterness Aroma: 3/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 3/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 6/20 Rating: 1.8/5.0 Drinkability: 4/10 Score: 4

Appearance: Pours a hazy, light orange-yellow body with a smallish, white head. Smell: The typical sweetish fetor of chemicals and adjuncts but kicked up the notches unknown. This is pretty poor even for a malt liquor. Taste: This is going to be an absolute struggle. Sweetish, harsh flavor of corn, rubbing alcohol, diesel, and the tears of sentient apples. The burn and palate grating mix of crude flavors only increases; unyielding until well beyond the perceived finish. Mouthfeel: Medium-thin body. Medium carbonation. Drinkability: Well, that was definitely horrendous. Why is it the worst beers come in such obscenely large doses?
wow. this is rough. gold with a large head. alcohol and white wine aroma. fire palate. paint thinner flavors with a twist of apple juice. ouch.
Sent to me as a Christmas Joke. From the can was sweet corn and booze. Awful tasting liquid as I am reluctant to call it beer.
Pours a fizzy crisp golden yellow. Aromas of corn, minor hopping, and not much else. Flavor is bland american lager with almost no hops.
This is actually the best tasting Camo variant I’ve had(which is not exactly a good thing). This one KIND OF tastes like beer, where as all the other Camos taste like fake whine.
Nutty, roasty, recommended! Very malty and good. A bit bitter in the finish. Not a bad effort. Seek this one out - it's seasonal.
The beer has got a deep clear amber color with a low head and medium body. Aroma of malt and fruits. Taste of hops, oranges, malt, bread. Mild finish.

3.9%ABV. Pilsner. Tapped out clear gold. 6ºSRM. Nose is beery with sweet pilsner malt aroma. Mouthfeel is beery and carbonated. Palate is pale malt. Hops are noble, woody. Finish is medium and noble hops

Part of a seasonal voyage platter at the Heartland Brewery and Chophouse, 43rd St, NYC. Pours clear amber with a small lasting white head. Very light aroma of orange, and hop. Light sweetness and bitterness. Thin body, above average carbonation. Drinkable but least favorite of the beers on the platter.
Fat @ Heartland, Empire State Bldg. Klar guldfärgad med ett generöst vitt skum. Dofter och smaker av lime, gräs och koriander. Fräsch men något anonym.
On tap at the brewpub. It poured a pale yellow color with a white head. The aroma was of citrus and wheat. The taste was similar to the aroma with more citrus, wheat and some coriander. Decent.
Aroma is on the sweeter side. Taste is light, but pleasant. Overall very drinkable.

On tap at Heartland, Empire State, NYC. A clear, golden beer with a dense, off-white head. The aroma is butterscotchy, on the corn-ish side, with some pear and generic fruityness in the back. There’s much less diacetyl in the flavor, it’s fruity and with a decent bitterness. Medium body, quite dry on the palate. Lasting bitter finish. Sort of refreshing this one, but not very good anyway. The orange blossoms and coriander weren’t detected. 150624

Pale gold beer with a weak white head. A light, slightly spicy malt led aroma with a hint of citrusy hop in the background. Medium dry mouthfeel. The taste starts off smooth and malty, some caramel and spice is followed by a zesty citrusy hop flavour that adds a bitterness to the finish. Draught @ Heartland Brewery, 8th St. New York.
Goldig, klar. Geruch malzig. Im Geschmack dann auch. Leicht restsüß. Kaum bitter, für ein leichtes aber sehr gut.
Schwacher heftiger und leicht malziger Geruch. Geschmack wie Spülwasser am Bierwagen: sehr dünn und wässrig. Vom Fass im Heartland Chophouse Times Square.

Sept, 2002: A Kenya beer that won a medal at the International Monde Awards. A strange dried yeast/elephant dung aroma rises from this anaemic coloured product, which doesn’t tempt, but does prepare one for the slightly unusual taste. It is a lager, but very dry and with a beer hoppiness. There is licorice, corn and honey flavours. Some gassiness. A warm after-taste that stops just short of spicy. An enjoyable and interesting drink, but not one that I’ll be trying again.
Unispiring other than a faint rye character. Other than that it is a rather flawless international lager.

dark mahagony clear liquid with white head. Aroma: roasted malts, caramel, Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, roasted malts, caramel. Palate: light body, creamy, average carbonation, long bready finish,
The beer as an aroma that is some where between beer and wine, with a mainly sweet taste and lightly bitter sub taste.
Clear dark brown color with thin white head. Taste are light roast malts with wanilla sugar. Aftertaste are roast malts with sugar. Its way over carboned and wattery
Clear dark appearancew with medium low head. Caramel and sweet aroma, very sweet taste. Average Dunkel.

Kaum darzustellen, wie eklig es ist. Vielleicht wäre die Beschreibung von Melasse und Zucker der beste Vergleich. Ekelhaft und eins der wenigen Biere, die ich nach dem ersten Schluck direkt weggekippt habe.

Pours out of the bottle in a deep dark colour with steady head and smooth body. Aroma of sugar and caramel mixed with malt. Taste of brown sugar, sweet malt, bread and grains. Very sweet overall - sticky, awful sweet. Not drinkable at all.

Sticky sweetness (flat cola notes evident, and this bottle isn’t that old--production date 2 months ago in Tatarstan), some toasted malt, almost bizarrely alkaline finish...that said, not terrible (I bet the earlier 6+ % abv version was better, but now it clocks in at 4.6% abv)

Clear malty flavor with a slightly burnt nuance and with elements of sweet syrup, fruit and wine. Despite the rather special taste it’s surprisingly pleasant. If you find it’s definitely worth testing!

500ml bottle (Rimi, Tallinn) Dark red, brief head. Understated malt aroma - some burntness. Rich toasted malt taste, yes it’s quite stout, but neither chocolatey nor coffee-like. Sticks to the tongue, so a roasted finish. Covers 6.5% very well, helped by a bit of sweetness.
bottled. purple coloured, soft texture, chocolate porridge aroma, quite tasty - ovaltine. much better than expected

Moving away from the Celtic connection with a picture of bags on the front, this new offering from the Norfolk microbrewery claims to be 'brewed smoother for a longer taste', a point worth debating. A slightly sour citrus fruit flavour dominates with a soon vanishing flowery hops bitterness in the aftertaste. There is a very mild malty sweetness in the background. Not an impressive beer at all - it is thin and undistinguished. Nothing stands out - even the sourness is rather shy. In the bag appears to be a good name if you consider that this is not a very bold beer, and is hiding everything away that makes a beer outstanding.

Les arômes de banane sont beaucoup trop présent, l’aspect visuel est top, malgré un manque sérieux de mousse, mais je n’ai pas eu l’impression de boire un me bière aromatisé mais plus du sirop de banane aromatisé à la bière
Glas geprobeerd bij Kim en Sander. Het is een troebel geel bier met weinig schuim. Het heeft een banaan achtige zoete geur. De smaak is zoet en bananenpuree achtig.

Bottle in Ethiopian restaurant in Amsterdam, server in a 'traditional' coconu bowl. This is one of the most terrible beer experiences I ever had. This is probably a mix of beer and an extract. The aroma isn't banana, but it smells like banana candies. Taste same; very sweet and very artificial. I could hardly finish the bottle.
Aus der Pulle. Riecht - was auch sonst - stark bananig. Der Antrunk ist sehr süß. Schmeckt wie diese Gellee-Bananen. Intensiv künstlich. Bier ist was anderes

Cerveza de color dorado, con una cabeza espumosa que se disipa en segundos. Aroma a plátano, un poco de almíbar y poco mas. En boca es levemente dulce y se siente el sabor del plátano pero en forma artificial.

The aroma of banana, lemonade duchess, candy barberry. Golden, transparent beer with a small white foam. Barberry, banana, duchess and small sweetness in taste. The body is medium, carbonation is low.

Der Name ist Programm. Das Bier hat einen deutlichen Geschmack nach Banane -und das passt auch. Es ist ein fein natürliches Aroma und schmeckt nicht komisch-chemisch. Die Fruchtaromen passen sich dem hopfigen Körper an. Ein spezielles Bier, das aber nicht schlecht ist.

Smell - quite strong, banana (duh), some candy, sweet. Foam - medium thick, to thin side, little little watery bit later, some banana notes. Taste - banana, synthetic banana, some weak bitterness, does not go together I think... Generally - nothing special, juicebeer.
Scent: Synthetic bananas Taste: Synthetic bananas, watery, exotic. Texture: Medium co2

Heavy artificial banana, bubblegum, yeast and gas. Bit hazy golden color with minimal sized white head. Sugar, heavy sweet taste, full of artificial flavors of banana and some golden ale like maltiness in the background. Ton of green apple, even feels like ultra sugary sweet cider at moments. Watery, soft carbonation. //bottle from Vrutak
16th July 2008. BBE Date of April 2008. Pours golden brown and cloudy. Dry and sour malt do battle with a dry hop finish/ Drinkable - just!
Bottle. Golden beer with a light head. The aroma is lightly hopped and caramel, and the flavour is gently bitter and slightly toffee’ish. Overall a fairly basic beer.
Bottle from Iceni Brewery, Ickburgh, Norfolk. Hazy gold with a large white head. Faint, sweet aroma. This has a pleasant sourness in the taste and enough bitterness to satisfy. Good.
From A Bottle.Cloudy amber with a small head,aroma of apples and peaches,taste is fruity,hoppy with a dry finish
Bottle. Quite flat and malty. Some light melony type flavours, with a touch of citrus, green hoppyness. Just felt a bit too thin, with a watery edge. I was a little dissapointed.

Pours with a giant white head which eventually settles into something more managable. I had two goes at this - first without the yeast sediment where it was crisp, clean, refreshing and slightly sweet; then with the yeast where it took on a slightly honey and leather tone. This is a lovely beer either way with a faint orange perfume, a twist of lemon in the taste, and a mild bitterness in the finish.
Bottle. Extremely bitter dark chocolate beer with burnt malty taste. More like a stout. Rather flat bottle. (2008)

50cl bottle from Bacchanalia, Cambridge. Black with a tawny tint and fast fading beige head; rich chocolate malt aroma; sweet oaty flavour to start, with a burst of tart fruit, and then a milky sweetness from the roasted malts; dry and somewhat chalky finish - reminds me of a milk stout. Very pleasant.
Bottle at home ... not at its best im sure ... Deep red ... Sweet blackcurrent malt ... Initial, fruity malt him followed quickly with off sourness... Some nice roast maltshidden in the sourtinge .

A dark, chocolate brown, rather flat beer. A very light toasted malt nose, with a slight hint of fruit. A very light bodied beer, with an initial sweet malty taste, there is a hint of fruit again, and the finish is light hoppy, slightly dry. (Bottle - Purchased from the Brewery’s stall @ King’s Lynn’s Farmers Market).
Dark almost like a stout. Plenty of complexity and body for its 3.6 strength. A pleasant mild.Well done Iceni for bottling it.

Bottle from Rai Wines, Birmingham. Jet black, with a beige head. Strong, sweet roast aroma: delicious! Very good mouthfeel - soft, rounded. Flavouring: sweet fruit and jam notes, plummy finish. Interesting citrus specks amongst some vaguely cakey choc moments. Not harsh, but a firm flavour, with some coco. For 3.6% this has unbelievable depth and balance. Superb bottled Mild. Superb!

Bottle.Black in colour with a small head,aroma is of blackberry,sour damp shed,coffee and old red wine,taste has a great hedgerow sourness with bitter chocolate,oak and blackcurrant,woodsy and earthy with a tarty dry finish,the air when it rains,you are summin else.
Cask Conditioned, at the Wenlock Arms, London. Dark brown with no head. Thin and a bit dull looking. Maltish aroma. Dull stagnant pond water flavour. Washed out and even too thin for a mild.

"Brewed on the edge of Thetford Forest" this is a great roasty, toasty mild full of twigs and hedgehogs and things that crawl and hoot and peer at you through the gloom. Boiled in a witches' cauldron with dark satanic fruits, then spiced with roots of licorice and the peel of lemons, this is a refreshing burst of flavours - perfect for an autumn or winter lunch-time drink.
Indertijd wel vaker op fles. Jammer dat de brouwer niet meer bestaat; zeker het pils was prima van smaak. Super was tikkie zoetig
Volgens mij was dit een dortmunder. Erg lang geleden dat ik dit gedronken . Was lekker, leek wel een beetje op Gulpener Dort. Jammer dat het niet meer gebrouwen wordt.
Средний карибский лагер. Нашел случайно в Сент Киттс и Невис бутылку и закончил с Южной Америкой
Butelka 0,33l alk.5%, piana słaba, szybko opada, kolor jasno słomkowy.Aromat lekko chmielowy z nutą traw. Lekko słodowe, typowy lager z Mezoameryki.
Bottle Brandsville Hotel, Georgetown, Guyana. Pours pale yellow with thin white head. Light bodied. Fairly complex taste. Some sweetness. Quite pleasant.

Pours yellow and fizzy with a decent frothy white head. Smells soapy and earthy with some perfumy hoppy touches. Tastes sweet and dry if that makes sense with some peppery splashes. A hint of bitterness emerges as the beer warms. A decent lawnmower brew.

Had this in Guyana--this is actually a decent beer, especially given it’s the only beer made in this country generally short on resources. It’s fresh and light (what I like when I’m in the deep tropics) but yet reasonably flavorful.

Cool, straight from Guyana, which I thought was an African country. Man, I’m ignorant. Anyway, Pale golden straw color, light fizzy white head. Light hint of grass and a sweetish malt nose. The body is spritzy with a light hop notion towards the back. Not sweet and not unpleasant, very standard international lager with a touch of roasty hops.
pale golden colour, fruity nose, fresh, some acidity .......................

Pours a light caramel-amber into the glass, with an initially eggshell soapy head that diminishes to trace lacing. The nose is of citrus, orange, circus peanuts and grain/spruce-pine/grassy notes. Flavors of caramel, candied oranges and alcohol notes, finishing with a peppering piney bitter. A bit boozy and sticky to the palate, this full-bodied offering is not the best example of the style, but respectable enough to be decent.
On tap at Capone’s. Poured a golden color with a smaller sized head. Some toastiness, caramel, and some fruits.

Draft at ABC’s Gettysburg Gateway location. Served in a pint glass, light coppery-brown color with thin white head. Aroma of heavy caramel malt sweetness, nuttiness, toast and earthy/fruity hops. Taste is the aroma notes toned down. Light body, moderate carbonation, crisp with clean finish. Pretty tasty lager.
This is one of my favorite Maibocks. Really enjoy the slight alcohol warmth and sweetness from the malts.

Copper, sweet malty aroma. Soft, creamy with good German hop character with very notable caramel sweetness. A little light, even for a lager lacking some of the body and flavor I would hope. Overall pretty enjoyable.

Bomber from State Line. Pours a clear amber color with a thin head that quickly fades. Big caramel aroma with stone fruits, faint tannins and a bit of toastiness. The taste is caramel, grain, toasted malts and mild hops. Medium bodied and pretty drinkable. Decent beer.

22 ounce bottle. Bright deep gold color topped by a small rocky white head. Fresh toasted malt nose hints at caramel and nuts. some grassy hops, too. Bittersweet spicy malt tastes of black pepper and cardamom. Nice subtle herbal hops creep up in finish. Creamy mouthfeel. Good overall flavor.

Sample on draft this beer poured a dark caramel color with a small foamy white head that faded quickly and left a bit of lacing. The aroma was sweetish table sugar and light golden fruits. The flavor was table sugar, golden raisins, pear, apple, bread and a light boozy presence that worked well. The finish was long and tangy with lingering table sugar and golden raisins. Fairly full bodied. Solid.

Not a bad maibock, but not one of the best I’ve tasted. The color is a dark golden hue, but the beer doesn’t carry much of a head. The nose is mostly of a caramel and bready malt. The body is smooth and very drinkable. I got some bready and malty flavors, along with some slight hoppiness in the finish.

Amber color with a small, off white head that left no lacing on the glass. Aroma of honey, caramel, toast, and alcohol. Taste was sweet, honey and caramel, with toasted dough, some citrus, and strong alcohol.

column1: Höss Allgauer Öko Bier Helles Vollbier
column5: Bière à l’allemande, très aqueuse, de couleur jaune pâle et avec une mise tes blanche. Idéale pour se désaltérer les de grandes chaleurs.

column1: Höss Allgauer Öko Bier Helles Vollbier
column5: Bottle @ Getränke Winkler, Traunstein. Pours clear golden with a white head. Skunky vegetables and plastic. Rotten eggs and paperbag. Waauw!

column1: Höss Allgauer Öko Bier Helles Vollbier
column5: Simples Helles ohne Besonderheiten. Leicht muffig mit etwas Heu und Zucker. Nicht ganz einfach zu trinken und gar etwas derb.

column1: Höss Allgauer Öko Bier Helles Vollbier
column5: Pours out of the bottle in a clear golden colour with airy steady head and medium body. Aroma of hops and straw. Taste of mild hops, grass, citrus, apples and straw. Grainy finish. Not that nice to drink - rather average and boring.

column1: Höss Allgauer Öko Bier Helles Vollbier
column5: Bottle 50 cl. Light golden pour with a small white head. Malty aroma and flavor with a hint of something citrus.

column1: Höss Allgauer Öko Bier Helles Vollbier
column5: Pours a clear golden yellow color. Aromas of grass, cheerios, and a touch of flowers. Flavor is kinda sweet to start, citrusy finish with some hop notes.

column1: Höss Allgauer Öko Bier Helles Vollbier
column5: bottle 0.5l labeled as Helles Export, with 5.2%abv. nice looking brew. juniperberries and musky nose. tastes also musky with juniperberries, little sweet and a little bitter. fruity, fresh and crisp finish. only disappointment is it’s body which is a little watery and thin especialy when warming up. overall decent.

column1: Höss Allgauer Öko Bier Helles Vollbier
column5: (bottle) Clear and pale golden colour with a foamy white medium head. Malty and doughy aroma with wet hay and a dense fruity note. Smooth mouthfeel with a moderately sweet malty taste, slightly fruity and a crispy light bitter finish. Decent and refreshing Helles.

column1: Höss Allgauer Öko Bier Helles Vollbier
column5: Bottle. (Ökobier Helles Export, 5.2%). Golden colour, looks still. Malty flavour, a little citric. Drinkable, but not very interesting.

column1: Höss Allgauer Öko Bier Helles Vollbier
column5: Mostly pilznerlike, very easy to drink. A beer to drink for thirst. It is not a mindblowing experience, but it is not a bad beer either.....
Aroma is heavy on the nectar. Mild carbonation, any aftertaste fades quickly, peach flavor is very natural, not syrupy or artificial.
8.4 fl oz bottle. Pours pale orange with no head. Aroma is peachy and dry acidic. Dry, flat malty and slight acidci with a peach flavour swept through. No sweetness. Ends dry and peach flavoured.

(bottle at Sun Devil). Pours like a peach colored wine with a thin white head. Aroma of dried fruit and somewhat mediciney. Taste is sourish with some sweet, but not as sweet as I thought it would be. Medium bodied with thin texture. Ok beer, but not sour enough and not one I would get again.

I’ll be the first to admit that I was probably way too kind to this one. I’ve had much better lambics, but for some reason I rated this one higher than I should have. Smooth lambic along the lines of Lindemans. A little too sugary. Rated 10/8/04 Originally 4.5

I’ve had this in my beer fridge for over a year, not too excited to crack it. Pours a flaccid hazy honey gold with a thin foamy head that vanishes quickly. Not a good start. The nose is nice enough-- peach juice (not candy) with a firm lactic yogurty aroma and subtle musty yeast. This is not the same disgusting candy cooler pseudo-lambic a-la-Melbourne Bros. (although theirs is apricot). Sour peach schnapps flavour, with an acidic lactic tartness in the finish. Again, there are strong lactic undertones here adding complexity. The acidity leads to a dry finish. I am pleasantly surprised!
Aroma and flavor were more apricot than peach. A little too sweet for my tastes. Thin finish with some alcohol. Wouldn’t try again.

Bottle. Great aroma, just as the name says. its peach and very appealing. The appearance doesn’t really appeal to me, a little like dirty washing water. Thin lace around the glass. Flavour of peach, alcoholic notes, sweet bitter finish. a little thin. Very much like a cider Not my cup of tea and my first Peach beer.

Pretty poor lambic actually. And it upsets me because this style gets a bad rap. I didn’t like the aroma, smelled like fake apricot. Flavor was weird, like sweetened peach ice tea. Absolutely zero finish. A bad example of a good style.

Date: 01/19/2003 Mode: Bottle Source: Murfreesboro clear liguid gold, wonderful sweet aroma of peaches and apracot, light, dry, tart, flavor is too subtle and does not live up to the aroma, Aroma: 8/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.9/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.
Orange with some bubbles. Very sweet aroma of candied peaches. Sweet sugary peach flavor. Not so bad for something so sweet, but it needs more lambic and less sugar.

Herber Antrunk, leicht malziger Abgang. Ich wurde von meinem Vater gewarnt das dieses Bier scheiße schmeckt und einen übelen Kater verursacht. Naja ich finde es schmeckt ganz normal, erinnert etwas an Warsteiner. Fazit: Typisches Pils, nicht gut und nicht schlecht - kann man trinken, ist aber kein Spitzenbier!

Pale yellow color with a very thin white head that quickly fade out. Aroma is grainy and malty, too weak. Flavor is like aroma but more watery. Low to medium carbonation and light body with a light bitter finish.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein klares goldgelbes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hopfig, getreidig, grasig. Geschmack hopfig, grasig, lang anhaltende Bitterkeit.

50 cl Swing-top bottle. Pale golden in the glass, nice white head. Bready-pils-typical aroma. The beer starts nice aromatic, not too sweet, but nice balanced. The mainpart gets a bit sweeter, but still bittering hops are noticeable. Full bodied. The grainy-malty aroma is still there, but fits in well. The aftertaste is slightly sweet, nicely bitter, but still a bit too bready. --> in the swing-top bottle much better than the crown-top version - or they’ve changed their recipe - I remember the latter one being disgusting… --> 12/13/12/12 Old rating from the crown-top bottle: Der Geruch ist süßlich laff. Im Geschmack ist es auch nicht wirklich überzeugend: es ist zwar frisch-hopfig und kaum herb, allerdings total neutral-laff, aber ohne wirklich wässrig zu wirken. --> ziemlich laffes Bier ohne Tiefen Test vom 9.1.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 12,6,9,6,12,6 - 7,35
Bottle shared with McTapps. Interesting pilsner which comes quite quaffy with a decent malty aroma. Definitely a mild surprise as I expected a very bitter end. Nice.

Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. So I don’t really am a big fan of CGP but this one really is enjoyable. The bottle design is different than in the picture, the new label design is more classy and posh. Deep golden in colour, low head, smooth head and no real carbonation. Taste of mild but strong hops, green apples, ripe grains and summer. There is no bitterness at all and so quaffable. Very easy to drink. --- Test from 14th Januar 2013.

On tap at a hotel in Willebadessen. Clear yello colour with a small white head. grainy aroma, also in the taste grains, some grass, faint bitterness and a bit sourish aftertaste. Normal pisener, 1 in 1000.
Typical german pilsener with a very bad after taste. Ordered this in a bar in germany.

#1064 Dieses Bier ist wirklich übel! Noch bitterer geht kaum und die Süffigkeit beträgt gleich 0 auch aufgrund eines fiesen Beigeschmacks nach Radiergummi. Test vom 8.9.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 9,8,3,3,6,3 - 4,50
Not very impressive as far as body or flavor. This brew was lightly carbinated and bitter.
Can 0,33l. Pours a clear gold with a off white foam. Aroma of malts and corn. Same for taste. Watery. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
09.09.2006. 0,33l Bottle. Golden yellow colour with white head. Malty aroma with moderate bitterness.
Clear golden with large white head. Sweet and somewhat malty aroma with caramel notes. Flavour is sweet with malt and caramel notes. Somewhat grainy. Finished sweet. Not bad.
33cl bottle: Clear gold with a off white foam. Sweet nose & taste with lots of grain & corn. Nearly sour & watery. Not good!
Aarhus, DK. Bottled Not even alcoholic, Week and low on everything: Hops, malt, yeast
Light golden with a weak head. Both aroma and flavour are sweetish with notes of wet grain, corn and a bit of malt. It’s weak, thin and very boring - but not inoffensive.
A too bright yellow colour not proper to a gold beer, with a minor mostly diminishing white head. Aroma of malt and hobs. But nothing special..
Clear golden colour, very small white head. Sweet malty aroma. Rather thin flavor with sweet sugar. The aftertaste is very thin and watery.
Bottle. Yellow colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of malt and hops.
33 cL bottle. Pours pale yellow with a quickly disappearing white head. Slight sweet malty and grainy aroma. Sweet and soft malt flavour. Soft and sweet finish. Only a vague bitterness.

column2: Banmai, Mueang, Pathum Thani Province, Thailand
column5: 02.01.2019, a bottle at Naiyang Beach, Phuket. Aroma: fresh and yeasty. Appearance: clear pale amber, minimal lacing. Palate: light-bodied and rather watery. Practically flat, slightly bitter at the finish. Taste: lightly bitter, a pronounced flavour of caramel. Totally lifeless, though interesting taste, maybe a dud bottle. The label is beautiful, a hornbill perhaps?

column2: Banmai, Mueang, Pathum Thani Province, Thailand
column5: Just typical Asian light lager. I only wish local breweries try something else beside lager beer to compete with big Thai beers,!like Singha or Chang beers. Make me feel this is just the same or worse.

column2: Banmai, Mueang, Pathum Thani Province, Thailand
column5: Bottle. Pours a clear golden yellow with a quickly fading off white bubbly head. Notes of cereal, grassy, citrus, butterscotch. Watery to oily mouthfeel, soft to medium carbonation.

column2: Banmai, Mueang, Pathum Thani Province, Thailand
column5: From a 33 cl bottle courtesy of Deanso. It is a clear effervescent pale golden color wirh a white head. The aroma is malty and the taste is sweet malty flavor with a shock of a bitterness

column2: Banmai, Mueang, Pathum Thani Province, Thailand
column5: From a 33 cl bottle courtesy of Deanso. Pours a clear pale gold wirh a white head. Aroma of bread dough. Flavors are sweet malt. Okay.

column2: Banmai, Mueang, Pathum Thani Province, Thailand
column5: Bottle on the Khao San Road. I had 3 weeks of fizzy, “lager beer”, this was the best one I found!

column2: Banmai, Mueang, Pathum Thani Province, Thailand
column5: Can from Lub d Patong, drank from a can. Looks probably fizzy and yellow, that I can deduct already from the first sip. Aroma is somewhat grainy, light acidity there. Pretty much same as much going on in the taste. Not particularly interesting but medium boded, some sweetness and not that hoppy or bitter. OK overall, I guess - just another Asian lager.

column2: Banmai, Mueang, Pathum Thani Province, Thailand
column5: 330ml green bottle, filtered, from Beers Of Europe. This is harmless and drinkable. Quite nice. It's a typical global pale lager, so there's no character, but there's no nasty or off flavours either. It'll quench your thirst. It's OK.

column2: Banmai, Mueang, Pathum Thani Province, Thailand
column5: Large bottle in Bangkok. Pours a dark gold with a slight head. Aroma of malt, grain. Taste of rice, malt, some sweetness. Slightly different to the usual Thai macros but still disappointing.

column2: Banmai, Mueang, Pathum Thani Province, Thailand
column5: 330ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Brewed in Cambodia. Pours dark gold with a small white head. Aroma is rice, butterscotch, grain. Taste is light sweet, rice, caramel.

column2: Banmai, Mueang, Pathum Thani Province, Thailand
column5: Bottle. I finally found this beer in Phucket, Thailand. I looked all over Bangkok and Chiang Mai to no avail. I bought a big bottle. It was a rich brown with a light brown head. The label said it was a "Black Lager." There was a dry nutty flavor. It was a welcome relief from other Thai beers.
Gyllene i färgen vitt skum. Doftar alkohol och söt malt, majs och vått gräs. Smakar sött alkohol, sur malt. metallisk eftersmak med alkohol.
Can gift from Thailand. Dark yellow color with fruity aroma. Taste is sweet, with tones of metal with strong alcohol feel.
Can. Pours a clear golden colour with a medium rather short lasting white head. Grainy bit sweet aroma with corn. Sweetish grainy and bit maltish flavour with a bitterish grainy finish. Served cold.

33 cL can. Pours clear yellow with a huge white head. Sweet cereal aroma. Quite sweet flavour, not cloyingly sweet but just more than average. Has a minor artificial note. No real bitterness nor malt flavour. Mild finish. Strange brew, not in anyway offensive though.

Canned (thanks tbone_!). Yellow colour, big foamy white head, which disappears quite fast. Hay, sweet maize and some malty hints in aroma. Flavour is sweet maize, hay and alcohol. The alcohol is a lucky thing in this beer, as I feel it hides all the horrors in beneath...
Can (filled 06/2006) Golden color, foamy white head. Corn-like sweetish and papery aroma. Starts sweetish with weak grassy hops. Finishing to alcoholic punch. Unbalanced tropical lager.

(Can) Mild, slightly pungent aroma of fruits, malt and maize (corn). Huge, a bit creamy, white, slightly lasting head with good lacing. Pale yellow colour and clear (some very tiny particles). Fruity and malty flavour. Metallic, softly carbonated, slightly alcoholic and light to medium-bodied palate. 30/12/06
Can. Pale yellow colour with a small off-white head. Sweet malty aroma. Very sweet malty flavor with lots of alcohol. Very sweet malty finish. Too sweet for me.
more alcohol then necessary here, and you know it, i guess that is why it falls into the malt liquor genre. malty sweet slight alcohol ember. not good.

This beer is an attempt at cashing in on Thaksin’s Thai nationalistic fervor. Thai beer spelled in the Thai alphabet aimed at Khun Thai, whoopee! This is basically crap. Even the lousy Bier Sing in Thailand is better than this crap. The cash in on brainless nationalism is only trumped by Carabao’s adverts for its energy drinks. I would only drink if held in the Bangkok Hilton prison.
330 Bottle, Mikumi Lodge, Tanzania. Too sweet, water, wrong taste. As far as I remember, the only one beer I could not drink so far.
A: Clear gold with a small white head. N: Faint hint of pale malt T: Faint malty profile with a hint of bitterness. P: Thin O: Standard light lager.

0,375l from bottle. Light yellow, small white head. Smells peppery, tobacco, earthy, grains. Average smell. Medium body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. Tastes grainy, earthy, tobacco, light malty backbone, bit nutty, bit watery. Finishes lightly bitter with notes of tobacco, grains and light marzipan notes. Ok overall 5, 3, 5, 3, 10

2019-01-17. Pale yellow body, small quick off-white head. Aroma has rough grassy skunk character. Flavour is similarly harsh. Average to light bodied palate, moderate carbonation. Thanks green bottle! 3/3/3/2/6 Bottle shared by fiulijn at mcberko's.
Courtesy of Maureen Pale blond colour. The smell is quite grainy. The flavour is rather skunky.

375ml bottle @ Matt's. Pours a clear golden colour with a small white head. Nose is very skunky and vegetal. Flavour is not drinkable skunky vegetables. Light bodied, light carbonation, and a mild sweetness. Wow, this is not good.
375ml bottle at Matt's. Appearence: clear golden Aroma: bready malt with hops Taste: similar Overall: meh
Skunky, but a green bottle so expected. Clear gold with a small white head. Paper and some sweetness.

375mL bottle, pours a clear pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma is very skunky, with lots of skunk cabbage, vegetables, and some straw. Flavour doesn't even any redeeming qualities -- tons of skunk cabbage; that's it. Putrid stuff.
Light amber, bit hazy/murky. Not much head. Malt-ish, some lighter grassy hop notes and light bitterness. Finishes more on the sticky-sweet side, though.
The beer of Tanganjika region; "our beer, our taste". Full and balanced lager taste, no bitterness at all, enjoyable even warm!

I guess the major selling point for this one is its alcohol content, but otherwise it’s just a low qualtiy lager. Scent of alcohol and malt, taste of syrupiness and alcohol, not much head. Kind of okay if you want to get trashed, but basically it’s a Tanzanian malt liquor.
A hopps beer that will get you trashed nicely of seven or eight with a percentage of 8. A strong beer.

After living for a while in Zambia, I came to appreciate the Rhino. It’s actually almost drinkable when it’s cold, providing you aren’t too into things like hops, aroma, flavor, mouthfeel..., and the hangovers aren’t nearly as bad as what you’ll get from Eagle. It tends to keep longer than Mosi, meaning you are more likely to avoid that Africa skunky/pee flavor... and you’ll get hipster points for choosing something other than the over-advertised Mosi. At its best, you can almost fool yourself into thinking you’re drinking PBR. Goes pretty well with putrid Zambian cigarettes. This was actually my first choice in Zambian beer... providing it was cold.
High carbonation and head retention. Pale straw colour, light flower hop and grain aromas light pleasent flavour, though corn comes trhough and a few other fermentation issues like diacetyl.
Bottle brought back from L.A. Pale yellow colour, medium white head. Aroma of hay and grass. Thin, carbonated, not very nice.

12 oz. Clear, golden with a lasting quarter inch of creamy foam. Nose of burnt tire, honey, and scorched grain. Taste is the same as the aroma, but the skunky tire fades after a short while, so it gets a little higher mark. Light medium body is fairly smooth with carbonation and to the sweetish side, but well balanced. Seems as though it may be better than I expected, and if it wasn’t skunked and scorched, buttered popcorn it would be a pretty damn good lager.

Clear bottle from a Save-Mart. Pours very pale gold with a creamy/bubbly white head. Light skunky aroma. Flavor is quite bready, tho not in a heavy way, and there’s a lot of noble hop. Barring the skunk it would be pretty decent for a pale lager.

Clear yellow, loose white head. Aroma is OH GOD, THE STANK! THE STAAAAAAAAAANK! DEAR LORD, THAT"S BAD! OH GOD NO! Also, tastes bad, too. I swear, this is the first time I’ve ever tasted chlorine in a beer...

Lucent straw, thin lasting white head, thin body, high co2. Aroma: very skunk cabbage. Taste: sweet pale malt, roasted corn, mild vegetal bitterness, skunk cabbage, carbonic acid. I’m surprised there’s even enough hops in here to get this much skunky light-struck flavor. If i was hosting a class on beer off-flavors, this would be my prime example of what happens to pale lagers in clear bottles that orbit the sun a few times on their way to my house.
Yellow. Corn and light honeyed malts in the nose. Flavoris clean and eatery but the finish is metallic. Not good.

Light clear yellow pour with a tiny white head. Scent is corn, cereal and musty. Taste is carbonated corn and this time of year might not be bad but there is a metal hint in the after taste that I do not care for...

I just got a whole bunch of "Beers of the World" as a gift, and damned if I’m not going to rate these fairly. Pale Lagers get a bad rap here, and they take a ratings hit just because they are PALE LAGERS. Granted, I am no fan of this beer - but I am going to rate it as if it were any other style I just didn’t like. That includes Golden Ales, Lagers and Berlinnerweisses. Anyway, this stuf smells a little skunky - probably because of the bottle. But to be honest, I was surprised it wasn’t MORE skunky. Clear bottle - hello? Anway, the beer itself pours a golden clear, with a piss yellow hue. Right off the bat, this stuff is very buttery aka full of diactyl. Goes too slow on the tongue. Notes of some rotting fruit and a little banana. Finishes cloying. AT the same time, better than Corona. Would go well with a lime to help make it less viscous.
Tried a sample at Brewfest Tallahassee. Oh boy. Why would somebody copy Corona and make it worse? Skunk and corn. Disgusting.

Bottle… Clear, straw-colored lager with a small, fizzy, white head. The aroma is pure skunk – my wife smelled it from across the kitchen – with a little lemon thrown in. Light to medium-bodied with a slick mouthfeel and tingly carbonation. The flavor is actually pleasant, much to my surprise. Trends toward the sweet side of balance, but offers light acidity and mild bitterness. Crisp, clean finish.

column1: Haldemann Bière de Vully Helles / Blonde
column5: Goldig, sehr klar, angemessener schaum, leichte süsse und malzig im aroma, antrunk süsslich, minim honig, ganz leichte bittere, angenehme rezenz, süffig ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column1: Haldemann Bière de Vully Helles / Blonde
column5: straw color, not much head(white). smells of malt,floral, honey-like hint. tasts malty, floral, like some honey, some bitterness. aftertaste has some bitterness andherbs, and honey.

column1: Haldemann Bière de Vully Helles / Blonde
column5: Bottled. Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is sweet malts, mild notes of bread, some honey and grass. Flavour is grassy, hoppy and overall quite dryish. Some mild notes of wood in the finish.

column1: Haldemann Bière de Vully Helles / Blonde
column5: Bottled, thanks Bov! Lightly hazy golden, small head. Perfumy jelly aroma. Sweet and light boded, crist and spicy with some cinnamon. Low bitterness. If it wasn’t for the strong jelly flavour it’d be way more pleasant.

column1: Haldemann Bière de Vully Helles / Blonde
column5: Tap @ Master brewery pub, Folkestone (UK). I’m not sure which Haldemann I had, but it was lager/pilsener like and this is the only one not retired. Aroma of skunky hops. Clear, golden-yellow coloured with a thin, white head. Taste is crisp, thin, watery. It has skunky hops and a little malitiness.

column1: Haldemann Bière de Vully Helles / Blonde
column5:
clear golden colour with a solid white foam, nice lace, subtle herbal aroma with a touch of butter and dust, creamy mouthfeel, medium-bodied and with a low bitterness, papery and slightly herbal finish - easy and definitely not what it was 5 years ago

3/2003 - golden colour, light cloudy, few head, strong herbal and spices aroma with notes of butter, medium-bodied with a very long herbal finish - strong character - 4/7/7/4/15

column1: Haldemann Bière de Vully Helles / Blonde
column5: 2009-04-04, draught at the brewery, 6-3-6-2-11=28 Hazy blond color; persistent creamy head. Light hop and malt aroma. Dryish mouthfeel, light malt flavor, correct bitterness, but missing better crispy malt and better aromatic hop, so that it can result being boring. 2002-05-15, draught at the brewery, 9-5-7-3-14=38 Blond lager, generous head. Wonderful hop aroma. Good mix of malt and hop, dry, enough body, a bit metallic. Ordinary palate, medium aromatic.

[Rerate] Very good malt and hop, yet less impressive than the Dunkles; the body has still some sweetness (compared to many other dryer lagers). It's the "beer for everybody" of the brewery, and one of the best as such. [16-05-2002, 9-4-7-4-14] Blond lager. Very nice hop aroma, malt, lightly fruity, light apricot. Good malt taste, nice hop, a bit astringent, less metallic than "Bière de Vully". Quite good palate, not too much aromatic. Beers of Switzerland
bread, dough, banana, floral, golden, hazy, frothy, medium sweetness, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, lively,

Biertage 2005, 5,7% - reddish orange colour, little unregular foam, strong aroma of matured banans, very sweet with a high carbonation, long banana finish with a residual sweetness - ok but still not my kind of beer (7/4/6/3/11) Biertage 2004 - cloudy dark-orange colour, fine head, strong corny aroma with notes of matured bananas, very (too?) sweet, a bit oily, the finish is moderately malty with reminiscence of banana - not bad at all though a bit cloying

2009-04-04, draught at the brewery, 7-4-6-2-11=30 Cloudy blondcolor; big creamy head; very nice perlage. The aroma is both fruity (banana) and spicy. The mouthfeel is not very strong, there is some wheat character and some spices, a good hopping for a Weizen, but less interesting than it used to be. The final is quite boring. 2002-05-16, draught at the brewery, 7-4-8-4-15=38 Gold wheat ale. Nice aroma, sweet, spicy (cloves). Nice malt taste, good mouth, spices; a little too much carbonation. Also good hoppy finish. Atypical wheat beer, far better than the Swiss average.

draught at the Biertage 2005, 5.7% - black coloured, almost no foam, strong nose of licorice and juniper, good malt body, a bit oily, robust and slightly dry malty and fruity finish (7/4/6/3/14) march 2003 at the brewery - 4 years old bottle with stronger alc. content - reddish-brown, dense creamy head and beautiful lace, complex nose of juniper and chocolate, full-bodied, long bitter chocolate and plum finish - deeply balanced

Amber lager, thick and generous head; brewed with juniper. Nice hop aroma. Good body, perfect balance of sweetness and bitterness, good malt, quite evident caramel, the juniper can be perceived in the background; then the bitterness of the hop (>34IBU) and the roasted malt get ahead, to a strong and persistent finish. Beers of Switzerland

brownish beer with a reddish gloom and an offwhite head smooth carbonation smells of malt and some caramel and a bit honeylike tasts malty and has a floralness that remains me of chestnut-flowers-honey and caramel, some fruitt aftertaste good maltyness
amber colour, fine head, caramel aroma, some flowery and fruity notes, medium-bodied, well-hopped, sweet with a robust bitterness, dry malty finish - not really true to the style but very nice anyway

[Rerate] This beer has been improved a lot, becoming a real homebrewing masterpiece. Cloudy amber colour, with a generous, wonderful head and lace. Very nice hop aroma, a bit fruity, and also a very nice malt. The mouth feeling is lower than the aroma, dry taste, in the beginning; then it improves a lot (getting warmer), with a very good malt texture, some caramel and enough residual sweetness. [16-05-2002, 7-5-7-4-14] Orange colour lager, misty. Very nice hop aroma. Nice malt and hop in the mouth, with a good finish; classic style. Beers of Switzerland
dark black colour, nice creamy, dense head, subtle coffee aroma, toasted, smooth, nice bitter chocolate finish - well-made

[Rerate] Recently brewed with top fermenting yeast. Hazy dark amber colour, with a generous head, reducing to a thin collar, persistent. Very good malt and hop aromas and flavours, but with a metallic note, which lowers a bit the final evaluation. Final very strong and good as usual. [16-05-2002, 5-5-7-4-14] Red-amber 'lager'. Ordinary aroma. Good roasted barley; dryer than the other beers by the same brewery; the balance is reached in the end. Dry-bitter palate, quite strong. Beers of Switzerland
Gold lager (dunkelblond). Wonderful hop aroma, lightly floreal and fruity. Nice malt, poor hop. Ordinary finish. Beers of Switzerland
Pours clear pale golden with a three finger, white head. Aroma is light caramel and Saaz hops. Taste is light caramel, moving to strong Saaz hops. Finish is hoppy. A hoppy pils.
Grassy hops, grainy malt, and that German yeast flavor. Clean, effervescent, a solid pilsner.

Pours light golden with a thick white head. Aroma of sweet malt and light hops. Taste has light grass notes on the hops along with bread elements. Pilsen malt toasted notes on the palate. Great pilsener.
Enjoyable pils. Bready, some herbal, grassy. Medium bodied but very drinkable was
Bottle. Pours light gold with thin white head. Light cracker malt aroma. Light cracker malt and some floral hops. Light body.

Bottle. Hazy golden beer with a large white head. Aroma is malty with notes of citrus, bread, grass, herbs and spices. Flavor is spicy with notes of citrus, bread, herbs, grass and hay. Well balanced.

Poured golden, almost sunshine, yellow. Smells very much like I expect a Pils to, slight hops. Taste is crisp with a pleasant bite. Definitely a light, summer pils but nothing extraordinary. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle - from sampler pack. Light in color, clear. Light, hoppy aroma. Pretty good - decent hop flavor, not strong. About as session-y a beer as I can enjoy.

Sometimes I wish the purists would lay off the summer sessions. These are brewed with the notion that those who drink them are doing so after cutting the grass, going for a long run, or otherwise working up a sweat. At 4.5% this one is not going to ruin the next day. Pored into a Pilsener glass. Not much retention, very clear. Good aroma and nice finish. All in all a great beer for me to dink while sitting around the pool, after yard work, or any other sweaty endeavor. Cheers!
Not a bad lighter beer. Not as strong as I like but shouldn't expect much with a pilsner. Would probably buy for an all day beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap. Comes a clear pale gold with an average white head. Mild aroma and taste of malt, grain (corn), and lemon. Drinkable.

On tap at Gluek. Pours a clear light gold with a white head that dissipates quickly and completely. Aroma has earthy notes of biscuit and grain with a hint of straw. Flavor is similar with earthy bread and musty grain as well as a hint of straw.
You know, it’s not a great beer, but I’m always surprised at how Gluek makes such cheap beer that’s actually drinkable.
Wow, bad even for glueks. At this point, buy their red bock, or pony up the extra cash to get some Bud. Thouroghly undrinkable.

Only slightly better than the other gluek offerings and this is only due to the fact that it doesn’t piss me off quite as much as the others when I drink it. The flavor is still awful yet minimal so again, people, read the ratings before you buy this. Don’t think that this is a good beer by any style.
Fruity, pale, weak, wattery, all words that come to mind when drinking this. Only had it because of the price and homeland pride. Probably wont get it again.

12oz can. Pours an extremely pale hay color with a fairly nice white head. Aroma is light and sweet, with a fruity lemon scent alongside a bit of grain and malt. Body is light and dry, with a very neutral flavor yielding just the slightest hints of citrus, grain, and malt and a slightly off aftertaste. Very...uh...cheap?

A pale yellow appearance with a small white head. The aroma is very faint with some corn and lemons. The flavor is a bit on the dry side with some lemons, hay, and corn. Overall not too much going on here but not offensive either.

I wish I could rate this beer lower. I was challenged by a brew friend to find the worst beer commercially available. I thought I had won with the Stite Light Lager which was worse than the Lawson Creek Vanilla Stout. Nope, she beat the pant off of me with this beer. Can you say oxidized buttered blood sausage. The three worst beers I have rated are from this brewery. I am no longer falling victim to their cunning marketing schemes.

Canned. Pale straw body with a quickly fading bright white head. The aroma is grainy corn with some cherry syrup. There is also a little bit of buckwheat pancakes. The taste has glazed donuts with some apple chips. However, the finish is strangely metallic with some muted corn chips. Not as bad as some of Gluek’s other pale lagers.

Minimal nose, I swear, they must intentionally make their beer smell like nothing at this place. I was hoping for something that would be like their Vanilla Stout, the only good beer in the house, but this stuff failed. Quite weak, thin, and watery, this stout should be ashamed of itself.

Citrus (lemon) but bit soapy aroma. Light amber color, white rocky head that diminishes fast, some lace. Not a bad brew but not interesting as well. Light sweet, some citrus, nicely hopped. Sparkling finish.
Quite a smooth, rich taste with backbone of silky malt (pretentious as that sounds). Overall a very satisfying beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On cask at the Haymarket. Appearance - golden amber with a decent head. Slight haze. Nose - toffee and more toffee. Taste - toffee with the merest hint of biscuit and spice. Palate - close to medium bodied with a creamy and sweet texture and I’d just like a cleaner drier finish. Overall - decent.
Cask at the Amber Rose. Pours clear amber, bitter but flat and not much else there.
Cask at the white lady. Pours clear amber, thin white head. Oat sweet aromas, taste is all hob-nobs. Not great.

Cask at the Falcon. Orange, light haze, still, small white head, full lacing. Aroma has varnish, grass. Body is medium, smooth, fairly high carbonation for cask. Taste is quite drying, malt-forward, sweet toffee-ish, some resin, floral hop character, soft bitterness.

Gravity cask at the Bedford Beer Festival. A shade lighter than honey brown. Very clear. Aroma of malt, orange juice, cinnamon and clove. With such an exciting bouquet, I am somewhat disappointed by the taste: very middle-of-the-road malty bittersweet. However I’m more keen on the spicy honeyed citrus finish, and the beer as a whole does grow on me.
Cask Pint in Wibbas Down Inn (JDW), Wimbledon in Nov 2013 - Amber Gold in colour. Malty; toasty malts, caramel. Fruity; orange. Hoppy; grassy Saaz hops. Sweetish malty fruity throughout. Drinkable.
Cask conditioned at a Wetherspoons. Amber with thin white head. Initially toffee’d malts developing to a flowery, perfumed tartish flavour. Fruity later. Not great.
On tap at Cafe Royal. Pours with good white head which lasts well. Brown amber colour. Sweet bitter. Bit if metal finish? Ok, but not great

Cask, The Last Plantagenet, Leicester. Golden with an off white foam. Aromas are biscuit and caramel with mellow, jammy lemon and leafy aspects. Some nuttiness with bready yeast. Flavours are sweet caramel with toasted notes. Sweet and sour sauce with leafy, spicy notes. Stewed apple with a lightly peppery finish. A bit of a throwback but not bad.
Cask at The Moon Under Water (JDW), Watford in 2013. Clear amber with a white head. Aroma of toasted malt, golden syrup and dried fruit. Malty flavour with sweetish notes and a hint of roastiness.

Bottle. As "Marks & Spencer Buckinghamshire Ale". Dark amber brown in colour. Very malty; caramel, toffee, toasted malts. Fruity; dark fruits. Balanced by floral hoppy bitterness. Bitter malty throughout. Dryish bitter finish. (2008)
Clear caramel amber color, white head. Aroma of malts, caramel and straw. Light bitter flavour, malts. Finish straw and caramel. (From draught -cask- @ GBBF ’14, London)
From cask. Pours clear and golden amber with a small off white head. Aroma is toasted breadish and light malty. Bitter, dry and herbal. Dry and slight grainy finish.

How: Cask. Where: GBBF 2014. Appearance: Dark golden colour with a small white head. Aroma: Malt, butter, vegetables. Body: Medium body, low to medium carbonation. Flavour: Rather sweet malt, butter, citrus, grass.
Sample at Great British Beer Festival 2014. Clear amber beer with a small beige head. Fruity hop aroma, grassy, hay, floral, earthy notes. Hoppy citrus flavor, grassy, hay, floral notes.

Sampled @ GBBF. Clear lightly amber color, average sized off-white to beige head. Smell and taste malts, caramel, some toffee, lightly butter, lightly bitter. Average body and carbonation. Hmm it’s ok but don’t really like it.
Cask - Twig and caramel. Clear copper with a decent white head. Tastes as it smells with a light bitter finish.
Cask at Black Door, Helsinki. Originally rated 24032012. Colour is clear light copper with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, bitterness, caramel and malts.
Aromas of paint. Carmel and leather tastes are good but a little bitter and a quickly vanishing palate. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Gold lager. Fruity aroma, malt and hops. Fresh taste, powerful, sweet, malty then hoppy and aromatic. Beers of Switzerland
Soft drinkable brown. Pours rather pretty & goes down easy! Nicely done!
Medium brown with a thin tan head. Malty with a sort of fruity, nutty caramel thing going on.
On tap. Light tan-copper. A-roasty/earthy cocoa, medium/dark malt. T-roasty/cocoa-medium malt, second earthy hops, hint of cardboard.
on tap at the brewpub; a decent reddish-brown colored ale; a bit bitter with a malty background.

tap at River City... I hit a lull in the beers they made, the amber and the brown back to back were boring and bland needed something to wake them up, htis is as non offensive as you can get to a Macro drinker.
Tap - good size foamy head, dark amber color, malty nutty aroma and flavor - nothing special, but not bad
Not a whole lot going for this one. DIdnt have much flavor or aroma. Some DMS was evident on the aroma. Not my favorite from the brewery

Sampler at the brewpub. Comes a dark brown with a small biege head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark fruit, caramel and chocolate. Taste is on the sweet side, mostly malt and chocolate. Some bitterness in the finish.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a murky dark brown with a thin beige head. The nose is round and malty: nuts, toasty and roasty malt with maybe some burnt sugar/caramel notes in the background. Medium-bodied and slick with a bitter roasted finish. The flavor is of a round and nutty malt front that transitions to an ashy, day-old coffee, bitter-roasted finish. The finish, on this beer, is a huge detractor. Overall, it’s just not particularly enjoyable.

Date: February 24, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: clear brown with ruby edges, fine beige head, scattered bits of drippy lace Aroma: rich dry chocolate aroma, light nutty character Body: creamy body Flavor: rich chocolate flavor, touch of caramel sweetness enrichens the chocolate, light balancing bitterness Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 8/10; Overall: 13/20 Rating: 3.3/5.0 Drinkability: 9/10 Score: **+/4

En av mina favoritöl. Åbro gör de bästa ölsorterna. Den är lättdrucken. Det är ingen spritsmak i det. Den ska vara i kylskåpet på 4 grader i några timmar innan man dricker den. Den påminner mycket om fem komma tvåan.
tåkete strågul, våt papp, grønsaker, marsipan, ufrisk........................................
Clear gold. Aroma is pale malt syrup and apple peel. Taste is sweet syrup with some alcohol burn bitterness. Nothing more to say.
First likkah, can. Nose is malt, cardboard, palate is sweet malt, not much else. Bad, first likkah is last likkah.
Can. Pale golden, low white lace. Dry fruit esters, rotten hay, rural. Sticky maize. Rice sticky pudding, hay and grain, meh.
Can, many thanks Nische! Clear golden color with white head. Aroma is papery, starch, fussle oils. Taste is ethanol, sugary, papery, fussle oils again. Oily mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Meh.
Detta är en mycket lättdrucken "procenten före smaken öl", vattnig, söt och stark ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml can poured into a pint glass. Appearance is clear golden with a medium sized foamy head. Aroma of bread, cereal and a hint of alcohol. Taste is medium-heavy sweet and medium bitter. Palate is medium bodied, smooth texture and average carbonation. Åbro Sjukommatvåan is decent for a cheap strong lager, malty, sweet and somewhat boozy.

500ml can from Systembolaget. Clear pale golden, frothy white head, some lacing. Sweet malty and grainy nose. Smooth mouthfeel mild carbonation. Sweet malty taste, red apples, pear, grains, metallic and some alcohol notes. Quite harsh metallic finish. Low bitterness overall.
Malty, sweet aroma and taste. Medium body, no alcohol notes. Drinkable strong lager.

A yellow pour with a creamy white head and lace. A flavor of light malt with a semi sweet after taste. A tad thin and fizzy but very good for what it is suppose to be. A very solid refreshing brewpub offering.
Draft at brewpub. Light yellow body, smallish head, not much nose. Very clean, with limited hop character and a bready malt finish. Great example of the style.

Sample at the brewpub: Pours a clear pale yellow color with a thin white head that dissipates pretty quickly. Spotty lacing. Mild aroma of hops and hay. Light, dry body with a lightly hoppy character. Touches of spice as well. The finish is lightly hoppy and malty. Straightforward light fare.

Ultra pale yellow with mild carbonation under a short white head. Mild, pissy bitters in the aroma. Light bodied, finishing dry with enough bitterness in the flavor to keep this from being simply another lame pale lager. On draught at Elevator Brewing Co., Columbus, OH 43215
Soft, vanilla cakey aroma with very very light vinegar. Pale banana gold. A little briney, lightly tart, milky. Light quick tart aftertste. Medium light to light body.

Draft sampler at the Elevator. Poured a clear straw color with a medium white head that diminished slowly. Light hoppy citrus aroma. Light body with a watery texture. Light citrus flavor with a soft short finish. Wet cold alcohol with some character.

Sample at the brewpub - Pours pale golden with a short white head that didn’t stay very long. Aroma of light citrus and grains. Flavor was light grains and not much else. Palate light and airy. Nothing to remember on this one. Seemed much like Sam Adam’s Light to me.
Just like everyother Light beer...bland.....................................

On draught at the brewpub, this is the August selection in Elevator’s "PHD" program. The beer pours a hazy straw color with a medium white head that evaporates steadily to a film. Spotty lacing. Aroma of grassy hops, fruit and malt. Light-bodied with flavors of spicy hops, mild citrus and biscuit malt. The finish is mildly bitter with a grassy hop aftertaste. Decent overall.

This beer poured a nice dark straw color with a white head. The aroma had elements of hops and malt in it with a slight citrus smell. The taste also had elements of hops and citrus. A good summer beer.

On tap at Schmidt’s German Restaurant in Columbus, OH (locally called Schmidt’d Gold Lager). Pours a pale gold color with a full white head. No aroma. Smooth sweet pale malt and white bread taste. Not a lot of flavor, but well balanced and very refreshing.
Pours amber with a thick light beige head. Aroma of light hops and honey. Flavor is kind of on the bland side, but malt and honey are in a decent mix.
Light golden color with a full head. Not much flavor hints of hops and tinges of sweetness. Good beer for a hot day. FInishing rather weakly.

Served in an ice cube basically, so very little aroma. Flavor was actually quite good though. A lot of grainy malt flavor with some residual sweetness. A little more balanced toward malt than hops, but not bad.

On draught at Carrabba's. Served in a frozen mug so I had to wait quite awhile before drinking. Pours an amber color with a thick light beige head. Aroma of light hops and honey. Flavor is not very robust and consists of roasted malt, caramel and honey again. Finish is slightly hoppy but mostly sweet. Average.
From notes. Not much to this beer. Tiny spicy aroma and flavor. Very pale color. Some toasty notes. Big bubbles. Like 1/4 of a Prima Pils.

Appearance: Darker Amber medium hazy brew with a full head of fluffy white lace Nose: Mostly pine hops with a touch of citrus. Taste: Decent malt presence with a moderately huge hop presence. Body: medium to fuller body with some lively carbonation Parting thoughts: Decent unremarkable by the numbers IPA

Deep hard amber/orange pour with gooey head and lace. An evergreen hops aroma. Solid malt with a medium/hard bitter. Creamy full bodied. Very nice balance solid bitter make this an all round good beer.
Draft sampler at brewpub. aroma of pine/hops/citrus, medium brown color, pleasant hoppy taste. Not bad at all.
Draft. Amber in color. Citrusy hop aroma. Good hop flavor and bitterness. Good IPA
Pours a deep amber with a huge white head. Huge hop nose, strong floral and citrus. Taste is strong hops, slight raw hop, citrus with balanced pine. Finish is strong but smooth. Very nice.

Served with a sheet-lacing ecru head over a deep yet clear copper body. Soapy florals above pepper in the aroma carry through to the flavor. I enjoyed it despite my scant notes. On draught at Elevator Brewing Co., Columbus, OH 43215

Nose of fruit, flowers, and pine. The brew is clear copper with ruby highlights. The white creamy head is mostly lasting & leaves good lace. Bitter and burnt flavor with a heavy citrus presence and a long finish. The full body is dry and soft. Very nice indeed.
Sample at the Elevator. Nice reddish/copper tint. Nice medium head, good lacing. Bitter hops flavor but lots of malt as well. Decent beer.
Copper color with a small beige head. Mild hop aroma. Nice bitter hoppy flavor. Not citrus or floral more of an English hoppiness.

Draft at the brewpub: Shiny copper. Sweet and tart together at once. A starker version of their pale ale. Almost baked apple sourness at the end. Livens up a bit as it warms, as the moldiness settles into a bit more of a fruity bite.

On tap at Elevator Taproom. Pours clear amber red with a white head. Aroma: roasted malts, bready, caramel, floral hop. Taste: light sweet & moderate bitter, caramel, nutty, toasted biscuit, earthy. Medium body, moderate carb, light dry finish

clear, red color; bready, roasted malt and floral hop aroma; an excellent, well balanced red ale; bready, toasted malt, balanced nicely with a good amount of hoppy bitterness; dry, bitter finish; creamy mouthfeel; very smooth
On tap at Elevator in Columbus. Pours copper color. Just enough bitterness for my liking. Loved this one ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft - Dark malts, caramel malts. Cloudy copper with a rich white head. Sweet and grainy Amber malts with a touch of vegetal notes.
Draft - pours amber white head - nose/taste of bread, light burnt barley - med body

16 ounce can into pint glass, no can dating. Pours slightly hazy deep orange/copper color with a 1-2 finger dense and fluffy light khaki headh with good retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of caramel, brown sugar, brown bread, and toasted biscuit; with lighter notes of nuttiness, raisin, plum, apple, herbal, floral, grass, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Nice aromas with good balance and complexity of dark/bready malt and light-moderate fruity yeast/earthy hop notes; with solid strength. Taste of caramel, brown sugar, brown bread, and toasted biscuit; with lighter notes of nuttiness, raisin, plum, apple, herbal, floral, grass, light pepper, an y east earthiness. Light-moderate herbal/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of caramel, brown sugar, brown bread, toasted biscuit, nuttiness, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Nice complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/bready malt and light-moderate fruity yeast/earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish.
