I have been on recent maibock kick so although it has slipped into June I’m enjoying this as my long weekend begins. Hazes amber pour with nose of dry hops and caramel. Tastes of faint dusty hops, caramel, toasted malt, vanilla, touch floral, and cherry. Fine medium palate. Fresh tasting and nice.
Pours a dark golden color with a white head. Aroma is sweet malt. Flavor hints at caramel with a sweet alcohol finish.
Copper-orange pour. Aroma is smoky-sweet with notes of citrus, fruit and vanilla. Flavor is caramel, toffee, nuts, dates, and fruit.
Deep gold, almost amber color. Aroma is mostly sweet bready malt. Also possibly butterscotch? Taste is sweet-ish with this weird mediciny after taste. Didn’t quite care for it

“Mager Pils“, vom Faß beim Mager in Pottenstein. - Satt goldgelb, klar. - In der Nase aromatisch kräuteriger Hopfen. - Antrunk zart hellmalzig mit charakteristischer, kräuteriger Hopfung. Gut rezent, etwas dünn. Im Abgang nur milde Hopfenherbe. - Ein süddeutsches Pilsener, das statt kerniger Herbe milde aber ausgeprägte Hopfenaromen bei milder Restsüße bietet, aber etwas blaß daherkommt.

resin, floral, grass, spruce, citrus, herbs, caramel, bread, hay, hay, cereal, chocolate, pale, golden, amber, orange, medium sweetness, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium sourness,

Goldgelb und klar im Glas, mit schöner Blume, die aber sehr kurzlebig ist. Hopfig frischer Antrunk, harmonisch bitterer Körper, der eine leichte Säure aufweist. Gut trockener Abgang. Für ein fränkisches Pils sehr gut gehopft. Trinkempfehlung!

Bottle 50cl. from Total gas station @ Pottenstein. Poured into a stemmed pilsner glass. Clear pale golden, average frothy white head, diminishing slowly, good lacing; aroma malt, grain, grass; taste medium sweet and bitter, malty, grainy, grassy, touch of sugar; mild sweetbitter aftertaste, malty notes at the end; medium body, oily texture, sot carbonation; decent pilsner.
50cl bottle from the brewpub. Pours clear pale golden colour with a mid-sized white head. aroma of grassy floral hops, grain. Taste of floral hops, grassy, mild bitterness, very good!

(Bue sur place): Une structure céréalière délicate doublée d’une membrane sucrée, mielleuse qui se laisse réconforter par une douillette herbacée. Les saveurs tranchent et le coupable est la minéralité de Pottenstein.

My Bottom Line: This mineral Pilsener benefits from a toasty malt touch as wooden hop resins slowly establish their control of the finish. Further Personal Perceptions: -A cloud of foam bobs atop the golden gown. -Mouthfeel is fluffy, almost airy. -Bitterness is more and more engaging. -The minerality in this village is salient. Bottle at the brewpub.

a) Sehr schönes dunkelgelbes Bier. Geruch süßlich-hopfig. Im Antrunk süßlich-herb. Die Herbe verfliegt allerdings auch relativ schnell, so dass im Mund ein süßlich-süffiger Geschmack mit leichter Hopfennote zurückbleibt. --> Typisches fränkisches Pils. Test vom 6.8.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 12,12,11,12,12,10 - 11,05 b) Leicht-herb, etwas süßlich-wässrig, im Nachgeschmack eine etwas herbere Note zu Tage tretend. Interessantes, angenehmes Bier...Dabei doch etwas malzig. Test vom 24.1.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 12,12,12,11,12,11 - 11,45
Draft. Pours gold with a white head. Grainy pale malts and floral hops. Well balanced and drinkable.
Smooth and dry hoppy flavor. Medium bodied. Grass and grain. Pleasant and quaffable.
Bottle from landbierparadies.Clear dark brown colour, creamy white foam. Rather sweet dunkel, lots of caramel, some notes of cocoa, light roasted malts. Easy drinkable.

“Mager Dunkel“, vom Faß beim Mager in Pottenstein. - Kastanienrotbraun, klar. - In der Nase neben dunklem Malz und milden Röstnoten wieder die aromatisch kräuterige Hopfennote, die auch die übrigen Biere vom Mager auszeichnet. - Mild aber aromatisch nussig-röstmalzig, zart rauchig, auf den ersten Schluck etwas dünn aber mit gediegener Hopfenherbe. Mild rezent, leicht alkalisch, angenehm trocken. - Langer, trocken-röstmalzig bitterer Nachtrunk. - Enorm stimmiges, kernig malziges Dunkles individueller Prägung. Herausragend.

resin, floral, grass, spruce, citrus, herbs, caramel, roasty, bread, hay, cereal, chocolate, coffee, nuts, toast, light sweetness, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium sourness, light body, medium body, full body,
Darkest brown. Aroma is weet basement moss melasses slight sulfur and copper. Taste is metallic dark malt. Melasses. Brown sugar. Black bread finish. Ok.

Tap. Clear brown color with ruby highlight and a creamy off-white head with huge carbonation visible. Aroma is chocolate, earthy. Taste is chocolate, earthy, nutty, medium sweet. Oily mouthfeel with spritzy carbonation. Tasty enough.
500ml Bottle - Dark brown with red tinges. Slightly earthy aroma with notes of aniseed and chocolate. Liquorice, raisins, coffee and some earthy notes in the taste.

500ml bottle. Clear, dark chestnut colour with average, fluffy, half-way lasting, moderately lacing, off-white head. Grainy, slightly roasty, dark malty aroma, hints of spelt, a touch of chocolate and cocoa. Taste is bitter, roasty dark malty, chalky; a bit thin and monotonous.

Bottle from Landbierparadies24! Pours deep black with a tiny head. Aroma has pure coffee and strong roasted malts. Taste has very strong and bitter roasted malts and lots of coffee. Longlasting bitter roasty finish.
50 cl bottle @ home with friends.Dark colour. Medium off-white head.Roasted malts, nuts, floral/herbal hops.Long lasting bitter floral finish.Medium body.Refreshing ,tasty and interesting.

Bottle from Erlangernick, thanks my friend, Prost! Clear dark brown cola coloured, lasting tan head. Tasty dark beer, some good dark malts, some light chocolate. It’s a decent dunkel, nothing over the top or with particular character, and nothing wrong with it either. A little dark malt character. Decent.
At bierfestival Bad Staffelstein. Clear golden color, white head. Smell and taste malts, grainy a bit, a bit bitter and a bit sweet. Ok pilsener.
500ml Bottle - Golden with a white head. Grass and hints of lime and white bread in the aroma. Lime leaves, lemon and some bready and grassy hints in the taste.

Flaska från landbierparadis. Klar ljusgul vätska med medelhögt kritvitt skum. Lite kryddig och gräsig doft med säd i bakgrunen. Smak som doften. Lätt kropp, torr och påtaglig gräsig beska utan att bli kantig. Gott.

Angemessene Schaumentwicklung mit durchschnittlicher bis etwas gröberer Konsistenz. Farblich durchschnittlich gelb und klar. Riecht gut würzig, leicht strohig-malzig, hopfig. Geschmacklich zunächst würzig, dann undefinierbar fruchtig-süß, leicht gammlig. Im Abgang wird es dann fein herb mit krautig-harzigen Noten. Im Mittelteil scheint das Bier einen dicken Braufehler drin zu haben.
Surprisingly good Pils from the Vierzehnheiligen brewery. Always surprised when a south brewery hits a home run with a PIls. A good beer indeed herbal and smooth.

Keg at GBBF 2018. It pours clear yellow with a small white head. The aroma is soft, sweet, doughy white bread, sponge cake and grass The taste is crisp, dry, grassy, straw, peppery spice, cracker, herbal and doughy white bread with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate, prickly carbonation. Chuggable.

resin, floral, grass, spruce, citrus, herbs, medium sweetness, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, medium bitterness, very bitter, lightly sour, medium sourness, heavily sour, light body, medium body, fizzy, lively, average carbonation, soft carbonation, flat, bitter,
Bottle from Die Bierotek, Bamberg. Aroma is grainy malt with a hint of fruit including some apple. Flavour is light sweet and bitter. Body is light to medium. Drinkable but not great Pilsener.
The beer has got a clear golden colour with a small head and medium Body. Aroma of hops and malt. Taste of malt, hops, citrus and grass. Malty finish.

Bei meiner Flasche eine starke Carbonisierung (entgegen anderer Bewertungen), und damit auch etwas metallischer Geschmack mit viel Prickeln. Mild-weiches Aroma mit schönen Getreidenoten. Leichte Bitterkeit im Nachgeschmack mit schön schmeckbarem Hopfen.

De Landbierparadies. En copa hefe de Bavaria. Viendo El Hombre en el Castillo 1x02-03. Caduca en una semana. Correcta aunque le falta mayor intensidad en el sabor respecto a mejores exponentes del estilo. Muy buen feel, eso si

500ml Bottle - Dark brown with orange tinges. Nuts, brown sugar and some slightly roasted notes in the aroma. Blackcurrant, raisins, caramel and some spicy and bready notes. A dunkel with plenty of character and drinkability.
At bierfestival Bad Staffelstein. Dark color, decent sized head. Smell and taste malts, dark malts, brown sugar, light caramel. 7-4-7-4-13

Flaska från Landbierparadis. Kopparfärgad klar vätska med en krämig skumpuck.Söt brödig doft och smakbild, lite mjölkchoklad, mörk sirap, lite brödkryddor i den lätta beska. Kanske något söt annars bra. Gott.
Drunk from the bottle. Cacao, mildly sweet, molasses notes without the sugar itself, herbal hop note coming late. Complex beer made with plenty of dark roasted malt. Excellent
Well made amber beer. Medium body, good flavour, low bitterness. Well rounded. D&S Dresden

Many thanks for this kloster beer to Mariusz. Piwo ma ladna czerwono miedziana barwe, spora i trwala piane, zapach pieczonego makowca, W smaku nuty slodowe, lekko palone, troche karmelu, troche ciasta domowego makowca i nieco farszu z nalesnikow z jablkami. Fajne, udane z ladna etykieta.
0,5l bottle Nürnberg- clear brown with a brownish head as a dunkle should be - aromas of malts and burned caramel - taste of caramel coffee easy and drinkable Dunkel with a bitter finish

500ml bottle as Trunk Export Dunkel; BB 29th Nov 18. Drank in our Bamberg holiday apartment on 9th Sep 18, bought from Bierothek, Bamberg. Clear brown pour, beige crown. Malts rule the nose and taste, semi-sweet initial taste, late bitterness and matallic twang as the beer warms.
Bottle from Landbierparadies. Dark brown colour, creamy beige foam. Medium carbonation. Sweet, malty, notes of caramel, bready, very light bitterness. Easy drinkable. Nice Dunkel.

Bottle from Cask Craft Pimlico as Wieninger Teisendorfer Hell . Drunk on slowest train ever from Victoria to Ashford. Clear gold lasting white head. Malty golden beer. So maltier than you would expect a hell or pilsner. So more a landbier i guess. Quite peppery hoppy on the finish. Anyway made me happy to have a Franconian beer. Some yeast on aroma.

On tap at Alte Klosterbrauerei/ Brauerei Trunk, Bad Staffelstein-Vierzehnheiligen, Bayern, 5.10.17. As Trunk Erntebier. Clear light gold with a creamy white head. Very faint floral and grassy aroma, bitter and floral taste with a hint of sweetness that comes from the malt. Medium body, fairly fizzy, long, floral finish.

"Vierzehnheiligener Bier Nothelfer Erntebier", 5,1 %, Flasche (50 cl) von Hopfen & Malz, Berlin. Ein Bier mit Gersten-, Roggen- und Weizenmalz. - Satt bronzegelb, klar, bescheidene Schaumbildung. - In der Nase würzig-karamelliges Malz, hopfenwürziger Hopfen und eine zart butterig-ranzige Note. - Antrunk eigenartig unbestimmt, einerseits süßlich karamelmalzig mit Toastbrot, Anklängen an Kräuter und Honig, andererseits mit einer unpassenden fruchtig-säuerlichen Note, die vom Roggenmalz herrühren könnte (wenn sie denn beabsichtigt war). Mild rezent. Im Abgang schwach krautige, unangenehm ranzige Hopfenherbe. - Aromatisch unentschiedenes Bier, das süße, säuerliche und herbe Aromen nicht zu einem harmonischen Ganzen zu integrieren vermag. Was mir dies Bier aber endgültig verleidet, ist der abgestandene ranzig-herbe Nachtrunk.
Bottle looks simple, but good. Beer in the glass zippy, small head. Starts mild, fine malty and spicy. Light grasy-wheaty notes. Finish well balanced, quite drinkable. Nice!

bottle, picked up at landbierparadies in nuremberg. i must have got a really fresh bottle of this harvest seasonal beer, because i had a much better impression of it than other raters. anyways, the first highlight was an immaculate golden colour reminiscent of stained glass and chandeliers, emphasised by the head being rather modest. the aroma screamed of fresh green hallertau; i would be surprised if there was no addition of wet hops, however it s hard to say as german beer labels tend to refrain from making any boasts as to the quality of the beer or any special technical aspects. the green hop character lingered past some light caramel sweetness and through till the aftertaste which was long and prickly
Golden colour with off-white head. Aroma is mild toasted and fruity. Flavor of butter and biscuits and bread.
Blond body, it smells malty, sweet, dusty. It taste sweet a bit citrus. Nothing special but drinkabel 10/9/9/9/10/9

(bottle) pours a clear deep golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of caramel, grain and heavy vanilla, quite muesli-esque, with some notes of wild berries and washing-up liqiud. flavour is exactly the same, with a prominent popcorny graininess toward the finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Recht getreidiger Antrunk mit süßen und trockenen Noten. Die Würzigkeit basiert auf dem hellen Malz, die Hopfigkeit ist vorhanden, spielt aber in weiten Teilen nur eine Nebenrolle. Erst zum Ende ist er wenig präsent vorhanden. Trinkbares Bier ohne Besonderheiten. 9/8/9/9//8

0.5 l bottle (5.1 %), thanks Timo A. Golden color. Malty, fruity and honeyish aroma with hint of pepper, lemon and metal. Fruity and honeyish flavor with medium bitterness, lemon and hint of nuts. The palate is slightly rough and metallic.
Sweet fruit hop malt aroma with stone fruit. Murky light brown colour good head and lacing. Smooth sweet fruit hop flavour. Smooth palate.
500ml bottle pours a golden color with a bit of head. Fruity Belgian yeast. Nice hop balance.

330ml bottle. Clear, yellow-ish, pale golden colour with average, frothy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, snow-white head. Fruity and minimally funky aroma, hints of orange, dill, a touch of brine. Taste is dry, moderately sweet pale malty undertones, fruity notes of orange and mandarine, apricot, a spicy touch of brine, white wine.
Hazed golden color with a thin lid of dense taupe bubbles. Very fruity aroma, with mangos and oranges soaking in cream. Orange cream flavor. Hints of herbal hops and light grass. 1/14
Bottle. Lovely golden appearance with a small head. A bit lively upon opening with a spicy hoppiness and a twist of orange.A truly delectable beer.

From a 500ml bottle on 20/3/2016 (shared with Butz). Pours a slightly cloudy straw with a huge fluffy white head. The nose is primarily Belgian yeast. In the mouth, it’s very sweet, with bready malt, citrus fruit, banana and spice. Has a slightly syrupy texture with moderate carbonation. Very easy drinking and doesn’t really present as 6.5%. A very nice brew.

Bottle. Fuggle & Golding, Ilkley. Clear gold. Film of bright, white head. Sweet, fruity, bready malts. Banana esters. Hint of grated lemon rind. Taste is bready sweet. Turns fairly bitter. Palate feels a bit chewy and overly thick. A bit claggy. Finishes with those sweet esters, and a lemony, pithy bitter close. Ok.

330ml bottle from Bottle Bank, Falmouth. Pours clear gold with creamy head. Aroma is vibrant sweet yeast. Taste bears a good strong sweetness with pillowy vanilla / banana notes. Not getting the low scores below. I thought this was quite nice.
330 bottle from honest brew, crystal clear light golden, sparse head, strong Raw sourdough notes hints to light orange, strong bready taste with intense alcohol

2nd July 2015 Almost clear gold beer, tidy cream colour head. Palate is smooth and semi dry, modest fine carbonation. Sweet dried fruits and sweet floralness. Gets a touch sticky sweet. Mild spice and bread. Smooth dry finish. A little stodgy but fine.
Great textured bottle. Big banana nose and flavors. Spicy nutmeg notes, starchy body. Pretty good. Enjoyed at Steph's house overlooking Auckland.

Pretty decent effort at a wheat beer, along the lines of Hoegaarden. Much darker pour, 330ml bottle in a mix six. Warning: last few drops were thick, syrupy. Next time, give it a mild shake before pouring!

Light Golden, Clean, White BeerHead, with frothy, abundant and fine foam, Good Persistency, sparkling body. The beer has typical aroma of hefeweizen, such as banana, clove-like phenols, citrus, dough, and grains. This one has more clear performance of spices on the nose. Medium carbonation, light sweetness, light bitterness, light body. The taste reflects the aroma but is slightly sour. The aftertaste is clean, crispy but watery. The drinkability is good.

On tap in Chiang Mai, Thailand. Golden, slightly hazy, with a thin white head that dilapidates quickly. Somewhat stuck inbetween a Weizen and a Witbier. Taste has a hint of fruit and bread. It takes a moment but then it becomes very drinkable.
Pours almost clear. Light golden. Medium carbonation. Pleasant yeasty, malty nose. Taste wise quite savoury (like a lightly grilled slice of toast) with a little soapy finish.
Kolor złoty, jasny. Piana dość mizerna ale ładnie osiada na szkle. W aromacie banany intensywne i lekkie cytrusy. Takie trochę oszukane hefe weizen. Rześkie pite z butelki na lotnisku w Auckland.
Bottle. Pours a hazy orange colour with a thin white head, light wheat aroma, the taste is medium bitterness and all wheat with a dry bitter finish.
A wonderful local weissbeer with great colour, aroma and clean finish. Highly recommend!
Best aroma I’ve smelt, smells like banana and bread. After taste is decent. Colour is a touch hazy which looks cool. After taste is fair. Great beer ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Botella. @Cimmeria, Oviedo 03/02/2018 Color amarillo corona de espuma blanca, aromas citricos con notas a levadura, sabor especiado notas citricas y levadura, cuerpo medio.

Light Golden, Hazy, white BeerHead, with frothy, fine foam and ok persistency. Sparkling body. Clear aroma of citrus. Clear oxidation due to poor storage. Slightly honey and cardboard hints. Light sweetness, Medium hoppy bitterness, Light body, Medium sparkling. The taste has malty characters such as grain, maize, dried straw and little toasty flavor.The drinkability is ok, but not enough for a pilsner-style beer.
Nice and crisp with good citrusy hops. Refreshing with not too much bracing bitterness.

Golden slightly hazy with a good head, good carbonation. Nice touch of hops on the nost, not over powing. This is a NZ Pilsener and not to be compared with Urquell. Refreshing taste, with good malt, balanced hops and alcohol. Great beer.
Clear golden body with a tall, vanishing but frothy white head. Grassy and sulphur aroma. Taste is grassy as well, with nice crispy notes. Medium body,average carbonation, thin texture
A lot of character, very hoppy for a pilsner, can definitely catch a lot of fruity vibes in the hops.
Bottle. Pours a dark gold colour with a fluffy white, light hop and malt aroma, the taste is medium bitterness and with a dry bitter finish.

330ml bottle as Tuatara Bohemian Pilsner. Pours lightly hazed yellow golden with a decent white head. Aroma: citrus, floral, grassy hop, hay. Taste: dry, crisp, light sweet, light to moderate bitter, grassy, floral, citrussy lemon notes. Light body, decent carbonation, with a dry, moderately bitter finish

Aroma: grassy nose. Taste: citrus with herbal notes and grassy finish. Clean and nice. Compared with the Czech classics, there is less grain and body. Nice New World (?) Pilsener. These guys are doing a great job.

Light clear yellow colour with white head. Nice smell of lemons, kiwi and grass. Taste of lemon and gooseberry, medium bitterness. Being czech and used to original pilseners I would not consider this pilsener but rather pale ale. Then it is really good.

Poured a crystal clear gold with a one-finger bright white frothy head that retained very well before diminishing to a blotchy cap that laced OK. Carbonation moderate to high, quite lively and coarse. Aroma softly of bready malt plus earthy tones; quite larger-like. Taste is slightly sweet with bready malt, slight bitterness and a little citrus flavour. Light body. Smooth, clean, crisp and slightly dry with low bitterness on a moderately long finish.
Dark yellow pour, white head. Citrus, grainy malt, light fruit. Pretty boring if you ask me.
Dark golden colour. Malt balanced, slightly buttery, but with adequate hop flavour. Not bad at all.
Es ist ein angenehm fruchtiges IPA mit recht herber Note. Es ist dabei aber nicht zu stark, sodass man es recht leicht trinken kann, auch wenn die Bitterkeit anfangs doch sehr vorprescht.

Restrained aroma in an amber pour. Hop forward balance with laid back body and finish. One of the first base brews from Tuatara and one that helped put them on the map. Not bad in its day - but long since overshadowed.

Bottle shared at a tasting at the Dancing Camel. Thanks Excellent Little Brother! Clear amber-gold with a huge white head. Soapy, limestone and some pine aroma, bitter, soapy and old taste. Light-to-medium body, quite carbonated, orange and soap finish.
Bottle in Villeneuvette, France. Really nice bottle, quite good beer, refreshing
Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks kerenmk. As Tuatara India Pale Ale. Golden. Stale hops, slightly soapy, malt, grains, a bit of caramel, sweetish, bitter finish.
Pours orange to yellow with a small head, aroma of fruits, malt, orange, flavor is slightly bitter with orange, sweet, medium bodied
Pours an amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy aroma. Fruity malty weak citrus hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty hoppy citrus finish.

330ml bottle. Slightly cloudy, amber colour with average, frothy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, off-white head. Citrusy fruity, hoppy aroma, notes of lemon, some orange, a resinous touch. Taste is citrusy fruity, hoppy, moderately bitter, notes of lemon, hints of orange, a resinous touch, caramel malty background; abrupt, quasi non-existent finish, only a minimally metallic impression remains...

5%ABV. IPA. Poured out amber. 12ºSRM. Mouthfeel is soapy. Palate is light and clean with pale malt, light sweetness suggesting lightly browned toast, wonderbread and sweet dough, keep in mind that the sweet is light but the palate has a nice ponderous sweet bready body. So it’s not all light and sweet. There is a nice slightly sour, fruity body to the palate which suggests juice, maybe some fresh-squeezed orange, especially a cloudy milky fresh-squeezed juice with a lot of pith. YOverall very sour and lemon juicy as far as the palate goes. Hops are resinous, pine, bitter melon, there is an emphasis on bitter rather than the pine or the citrus. So not so much on the parent aromatics and more emphasis on the bitter betas. Finish is medium with a clean bitter back of the throat bitter, which I have come to associate with Columbus. Goes on Favorites List!

Overall, quite an earthy ale. Green melon, orange, lemon, pineapple, floral. Sweet at the front, orange, wood and pine at the back. All flavours and aromas are on the light side and the body is fairly thin, which makes it a very drinkable quencher.

330ml bottle. Darkest brown colour with average, frothy, moderately lasting and lacing, beige head. Minimally chocolately, dark malty aroma, fruity hoppy hints of dark berries, bramble, blueberry, a leafy touch. Taste is rather dry, slightly roasty, dark malty, a touch of chocolate, minimally papery, cautious fruity hints of dark berries. bramble, blueberry, very subtle residual sweetness; oily texture, smooth and soft palate.

5%ABV. Porter. Poured out dark brown. 38SRM. Nose is yeasty, very much so. Light smoke. Mouthfeel is light. Palate is multigrain bread, barley bread, wheat toast. Hops are woody and noble. Finish is hoppier than a usual porter.

Draught @ Tap East Pub & Brewery, The Great Eastern Market, Westfield Stratford City, Stratford, Greater London, England E20 1ET. [ As Tuatara London Porter ]. Clear dark red brown color with a average, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, off-white to light beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, soy sauce - vinegar, tart berry - fruity notes. Flavor is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter with a long duration, sour fruit, dark roasted, chocolate. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20150217] 7-3-6-3-13

330 ml bottle. BB 11/04/17. Thanks Timo A! Dark reddish brown color with a small grayish tan head. Roasted malt, chocolate, some cherry notes (?) and some dryness in the aroma. The flavor is news paper, roasted malt, some ashy dryness and chocolate.
330ml bottle. Pours dark. Aroma is chocolate milk. Taste is a little bitter, some chocolate and some prunes. Quite refreshing, and really quite nice. A nice simple porter.
330ml bottle into glass. Earthy chocolate nose. Red/brown beer with small tan head. Light body, light fizz. Hints of chocolate and fruit. Bitter lingering dry cocoa finish. Good porter.

Average head and body, brown-black in colour. Aroma of swampy barley but not too swampy, but still swampy. Flavour is roasted barley with hints of coffee, but the finish is watery. I like my porters in your face and this is demure at best.

Flasche (33 cl) von Jenny Lou’s, Peking. - Tiefschwarz mit einer dünnen Decke dunkelbeigefarbenen Schaums. - In der Nase überraschend kräftige Hopfenaromen, die an ein IPA erinnern: tropische Frucht, Nadelwald, Menthol, erst dahinter Röstmalz und Mokka. - Antrunk ebenfalls wuchtig hopfenaromatisch, gefolgt von Mokka und Bitterkakao. Malzsüße ist kaum ausgeprägt. Gut rezent, fast etwas zu sehr; schlank und trocken. Im Abgang kräftige holzige Hopfenbittere, beinahe verbranntes Röstmalz und eine deutliche Note von Asche. - Interessantes Porter mit geballten, fast schroffen Hopfen- und Röstmalzaromen.

Porter’s for me are a time and a place beer. It is not a summer beer nor a beer I can drink all night. Also If I can get Fuller’s London Porter then everything else is an also ran. This however is not bad. I had this in a tiny pub in Taipei near Le-li road down a back street. The body is quite light for a Porter. Nose is coffee, milk chocolate and maybe burnt toast. More carbonation than I expected and a little drier. But that said it had some good crisp dark flavours...such as chocolate and malt. Finish was dry and clean. Very good beer.

Bottle. Black with a lovely chocolate like flavour. Hops in background make it feel like a dark IPA rather than an IPA. Nevertheless this is an excellent beer and easily the best I have tried so far from this brewery.
Pre-ratebeerian days this was one of my favourite "mainstream" beers that I drank often, would be good if they re-introduced it.

Another one from memory, but worthy of it. Was an impressive melding of malt and hops from one of the mainstream breweries - something they haven’t recaptured to the same degree of late. A shame it is no longer being brewed.

Tasted from 2006 notes. Rich amber colour, Aromas of mutued stonefruits and a touch citrus. Odd given the hop description, expecting different. Decent palate, nice flowery hop character, juicy with a touch of warm hop character to finish. Decent
Hoppy nose. Pours very red with a medium fluffy head. Flavour is hoppy and dry but unfortunately slightly thin and watery. All told it’s not bad, but not amazing.

A pleasant enough beer to drink, spoilt only by the high price (even here in the south island of New Zealand where it is brewed). The head did not last at all long but the flavour was enough to see me go back for seconds.

Bottle (and a pretty cool one for a change!): Very slightly hazy amber with a large off-white head. Hoppy aromas of citrus, pine, caramelised orange, over a broad spicy herbal base. Dominant orange hop flavours, much like the aromas. Sharp, but short hit of bitterness that is replaced by a dull, carboardy crystal malt tone.Very drying and possibly a little over carbonated.

Treacle / dark orange appearance. Sweet pineapple aromas. Good bitter sweet balance. Consistant frothy head and bubbles with a medium body. I personally didn’t think it was bitter enough for an IPA, but a great bevvy anyways.

Quite possibly the best beer currently available from this brewer, which isn’t to say much. Pours a bright browning copper with minimal islands of froth and little legs. Surprisingly good, big herbal and flowery New Zealand hop nose with licks of butter, cocoa and cola soda. Similar hop presence in the mouth with pronounced Munich and crystal-style malts that give it a biscuity sweetness with just a touch of ginger for depth. Malt is swallowed up as it moves backwards by some firm, fresh earthy hops that show just a little too softly bitter a swallow. Light crystal malt sweetness lingers. The body is exceptionally light and the artificial carbonation is a little annoying, yet this is quite a decent quaffer. Not at all bad!!! (33cL, 07/11/06, Morley Liquor Merchants)
On tap at Warners in Christchurch. Nice, drak beer enjoyed on a cold day. Quite malty. Not my preferred style of beer, but this was decent.

Pours a nice amber with a small white head. Armoa is very hoppy and spicy. The beer is very aggesivly hopped, and has a fairly sweet malt palate that balances quite well. This finish is also quite bitter and rough. Great for the price, I can see this going a long way in the Australian market.
Red tinted brown with a nice head. malt aroma. leaves lacing down glass. flavor is chocolate toffee with a citrus hop finish

On tap at Grapevine Texas location. First off a disclaimer, this is more akin to a fruit beer than a stout and I rated it a such. Nearly opaque with a reddish bottom. Small off-white head and some lacing, thin ot medium-bodied. Porter (not stout) aroma of roasted malt, strong coffee, bittersweet chocolate and smoky hints. The fruity raspberry is an complementary undertone. Very nice. Good smoky and sweet malt balance with the tart and fruity raspberry, wow, well thought out. Dry and lively mouthfeel, tart finish. A great hybrid, workes well together. I'm completely against the grain on this one, I really liked it. A love it or hate it beer.

Quite possibly the worst idea anyone ever had for something to do to beer. Seriously. An evil genius lay awake in his own sweat for nights dreaming up this concoction. For a few delerious, feverish moments I imagined a decent German desert of some sort, but then I woke up and realized that I was drinking sewage.
Sampled draught at Big Buck, Grapevine, Texas. Dark brown. Sweet artificial raspberry aroma. Lightly roasty, stiky and with candyish berry flavour. Watery finish.

A pointless fusion of one good beer with one bad beer, proving that not everything is the sum of its parts. With this mix, you lose the palate and finish of the stout in exchange for only a slight gain in fruitiness at the front. Not a fair trade. (on tap, Grapevine, TX location)
Weak head and weak lace, low carbination. The touch of raspberry with the bitterness of coffee was okay, but not great. This would go well with a nice cheese cake or chocolate dessert.

This beer is allegedly a combination of the stout and the raspberry wheat. Interesting....the stout wasnt stout enough to begin with so this beer wasnt all that it could have been. Very pretty color, mohogany. Dark berry taste and finish.
On tap. Orange in color and hzy with a small white head. Aroma is of banana, clove and lemon. Taste is of yeast, banana, and spice.
On tap at the brewpub. Best beer of the lineup. Golden orange color, hazy, and a thin head. Very banana and clove in the smell. Taste is banana, spices, wheat, and malts.
Had at he Big Buck in Auburn Hills in 2005. Served with lemon, had a cloudy colour as expected. Slightly bitter, average overall for a Hefe-Weizen in the US.

Poured from tap in Grapevine, TX. This pour produced a beer with a cloudy pale yellow body and very little head which diminished fully by the time the glass was brought to me. There was no need for a lemon with this brew as the aroma carried strong notes of lemon and wheat. I had to let the beer mature to bring out the notes of clove described by the brewery, and could not detect banana. This was a full-flavored, tart, crisp, and wheat-flavored brew, well in line for a Hefeweizen. I was very pleased with this beer and will enjoy it again when I have a chance.

On tap at the Gaylord, MI location. Basic, but tasty, hefeweizen, pouring a cloudy yellow-orange topped by a thick off-white head. Characteristic clove-banana ester notes paired with light bready, tangy wheat. They’re a dime a dozen, but hefeweizens are great for humid summer nights.

Draught at the brewpub, Heatwave Hefe-Weizen Cloudy blonde-orange color. It’s served with a slice of lemon, therefore the aroma has a mix of lemon and banana. Medium body, with a residual sweetness, a light banana taste, some spiceness and a final strong bitterness (for a Hefe-Weizen).

Grapevine location, on tap. Excellent Hefe, great look, amazing flavor of some citrus (lemon) and banana. Nice head, cloudy deep yellow pour. One of my Big Buck favorites, and the same for a few other aficionados at the bar.
Tap @ Brewpub with Nuffield. Rating from 2004 notes. Cloudy yellow color with note head. An off aroma and flavor with a touch of orange and citrus.

On tap at the brewery in Gaylord Michigan. <!-- p --> Yellow, hazy with no head. The nose is mostly grains. Taste is full of bannannas grains and yeast. Of the beers that they had this is among the best.
Pour is light yellow and hazey...almost like a witbier...smell is bubblegum and bananas....taste is spicy and lots of wheat and malty flavors....strange slightly sour finish...
Meh. Really was not a fan. Glad that I sampled it because it was pretty unique, but would pass on it in the future.

On tap: Real sweet aroma with banana and spice. Dark brown with reddish-orange hilights when held to the light. Off-white head. Sweet up front and finishes with a sour nutty hop flavor and a slight burn.

Tap: Dark brown in color not enough head for a dunkel( probably the pour). Strong ripe banana aroma. Even stronger banana finish with only a hint of spice/clove. Almost no sweet malt aroma or taste. Not a true dunkel but a decent beer nonetheless.

Sweet malty aroma. Dark brownish color. Sweet maltyflavor with some of the weizen. Very good beer. I usually don't like dunkelweizen as much as regular weizen but the guys at this Big Buck location (Grapevine, TX) figured out how to get past the usual dunkelweizen boringness and create something good.
Gorgeous reddish brown color. Thin head. Subtlely sweet malt flavor that went down smooth, not a whole lot to it, but it still kicked ass.
Like a Corona with a pulse and a little bitterness in the finish, not bad, but still a weak beer.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Bottle shared by Deanso at Mind Cafe. Cloudy amber pour with a off white fluffy head that gradually settles. Banana, wheat, doughy malt, light yeast, chewy, dry, slightly sweet, nice bready finish.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: 50cl beer shared with Pushkinwow from Tops. Thin white head. Very hazy golden pour. Easy drinking.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: A fruity aroma, some yeast. A medium large frothy white head with a long duration. The body is cloudy and yellow. A yeasty and malty aroma. The body is light to medium strong, very creamy with a lively carbonation.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Bottled 500ml. -at Bayrisch Jura gas station restaurant. Pale golden coloured, medium sized airy white head, mild yeasty nose. Sweet malty, light yeasty and wheaty with notes of citrus, banana and discreet cloves. Good weizen.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Flasche 0,5l: Golden, kräftige Trübung, sehr kräftiger sher stabiler feinporiger Schaum; frische Nase, kräftige fruchtig-malzige Süße, etwas exotische Früchte, Papaya, Honigmelone, Bananen, Malz, Getreide, kräftige Hefearomen, dezente Hopfennoten; frischer + leicht fruchtiger Körper, malzige Süße, dezente Zitrusnoten, grüne Früchte, Sternfrucht, Papaya, Malz, Getreide, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, kräftige Hefearomen, Bananen; angenehmer fruchtig-malziger Nachgang

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: 12-07-18 // 500 ml botte. Cloudy darker orange. White head. Good one. Banana creaminess, mild clove. Yeasty creamy. Full bodied.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Refrigerated 0.5 L brown flip-top bottle poured into a weizen glass. Aroma is nice wheat esters, medium body, medium/well carbonated, and good small-bubble lacing. Taste is wheat esters.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: bread, hay, cereal, roasty, chocolate, resin, floral, grass, spruce, citrus, herbs, pale, golden, amber, orange, red, light sweetness, medium sweetness, heavy cloying sweetness, light body, medium body, full body,

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Ar: Clove, black pepper, and underripe bananas; peach skin. Ap: Clear orange; medium head, very dense and with good retention, leaving a finely bubbled, semi-compact, foam cap. T: Tart banana and peach skins; practically no sweetness; clove and a metallic sourness; finishes extremely fast. P: Medium-light body with high carbonation; comes off as watery and dull. O: A beer with the right flavor profile, but the metallic sourness, watery mouthfeel, and dryness really get in the way.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: 0.5 l bottle from ’P&M Getränke’, best before October 2017. Hazy, golden amber with a large, foamy, stable, white head. Sweetish, moderately yeasty-spicy and a little fruity aroma of banana, cloves, pear and some peach. Quite sweet, a little sourish, yeasty-spicy and a bit fruity taste of banana, cloves, pear and hints of vanilla, followed by a short, slightly bitter, a little sourish and moderately yeasty-spicy finish. Medium body, slightly creamy and very effervescent mouthfeel, lively carbonation. Decent Weizen, very quaffable and refreshing, a bit too tame and bland though.
Turbid orange color. with good foam. The aroma is malt, grass hops, a little yeast .. Taste. Malt notes of fruit. A bit of grass hops. bitter aftertaste.

25/9/2019. Draft at Airbräu, Munich Airport centrum. Pours hazy golden orange with a lasting off-white head. Aroma of light spicy hops, malt, corn, fruit, flowers, caramel and a hint of banana. Moderate to medium sweetness and moderate bitterness. Medium body, slight oily/creamy texture, above average carbonation. Finished gassy.

On tap at Airbrau, Munich, Germany, Sunday 10th March. 2019 after bringing Frank, campervan over from UK to Attenkirchen. Pours hazy, gold with a white head. Pleasant soft carbonation, a touch of squidgy tropical fruit, a light bitterness. It's ok, I quite like it.
Tap at Munich Airport, 23rd November 18. Pours a clear beer almost, nice head. Aroma is yeast, clean, grass, nice. Taste is grainy, light caramel, refreshing, very drinkable with lots of flavour.

Ich kann mich erinnern, als ich mit ein paar Kumpels vor der Braukunst live 2013 extra mit der S-Bahn zum Flughafen gefahren bin, um das dortige Bier zu kosten. Leider wurde nur diese eine Sorte angeboten. Es ist ein recht süffiges Bier mit einem angenehmen Malzkörper. Kann man ruhig mehr davon trinken.

[Munich 2018] 500 ml. draft @ Airbräu. Hazy golden with a nice creamy white head. Nose is corn, green, raw, soapy, bit skunk almost seemingly,.. Taste is better, clearly grainy, soapy with some banana, grain, flowers,… Lively bodied with a grainy & soapy feel. Overall not great by Bavarian standards but it passes & it is no chore to drink it.
Draft at the MUC brewpub. Slightly hazy. Comes with a very airy heft. Mild corn malt is the basis, but ambles along with a drinkable, smooth balance. (#7215, 9/2018)

Tap at the brewpub. Hazy orange color with white head. Aroma is classic Helles sweetness and a touch of noble hops, lightly bready. Taste is very bready, grainy, rather sweet, not the cleanest finish. Silky mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Alright, a bit too grainy.
330ml Flasche. Klar und golden mit minimaler Schaumkrone. Süffig. Malzig. Würzig. Ordentlicher Körper. Herber Abgang.

Tap 0.5cl from Airbrau in Munich A - hazy golden yellow with foamy thick white head A - mild malty, hard to get much T - delicious malt, minimal bitter, mild sweet, no sour P - medium light body, creamy light texture, lively carb, great delicious malt multigrain bread finish O - great helles lager very enjoyable
33cl bottle. Hbf 2016. Golden color, thin white head. Grainy, malty earthy notes. Grainy, tasty.
Sample from bottle at HBF 2016, Helsinki. Colour is slightly cloudy golden with small white. Aromas and flavors: Grain, some sweetness, some hops and malts.

Bottle from the brewery getränkemarkt. Pours hazy gold with a tall-building and lasting white head. There’s some chunky yeast globules in the bottom of the bottle that don’t make it into the first pour but on subsequent pours it does turn the experience quite doughy and muddled. Without that, it’s enjoyably hoppy in the aroma, the yeast imparts a musty minerality, and the malt is simple but pleasant baked bread and crackers. Lightly sweet to off-dry with snappy bitterness and some juicy yeast acidity. Decently full mouth feel and lots of froth from the high carbonation, and while the finish is bitter and well-matched and pleasant, the whole effect isn’t all that special. Seems to be well-made, in decent shape, and benefiting from the yeast more than hurt by it.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein leicht trübes goldgelbes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, getreidig, leicht würzig. Geschmack malzig würzig, getreidig, leichte Bitterkeit.

330 ml bottle. BB 05/03/14. From bierzwerg.de. Cloudy pale golden colour with a small to medium sized white head. The aroma is grassy and even sourish hops, moderate bitterness and mild maltiness. The flavour is mild bitterness, grassy hops and grainy malt. Very drinkable. Quite nice.

(bottle) pours a murky golden colour with a frothy white head and lots of yeasty sediment. aroma of talcum powder, chalk, green apple and powdered sugar, quite musty and sweet, with a hint of pale malts and wood varnish. flavour is mostly the same, green apple, powdered sugar and pale malts, otherwise quite empty and overattenuated, with a faintly dry finish. light to medium-bodied with average carbonation.
330ml bottle. Clear golden colour with huge, diminishing, moderately lacing, white head. Grainy and strawy aroma. Taste is dry, grainy, strawy, minimally spicy, husky, dry to bitter hoppy overtones.
Hazy golden color with fine head. Malty flavor slightly bitter some fruits. Creamy.

Bottle. Light golden, hazy, average and mostly diminishing head. Moderate malty - lightly grainy and lightly sweetish aroma, light bread and light sourness - faint chemical notes, light herbal hoppyness. Light to moderate, malty - lightly grainy and lightly sweetish flavor, light bread with light herbal hoppyness. Finish is average, malty - grainy and dryish, faint bread and light sharp metal with light herbal - grassy hoppyness. OK dryish kellerbier, nice dryish hoppy finish - aroma with sour notes is not so seductive.

It’s hazy golden with a creamy, white head. The aroma has notes of vegetables and cardboard. The flavour has a light sweetness and notes of vegetables, straw, malt, cardboard, and the finish is slightly dry.
Bottled. Pale golden. Fruity, but fairly crisp. Traces of pine needles. Low bitterness. Simple, but well balanced.

The commercial description is right about one thing: The flavour is like air, i.e. equally tasteless! Brewed by Tou Bryggeri (now part of the Ringnes group) in my home town Stavanger (I'm ashamed), this beer is one of the summer specials that all Norwegian breweries have been spitting out the last 10 years or so. An utterly meaningless effort: Their standard pilseners (that otherwise dominate the market) are summer beers good enough. I hardly think anyone asked them for a change. But of course, as the American macro brewers always have known: Minimum malts + minimum hops + maximum water = maximum profits. And the unconscious public buy this shit: Named a "summer" brew, people think they're supposed to drink it once air temperature rises above +15 degrees Celsius. No colour (actually slightly hazy), just a little initial aroma, no flavour (well, at least the flavour isn't foul - it just isn't there), no aftertaste. Bad, bad, bad!

column1: Faiseurs de Bière Saint Eloi de Noël
column5: Unclear reddish brown of color with a beige head. An aroma of spice, sweets, raisins,caramel and nuts. A flavor of sweets, spice, hops, raisins and candy.

column1: Faiseurs de Bière Saint Eloi de Noël
column5: Bottle. A hazy, brown body is topped by a small, dense, off-white to beige head. Spiced nose, cardamom and cloves, as well as prunes and caramel. The flavor is spiced, but with a good dash of caramel and dried fruits. Warming, full-bodied and nicely carbonated. Long, warming and spiced finish with dried fruits. A pleasant one, tasteful and pleasing, but too warming. 110129

column1: Faiseurs de Bière Saint Eloi de Noël
column5: Bottle 330ml. [ Trade by fiulijn ]. Clear medium to dark amber color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to beige head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, spicy, spicy - coriander - ginger, moderate hoppy, perfume - soap, light to moderate yeasty, soap - perfume. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate bitter with a long to average duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110129]

column1: Faiseurs de Bière Saint Eloi de Noël
column5: Bottle 330ml @ fonefan Pours muddy with off-white head. Aroma has notes of dark fruits and sour apples. Taste is medium sweet and light sour. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

column1: Faiseurs de Bière Saint Eloi de Noël
column5: Bottle @ Ulfborg Weekend, Jan 2011. Pours unclear amber with a small white head. Nose is christmas spices. Cinnamon and clove. Christmas cake and vomit. One dimensional.

column1: Faiseurs de Bière Saint Eloi de Noël
column5: Bottle at Papsø’s - Thanks. Murkey amber - white head. Banana, fruity, berries, nutty, yeasty, herbal, spicy, sharpness, alcoholic, sharpness.

column1: Faiseurs de Bière Saint Eloi de Noël
column5: Bottle at Papsø. Muddy orange red coloured with a small off-white head. Sweet aroma of caramel and spices with notes of yeast. Sweet flavour of caramel and spices with notes of alcohol. Sweet and spicy finish.

column1: Faiseurs de Bière Saint Eloi de Noël
column5: 33 cL bottle, courtesy of fiulijn. Pours hazy to murky brown with a shorlived head. Aroma is spiced and phenolic, alcohol and roasted malt. Spiced and yeasty. Dry and spiced finish.

column1: Faiseurs de Bière Saint Eloi de Noël
column5: muddy brown, no head. dusty dark fruity aroma. flavor is sweet malty, faint dark fruity, fruity. tasty.

column1: Faiseurs de Bière Saint Eloi de Noël
column5: Bottle vintage 2005 properly brewed in 2003. [Courtesy of fiulijn, another great session @ Papsoe] Large thick beige head with a huge fizzy sounding. That was really a first time that we had heard that noisy a head. Muddy dark golden color. Spare lacework. The first impression that came to mind was beef stroganoff accompanied with heavy dried fruit and dominating spicy and Christmas feel. Medium to full bodied with a lively carbonation. Thick texture with light alcoholic tendency. Moderated sweet flavor with light bitter notes. Sweet fruity finish. That was a strange and very interesting experience, thanks Alex! 31-08-2007
On tap at the brewpub. Hazy yellow gold pour with a white head. Moderately hoppy taste and aroma with a dry, mildly bitter finish. Solid IPA.
From notes: On tap at the brewery it is a clear golden color with a citrus aroma. The taste is grapefruit.
On draft at the brewery. Pours a clear copper with an off white head. Fruity nose. Flavors of citrus and resin, with a dash of salt. Smooth, moderately bitter finish.
Standard IPa. Highlights the hop bite. Pretty balanced here, but unexciting. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft. Poured hazy copper color with an average frothy off-white head that lasted with fair lacing. Moderate sour citrus hop aroma. Medium body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. Moderate bittersweet flavor with a moderate bittersweet finish of medium duration. Good brew.

tap at the Gaylord location - Pours copper-gold with an off-white head. There’s a mild citrus hop aroma. The flavor has strong bitterness backed by a good medium bodied malt profile. The expected long bitter finish is there too. It’s fairly good. It doesn’t stand out for IPAs, but it’s works alright.
Have bought growlers of this because it was so fresh. Decent IPA with hops in both aroma and taste. Medium body and head. Amber color.
Pretty dark color for an IPA, hoppy nose/aroma as expected. Decently hoppy flavored, a bit of malt present. Probably my favorite beer that I have tried at Big Buck.

(From a 5 Liter mini-keg brought back from Michigan for me) Nice pine hop aroma, pours a cloudy brown/amber, with a big fluffy white head. Wow... great hop character, with just enough malts to balance it out. Nice long pine hop finish, a bit of thickness to the mouthfeel. I wish I could get this around me on a regular basis.

On tap at brewery. Aroma is floral, grassy, citrus hopps. Murky apple cider in appearance. Starts sweet and finishes bitter. Med/full bodied. Good aroma but just something a little off on the palate and flavor.

4oz pour at the brewpub. Pours amber with an off-white head. Aroma of light wheat, pale and caramel malts, hints of spices, and some dough. Flavor the same. Average texture. Not my favorite beer of the style.

Appearance: cloudy haze of liquefied white breads, crusts included for some color. Bubbly feeble head. Nose: doughy bready with bananas and a ghost of lemon. Predominantly chewy breads with another ghostly presence of crust for some crunch. Palate: unusual and not particularly pleasant spritzy mouthfeel with lemon bubblies. Bakery fresh breads with watery lemon essence. Banana phenolics disappear as fast as they appear. Final Thoughts: the nose didn’t leave me with much hope for the palate which was about what I expected. Far too thin, watery, and the seltzeresque mouthfeel wasn’t pleasant at all. Wheat beers should be creamy, smooth, and soft on the mouth. My least favorite of the beers I drank during my many visits to Northampton Brewery.
Sour ciruts on palate, gritty uneven wheat flavors, something when kinda wrong in a bad direction. It’s pretty bad unfortunately
The beer poured clear yellow with a note of fruit and spice on the nose. The palate showed some deeper notes of fruits but it had a very sharp bittrness on the finish.
Shared a sampler that had this in it. It had a Miller or Bud appearance with a Miller or Bud taste.

Tap at the brewery. Pale golden beer, thin white head. Light citrusy aroma, lemon, wheaty spice, some faint appley esters, but generall pretty clean. Marshmallowy flavour along with the standard fruit esters. Light citrus hop flavour, low bitterness. Thin bodied, soft testure. Decent summer beer but nothing really amazing either.
This was not undrinkable, but definitely NOT a wheat. Acted more like a relatively vanilla american microbrewed lager, this beer smelled of, well, not wheat. uninspired offering.
On tap at the brewpub. Clear light copper color. It had a nicely fizzy mouthfeel with a mild bitterness at the end.
Pours gold/orange with a thin white head. Smells of caramel and coriander. Tatses of caramel and chewy with some pine and orange on the finish.
Tap at the brewpub. Golden, hazy, no head. Malty aroma, very light on the phenols. Malty flavors with very mild wheat beer character. malty finish.

Excellent style. The Valley's original brewpub. It's best to hang out on their deck on a nice day. The inside bar is nice if you can find a spot. The food is average at best. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Northampton Brewery on 19 April 2010. Definitely a ruby porter rather than a big roasty number. Good condition. Big malty aroma - a little smoky. Some hops on the palate. A little sweet though. Not the best of the Northampton beers for me.
Loved the dynamic this porter presented. Quite possibly one of the best I have sampled. Not too heavy, with a hop presence that was just enough.
The porter pours deep brown with a nice head. It shows notes of chocolate and toasted malt on both the nose and the palate. It does drink quite smooth and the finish is nice and long.
On-tap at the brewpub. Black, with lace. Some bitterness, above average carbonation, creamy mouthfeel.
Shared a sampled that had this in it. It had a nice dark brown color and a nice chocolate aroma, but it was watery.

tap at the brewery. Dark brew with a thich light brown head. Light toasty aroma, cherry fruitiness. A little lacking on dark malt flavours. Some toast and light coffee. Low bitterness but a touch of piny/resiny hop flavour. Some nuttiness as it warms. Pretty bland in general though.
On tap at Noho brewing. Very dark brown. I found it to be a little on the watery side with an inoffensively mild taste.

Faint traces of head don’t last over the coke colored pour. Smoky roastiness contains a tartish backbone in the form of peaches and green grapes. Vinous apple-like tart character fights it off with the potently roasted malts. Very light bodied, fair carbonation.
On tap at the brewpub. Dark red in color with a white head. Malty aroma. Chocolate notes. Chocolate malty flavor. Thin palate.

My Bottom Line: Full-on banana esters eventually let cloves through before light citrus seals this chewy Weizen. Further Personal Perceptions: -A ring of foam surrounds the cloudy beige. -This is not as intensely carbonated as most bottled Weizens, so don’t expect the same fluffy mouthfeel. -The flavor profile is pretty much what you expect from the style. -Wheat flavors aren’t as well defined as in my favorite examples of the style. On tap at Standing Beer Bar 1020.

Bottle bought at the brewery. Hazy golden with a small white head. Banana, some citric aromas as well. Flavours are more spiced, providing a dry finish after the banana impact. Borderline infection case.

On tap at the brewery. Bright yellow, opaque with a medium head. Funky yeast aroma again! With bananas and clove. Creamy and sweet—banana cream pie! Thick, creamy body. Yeast presence is annoying. Buttery, with a tiny rancid-like note. Ok, but a little too funky.

A slightly sour-ish weizen. Again, the same undecipherable Japanese hieriglyphics on the label. No matter. The taste speaks for itself in any language. A very nice, wheaty, true-to-style weizen that is a pleasure to drink. Thanks Mark (MRomero548) for sending me all these quality Japanese brews!
瓶内発酵ビール 色濃いけど味はそんなにこくない

Draught at 1020. Deep golden color with a fine head. Malty nose, bread, oranges, light hop but it comes thru nicely. Bready, malty flavor, rich and thick, smooth, with low bitterness but nice citrus accent from the hops. Nicely enough done, a bit plain but good malt character. Very fruity. Needs more bitterness to shine.
This one's a bit of a dud, though perhaps it's just that I'm not much of a fan of the helles style. A tad overcarbonated and metallic. Weird aftertaste.
Hints of grape? Hmm. Not bad. A little too carbonated for my taste. Pleasant though.

Has a hazy golden color with a small white head. Smell is of light hops. Taste was also of light malts and finished with a light hop bitterness. Overall I was disappointed with the beer as I like the heavier/thicker bocks

Hazy golden orange, whitish sticky head. Fruity nose. All malts, apples, weird metal hints, light to medium bodied. Finishes with small hop bitterness. This is nothing special, Im not very impressed, although it is very drinkable.
Pours a hazy orange with a nice head. Nice, but weak malt aroma. Hearty malt taste, that lingers and is very refreshing.
Slightly hazy, amber, medium head. Aroma shows some pedio, light English yeast. Sweet, amber malts, a touch biscuity, the pedio isn’t showing through much.

Bottle. Quite caramel-forward with some grassy hops, feels a bit more British, not horrible but fairly boring. Probably at the top-end of the omiyage beer range but that is still fairly uninspiring...
Bottle. Amber pour with a thick white head. Grape, banana, tropical fruit, bread, perfume. Light and silky body with nice and balanced carbonation. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Thanks to Bart. Fresh, grassy aromas with some diacetyl notes. Golden yellow color. Mild maltiness, finish is a touch sweet. Medium body. Not bad at all.... but doesn’t really stand out in any way.

Bottle at home bought at Hanadaya. Golden amber coloured, slightly hazy with small beige head. Aroma is fruity, citrus and grassy hops, and also a bit sweet. Taste is fruity but without as much sweetness. End is lemony bitter, but not forcefully so. Quite subtle and pretty nice. Not bad at all.
Tap. Soft caramel and skunk nose. Soft and delicate. Nice low bitter finish. Very drinkable, if a tad nonchalant.
Mild Grapefruit and floral aroma. Golden-copper with off-white head. Cascade hops, fruit and mild lemon Flavor. Balanced with Medium Bitterness.
Bottle from the brewery, 5.5% ABV. Hazy amber, medium white head. Good fruity toffee, both in the mouth and in the nose. Good balance between toffee and fruity hop bitterness.

On tap at the brewery. Medium copper color. Flowery, slightly perfumey aroma, with citrus, hops, fruits. Hoppy, fruity, light flavor. Slightly alcoholic!; with honey. Popcicle like. Ok. It might be good if it weren’t so cold. Rather bland, though.
Deep golden color, eggshell white head, nice hoppy taste and again, a nice feel, rather creamy. Well done! I could drink way too much of this!

Tap the brewery. Clear blond. Big white head. Aroma is wheaty, touch of citrus hoppiness. Taste is crisp and nice. Solid pilsner. Wheaty and hoppy up front, slow fade. Nice and refreshing. Not bad. Ap 3 ar 78 t 8 p 3 o 1415
Super soft pils. Piss straw colour. Light hoppiness. Smooth easy drinking. Bready body.
Mild Grain aroma. Golden with thin head. Saaz hop and mild lemon flavour. Dry finish.
Light gold with a hint of green, similar to a Chardonnay. Foamy white head, grassy perfumy scent. A bit thin, mild flavor of grain and a slight lingering bitterness.

Medium white head. Pale yellow body with carbonation. Light flour and floral hop aroma, very harmonic. Taste is flour, floral clean hops and some rubber. Dry, rubbery aftertaste. Some spice. Normal pilsener, with a decent hop aroma. (0.3l on tap.)
Light yellow color. Pleasant, mild fruit tastes. Seems to go flat quickly...

Tap at the brewery. Dark brown colour, big gold head. Aroma is caramel, quite sweet, nice dark maltiness, bit of chocolate and something sharp. Taste is also initially sharp then settles down. Caramel sweetness, bit of chocolate milk, maybe kahlua. Nice enough.
Bottle from the brewery. Dark brown with a small, tan head. Milky, roasted malts aroma. Rich capuccino flavours with hints of chocolate. Good, though on the sweet side.

Served icy cold at the brewery. Tried to wait for it to warm up... Medium brown color. Yeasty aroma, with some caramel. Caramel flavor, with bitter hops, funky yeast. Slightly metallic, which chocolate. Ok malt—but this yeast overpowers it. Not too interesting. Disappointing.
Biggish creamy beige head. Amber body. Meaty roasty coffee and caramel aroma. Sweet roasty caramel and coffee taste with grainy notes. Dry grainy aftertaste. A nice dunkel. (0.3l on tap.)

Dark brown color. Sweet chcololate malt nose. Smooth, chocolately mouth, with hints of cherry cheescake and faint apples and oranges. Decent chocolatey malt finish. Nice. All these beers are much nicer on tap than in a bottle.

A medium Brown color with a small beige head. Nose is sweet malts with nutty/woody notes in the background. Slight malty sweetness with a lactic acid tartness to it. Follow is a bit tart, this seems to be the Japanese style for Dunkels. I’ve had several that have this odd acidic tartness to them.

Since the label says "Munchener Dark", perhaps this is a munich dunkel - I hear the Japanese are crazy about "black beers". This is above-average but tastes a little lacking in malt. This reminds me of Kostritzer Schwarzbier in its thinness. Good; not great.
I called this a brown ale originally rather than a stout or schwarzbier. Similar to other Japanese dark beers like Asahi Black. A little sweet. Overall, a good beer.
Can. Pale clear yellow pour, with a fizzy white head. Grain, corn, grassy, and watery. Light and non offensive. Not bad for an NA.
Aroma: metallic like aluminium, little weet and malty Appearance: golden, clear, minimal head, white foam disappears quickly Taste: Sweet, metallic Palate: light body, thin feel, lively carbonation,

Aroma is hay and grass. A bit of a yeastiness came out as it warmed. Rather muted. Clear yellow with golden depth and a full white head that faces quickly to a collar. Taste is hay, with moderate bitterness. Some aspects of smoothness in the back. An off lemon-polish aspect at the death. Certainly, there are worse NAs than this. [p.s. - raising the score a bit as I had a couple more of these as my brother left a twelve pack and they are sitting around. There is a rounded flavor to this and it lacks many of the harsh characteristics of many NAs and even cheap lagers. Have to say, his text to me that it is the first NA that taste like the real one scared me a bit.] [p.p.s.....may I never re-rate another non-alc in my life!]

Can. Brilliantly clear straw yellow. Tall white foamy headstand. Aroma of hay, corn, grass, grain. Flavor is corn, grass, cardboard, grains. Low bitterness. Light bodied. For what it is, it’s not bad. Not great by any means but not bad either.

I am rating this beer in comparison to what’s available not compared to alcoholic beer. Pours a light clear gold color with big head that settled down quickly to a minimal head. Aroma is of yeast and light malts. Taste follows the aroma and has a light mouth feel. Taste slightly sweet . very similar to Pabst Blue ribbon without a slight alcohol smoothness and taste. If you wouldn’t know it you might not no its none alcoholic beer.

can @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Clear light-medium amber, ivory head that shrinks to a cover, waves of lace. Taste is mild malt, light carbonation, and minimal hops. Actually quite drinkable as an NA,, but well short of traditional brews.
Straight outa the can, ’cause that’s the way you do it. Yellow, fizzy, taste of corn and aluminum.

Poured from a can into a pint glass. This beer is a very thin yellow color with a small white head. It has almost no aroma. The taste is actually not bad for a non-alcoholic brew, it has a faint beer flavor and it doesn’t have that often characteristic bad aftertaste Overall: this brew certainly would work for someone who is the designated driver and it is much better than O’Doul’s and Coors N/A.

12oz can, thanks to Chudwick. Date on bottom of the can reads Dec 08 14. Wow, I dig that there’s actually a legible date under this thing. Clear pale golden color, with some bigger bubbles on the side of the glass. Bigger airy white head upon pouring, that audibly fizzes away to a respectable thin (albeit bubbly and airy) amount, leaving some splotches of lace. Big bready burnt popcorn aroma that I’m beginning to associate with these NAs. What is that about? Just an intense, rough corn flavor that doesn’t ferment out? Definitely seeing a pattern, here. Moderate sweet taste, light bitter, and a sort of rough spicy bite. Seems to have a better doughy malt profile than other NAs I’ve recently tasted, though. Medium body, sort of slick, with a rough texture to it. Sort of soft, lighter carbonation. Leaves a sort of dry roughness on my teeth. Overall, disappointing and bad in the way most macro NAs are. I think I like this one slightly better than most, it’s not 100% repulsive. Maybe it’s fresher? Got to love the date codes.

Pours a clear yellow with a thick and frothy eggshell head. Average, but acceptable. Aroma is barely noticeable, malty and a bit fruity, not at all impressive. Malty flavor seems watered down - might as well be water with a little beer mixed in. Texture is watery and barely fizzy. Well, I had to try it. Nein danke - gimme a Sweetwater.

(bottle) very hazy deep golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of heavy caramelized wheat and overripe peaches, slightly metallic and grassy, with a light touch of clove and some peanuts. flavour is mostly bubble gum and beef broth, with some more wheat, apple juice and mushy peas in the light-bitter grassy finish. medium-bodied with fizzy carbonation. some weird stuff right here.

caramel, bread, pale, golden, amber, orange, clear, hazy, cloudy, rocky head, frothy, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium bitterness, very bitter, lightly sour, medium sourness,
Orangefarben im Glas. Fruchtig frischer Antrunk, schön hefiger Körper mit feinen Bananennoten. Süffig.
Trübes goldgelbes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, fruchtig. Geschmack hefig, fruchtig, minimale Würzigkeit.
Tap at the brewery Keller, hazy amber with a big white head and aromas of banana, lemon and pepper. Dry fruity body with banana and hop notes. One of the better Fraconian ersatz weissebiers!
A cloudy yellow beer with medium head. Nose is very fruity on over roped apple, banana, near a weizen bock nose.
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is butterscotsch, malt, hop. Flavour is butterscotsch, malt, orange, banana. Bad beer.

Bottle 500ml. Clear medium orange to yellow colour with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, light to moderate yeasty, sweet fruity yeast, moderate buttery. Flavour is moderate to light light heavy sweet with a average duration, buttery, sweet butter. Body is medium, texture is watery - creamy, carbonation is soft. [20120217]
Bottle. Clear golden with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, butter, wheat and yeast. Flavour is malt, medium sweet, yeast, butter, wheat and a little banana.
Bottle @ Fastelavnssmagning 2012, Ulfborg. Pours hazy golden with a small white head. Nose is citrus, wheat and banana. Sweet flavor with baked bread, wheat, banana and citrus. Butter underneath
Tap at Kellerwald. Deep amber-orange with a tall head and light haze. Nutty malt nose, light caramel, bready. Spicy hops and some peaches and apples. Light and spicy flavor, nutty, dry, minerally.
Bottle from Landbierparadies. Hazy dark amber/brownish colour, beige foam. Nose of roasted malts, sweet malts, bread, light bitter. Well balanced and nice Bier!
500ml Bottle - Amber with a small head. Biscuity aroma with nuts, caramel and dried apricot. Nicely balanced taste with walnuts, caramel, dates and sultanas detected.
The foam stability is good, body red, brwonish. The Aroma is darkmalty, maltaromatic, light hops. The taste is malty, darkmalty, nice maltiness, light roast, few hops. Nice!
Braun, goldbraun süffig anders wenig gehopft gut zu trinken feine perlensosse.

500ml bottle. Clear, dark copper colour with average to huge, thick, creamy, moderately lasting and lacing, white head. Minimally waxy, grassy, hoppy aroma, hints of protein, rather neutral malty background. Taste is floral hoppy and caramel malty, notes of Earl Grey tea, bergamot, a touch of hazelnut and nougat. Funny composition.
Keg gravity at Moor Bermondsey. Amber with a lacing head and typisch malty-sweet and grassy-bitter aromas. Lightly nutty and malty body, light dry bitterness. Nice.

From barrel at Moor. It clear golden with a small white head. The aroma is soft, sweet, bready, brioche, sponge cake, oily, grassy and straw. The taste is dry, soft, sweet, oily, bready, brioche, grassy, green, almond, sponge cake, herbal vibes, straw and sweet banana with a soft finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Nice stuff.
Draught @ Brewery. Pours Hazy amber with a White head. Caramelly and bready. Slight Grassy stale hops. Smooth and Good level of carbonation.
on tap oro carico quasi ambrata velata buona schiuma piuttosto persistente note maltate un filo tostato caramello buona secchezza leggero erbaceo amaro medio

(bottle) slightly opalescent golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of honey-tinged grain and candle wax, with a very light hint of cauliflower and some powdered sugar. flavour is more starchy malts and powdered sugar, slightly yeasty and belgian, with a light floral hoppiness and some msg in the finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.
The foam stabklity is medium, body gold and clear. The Aroma is malty, hoppy, flowery. The taste is malty, hoppy, herb, a bit floral. Easy going, fresh.
Aroma is nice hop profile with some light marille fruitiness, less herbal and some green stuff. Taste is sour wheaty with note much character. Juicy. Ok.
Bottle. Light hazy yellow, fast disappearing head. Neutral light aroma. Light grainy flavor, very little hops, hint of sweetness. Very mild beer
Bottle. Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma is cereals, grainy, rather sweet. Taste is cereals, rather sweet again, light grassy hops. Silky mouthfeel with natural carbonation.

500ml bottle. Slightly cloudy, orangey golden colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Strawy, grainy and sweet-ish, malty aroma, cautious floral hoppy overtones with a touch of pollen and honey. Taste is sweet-ish, spicy malty, minimally grainy and strawy, a fruity touch of pear and yellow apple, mirabelle, cautious floral hoppy overtones. Quite rich and complex for the style, nice subtleties which require a certain degree of attention. Whereas "grainy" and "strawy" in most cases are adjectives with pejorative connotation due to a certain mustiness, I use them here in at least a neutral way - not as a sign of impureness nor displeasure. Good.

Bottle.cloudy yellow, low eggshell head. Juicy grainy malt aroma, a hint banana even. Medium body, chewy mellow mouthfeel, fruity sweetness, light hay and grain, well balanced hop counterpoint. Quite drinkable and moreish.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of grains, apples, slight marzipan notes, dusty, a bit fruity. Taste is bitter with grains, apples, dusty, fruity, slight bready and a touch of flowery hops - honey melon.

Bottle @ Oberfranken Neuheiten, Summer Bottleshare Odense, Summer 2018. Pours hazy yellow with a small creamy head. Cellar, dusty malts, grains and grass beneath. Some good white bready malts - slight green apple also unfortunately.
Summer Sunday @ Dolle. Hazy golden with a lasting white head. Bready malt aroma with a touch of red apples. Sweet malty flavour with a fruity touch of apple, and a hint of grassy hops in the finish.
Bright gold in colour with smll white head, sulphur and hops bitterness. Caramel malt aroma. Just average.

Slightly hazy, pale golden colour, thin white head. Low to no aroma. Pretty standard attempt at a macro beer. Flavour is a little rough around the edges, grassy hops with a bit of a stale cheesey component as well. Bad.

Hog Blonde is a nice simple beer that makes deceptively easy drinking. While it doesn't present the punchier qualities expected in a pilsener, it's still a good drop. Pours lightly hazy pale straw with very small head. Low/medium carbonation. There's a strong "fields of wheat" and cut grass aroma with a mellow fresh malt fruitiness. An inviting combo. The taste is fresh'n'fruity with mild clover honey but is rather less impressive than the aroma. There's not enough hops used here. The mouthfeel is smooth, not very zingy, but still with a nice creaminess. There's not too much aftertaste and again, not very bitter. What you get is a hit of malt sweetness with a distant dryness and the mearest hint of bitterness. Smooth and fresh in the mouth, and still refreshing, this makes a good quaffer on a mild day. A mellow beer for a mellow mood, or social gathering, I could drink a lot of this. Great with brunch, antipasto or a sandwich with mustard in it. Serve cold.
after starting new years eve in christchurch with some dux de lux beers, this was quite a comedown. this beer tasted to me entirely of lemonade with some onion thrown in. thin alright

this is my new least favourite beer. it tastes precisely like melted down icecubes. small amount of saazy bitterness struggles to get above the freezer matured taste. yellow and doesnt keep a head. a complete disgrace, even worse than outback.

Very pale yellow with a rockiness in the head that presents well initially. The appearance is not great at first as there are many lemonadey type bubbles that eventually give way to the preferred beading. The nose has a definite hint of hop that could promise a bit more. The taste suggests that they have borrowed a small cupfull of hops from the Czechs (as opposed to the claim that they stole this from them and improved on it). There is a hint of butter that detracts from the necessary clean finish expected of a pisener.
A rather mediocre continental-style pils. Straw coloured, slight bitterness to start, with a sweet maltiness to follow.
750ml bottle at Brian's. Pours a bit hazy pale golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet with honey notes. Similar taste with some hoppy bitterness. Nice.
Bottle - Sweet honey and a touch of higher alcohol. Clearish gold. Honey and some woody notes with nice body.

750ml bottle @ hoem. Pours a clear golden colour with no head. Nose is honey nectar, light band-aids, and boozey notes. Flavour is floral, sweet honey, and a boozey character. Medium bodied, no carbonation, and a big sweetness. Delicious and dangerous.
750mL bottle from Vintage Wines. Floral aromas, honey. Clear deep gold. Sweet, light brush with citrusy hops in the mid-palate. Full bodied.

750mL bottle, pours a clear pale golden. Aroma brings out nice alcoholic notes, honey nectar, bandaid and some light floral notes. Flavour is very unusual, with lots of perfumey floral hops, light smoke, some licorice, and some nectar. A little phenolic, and there are some bandaid and plastic notes. Something rather off here.

Pretty good stuff. Sweet and strong. Aroma is honey, brandy, oak, tobacco. Flavor’s similar to nose, with sweet on top, followed by those other qualities. Even has a bit of burn in the finish, which I kind of like. Very clean. Maybe for sipping after dinner in hot weather, otherwise a dream come true for cold weather.

Smells of honey, leather, and alcohol, some faint floral notes. Taste is mainly honey, some dried fruit/raisins, a bit of boozy warmth at the back. Shame that it’s May, this would be amazing in the winter. Excellent either way.
Bottle. Crystal clear golden color. Floral aroma with light herbs. Taste is sweet, flora, subtle alcohol, slightly medicinal finish. Tasty enough.

70 cl bottle @ Sankt Hans Tasting, Ulfborg.Aroma has chlorine, some honey tones and mild alcohol tones. Also bad homemade white wine. Flavour has rather sweet and strong honey notes, mild chlorine and hints of root beer. Hides the ABV well - alchol kicks in the finish though. Liquid honey.
Bottle thanks to fonefan. Golden colored with no head. Sweet floral and fruity aroma. Fruity and floral a bit spicy flavour.

355 ml can from Metro grocery store. Pours a clear gold with tiny white cap. Aroma of wet straw (maybe some wet dog too). Taste is quite sweet with plenty of that wet straw character. Little bit of bitterness in the finish. That’s 2 of 4 raters who bought this for a pregnant wife. Not sure we were doing the ladies any favours.
Grainy, wet paper nose. Sparkling gold with a soda like head. Tastes really grainy with rice and hay. Very spritzy with wet paper aftertaste. Not good at all.
Very flat hops presence, light-moderate malt and basically no balls. Man this beer is weak!

I bought this because my wife is pregnant and on a killer hot day I thought it would be nice if we could share a beer. Really, this is bad, but not disgustingly bad. I would rate it fairly high for non-alc beers, but in general, it has to be rated poorly. It has an over-sweet aroma. It looks like generis pap. The flaour wasn't horrible, but only vaguely beer-like. No aftertaste.

2 February 2019. At Brugs Bierfestival. Cheers to tderoeck, 77ships, Jerre, Kevin & Anke! Clear pale golden with a lasting, thin, foamy, white head; little lacing. Aroma of white pepper, white bread, apricot, banana, cheese, soy milk, honey, grain, weird note of plasticine. Taste is light fruity sweet, quite estery, notes of unripe banana & apple peel, some white bread; light to medium grainy bitter middle, bit 'raw' & yeasty, grassy touch, faint honey. Dry, grainy finish, faintly grassy hoppy, lingering white bread & banana. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Okay, better than any industrial Pale Lager or so, but nothing more.
Bottle from LDW, Eke. Hazy golden colour, white foam. Nose of iron, skunk, wet cardboard. Taste is light sweet, bitter, very metallic. Not very nice.

Small bottles at home. Clear golden colour with a dense white head. Nice aroma of bready yeast and noble hop. Sweet start with a generous bitter follow. More bread malt character with bitter hop notes in the taste. Fairly light carbonation and a good mouthfeel makes this a rich, satisfying beer.
At ZBF17. Poured blond with a firm white head. Aroma is malts, honey, a bit grain. Taste has honey, sweet malts, grain. Sweet and a bit bitter finish.
Bottle shared by Dan n thanks. No head and pale clowdy yellow color. Big almond and apply aroma. Big bitterness for a Belgian ale.ä

Kerelsbier BlondF: big, white, creamy, average lasting. C: yellow, light hazy. A: malty, bread, grassy, floral, hint of caramel. T: malty, floral/grassy hoppy, light dry crispy on the palate, light bread, clear taste and good bitterness, medium body, good carbonation, more than average and tasty beer, 250ml bottle from Spar in Poperinge.

Bottle shared at Kings night avoidance tasting. Clear golden with a small off white head. Aroma of malt, light caramel and light yeast, a little chemical. Flavour is light moderate sweet and bitter. Above light bodied with light carbonation.
25cl bottle shared at Kings Night Avoidance Tasting. Thin white head. Hazy golden pour. A bit dull.

Bottle. Mine speaks of being brewed by Leroy . Guess they are a bit tied together with SAS and Van Eecke. Anyways, same ABV, same name, different label and brewer. Pours clear blonde, head fades instantly. Smell is malty, some lageryeast. bit sweet, mildly chemical. Taste ; enters rather bitter, but turns more intense towards the malty, typical lager backbone. Crispy, feels more natural than the common lagers. Easy drinkable, good carbo.
Bière blonde titrant 6.4° couleur Or bière limpide Arôme & gout de froment, d’orge, de foin. Style pils arrière goût métallique peu savoureuse
Cask Handpump at the Mill Hotel, Chester 21/03/2003 Copper amber coloured with some sour fruit aroma. Nutty flavour. Hop finish.
Cask Conditioned, at the GBBF, 2004. Amber with no head to mention. Stagnant tap water aroma which isn’t necessarily a criticism. A basic bitter with some west-country nuances.
