column5: On tap at the brewub. God but somewhat overated stout. Still good flaour for sessionable rated abv. Three eigths of retained mocha head on dark brown body. Lots of chocolate, very chocolately in fact. Some licorice, 31 ibu.Above average mouthfeel. Coco and malt aroma.

column1: Rocky River Oompa Loompa Chocolate Stout
column5: Sample at the Cleveland International Beer Fest on 5/14/11. Black pour with a medium tan head. Roasty aroma with fruit and chocolate. Roasty flavor up front, but quickly turns to chocolate syrup without being overly sweet (not ST Choklat). Nice, dry roasty finish.

column1: Rocky River Oompa Loompa Chocolate Stout
column5: We had dinner at Rocky River and watched the Kentucky Derby 2011. The stout was excellent. The color was jet black with no head. The medium body stout was pleasing to drink with roasted malt and chocolate flavors. We also detected some hint of cherries. this was one of the top stouts of our four day trip. Animal Kingdom won the derby.

column1: Rocky River Northern Lights German Helles Alt
column5: Wow, this is one hoppy alt. The best way to describe the effect of thids beer is to let a very nice IPA mellow for a wee bit. You notice the hops but they don’t take over. I’ll post a better review when time and sobriety allow. Good beer to all those who are concerned though.

column1: Rocky River Northern Lights German Helles Alt
column5: Goodbar beer club. Nose is slightly chocolate, rye, piney hops, resin, maybe a little orange. Flavor is iced tea, malt. Very hoppy for an alt. Bitter caramel finish.

column1: Rocky River Northern Lights German Helles Alt
column5: Crystal clear apple juice body with white head, nice lacing. Aroma is medium sweet, grassy, some spice, light bread. Taste is medium sweet, spicy/grassy. Light body, nice crispness.

column1: Rocky River Northern Lights German Helles Alt
column5: Dark copper color. Mild maltiness in the nose. Touch of hoppy zest. Pleasant, semi sweet bready malt body. Tangy hops with a touch of citrus character. Very drinkable.

column1: Rocky River Northern Lights German Helles Alt
column5: Copper in color with a nice white bubbly head, dry finish, very clean beer, malty flavors but lots of hoppiness as well, very drinkable & pleasant beer

column1: Rocky River Northern Lights German Helles Alt
column5: Copper colored body with an off-white head. Lots of lacing. Clean malt smell with a slight hop aroma. Pronounced hop taste. Sweet malt balances nicely. Lingering hop bitterness. Medium bodied with a long finish.

column1: Rocky River Northern Lights German Helles Alt
column5: 8/22/03: on tap at the Rocky River Brewing Co. moderate fruit aroma. light orange-copper body. medium lacing. malt with some nice hop flavors. hints of florals. not bad.

column1: Rocky River Northern Lights German Helles Alt
column5: thick and smooth, but with a nice hop bite. lightly toasty malt flavor. this was o.k.

column1: Rocky River Northern Lights German Helles Alt
column5: Sort of like an IPA/pils aroma, hoppy and sweet. Wierd yellow brown color with nice head. Smooth, creamy palate. Hoppy flavor, some malt, bitter finish. Sort of tasted like an alt but something not quite right.

Medium offwhite head. Yellow body with carbonation. Dryish grassy hop taste. Very soft, no aftertaste, very little taste overall. Traces of apple and water. Dry empty aftertaste. Definitely among the better happoshus, which doesn’t say much. (0.35l can.)

Can. Light yellow colour. Quite waterish aroma of some maltish thing, hoppish and metal, which comes again in the flavour with a very waterish mouthfeel. Then again, this is not real beer according to Japanese law, its a happushu........sheiyt!

Harsh ratings are indeed in order--this one tasted, in short, like a super-sweet "Miller High Life". But in more detail: aroma was of sweet malt and corn, the flavors were similarly malty and corn-laden. This was an extremely watery brew, easy to consume rapidly, but such a pace is necessary, as this one is certainly not anything to savor. Perhaps the only redeeming quailty is the 5.5% abv, though I seemed to get a headache soon after taking the first sip.
maybe its just because i’ve been drinking taiwan beer daily, but i got this one on special at 7-11 and it tastes mighty fine. those are some harsh ratings preceding me.
kono biru wa amari oishikunai kedo, motto yasui. moshi okane ga nai to kattahougaiidayo.
Pretty bad really. Nothing much to say about it.............................
Can in Kyoto, Japan. Almost clear yellow with a diminishing white head. A light, somewhat tangy, weak flavor but interesting on palate which I would describe as almost sticky.
Another US Macrobrew clone. Not very good...................................
A decent beer. Had this one in Nagoya, Japan. It’s not that special in flavor, but the text on the can makes it well worth the experience.
I did enjoy trying all these Japanese beers but there just isn't much to them. Just Japanese versions of Bud and Miller.
Cloudy golden coloured. Exotic mango aroma. A very complex and nice pilsener. Sweet notes of honey are well balanced with bitter hop notes. Also rather spicy and grassy.

[Bottled - around 1½ years old] The aroma is very nicely hoppy and grassy - very fresh. The color is an unclear orange and it has a small disappearing head. The flavor is very complex; slighly sour, grassy, hoppy, and sweet honey. An OK beer - but probably better fresh from tap. Thanks a lot to Alex (fiulijn) for bringing this to a sampling session.

Draught, 2002-06-06, 6-4-9-5-17 Blond pilsner. Light aroma, but powerful mouth, incredible body for this kind of beer, good malt, honeyish, smooth, enough sweet, powerful hop finish (taste and aftertaste). A delight. 37 IBU Bottle 2 years old, 2004-01-28, 8-4-8-4-14 Cloudy blond color. Delicate hop; cheesy nose. Dry, bitter taste, quite similar sensation as an Orval (the old hops…). Old but still enjoyable.
cloudy orange colour, few head, fruity (apricot, apple) and floral, full, sweet, late bitterness, long dry bitter fruity finish
Bought for supporting a good case.Nothing exciting about the beer. Mainstream pilsener.

A Danish lager without special traits. Light in color and taste. For each sold beer it takes 0,25 DKK to Salmon Foundation, which works to bring wild salmon back in the Danish streams. For that reason I will give an extra point.
Golden color with very small white head. Malty aroma. Thin malty and sweet flavor.
13.10.2005. 0,33l Bottle. Hotell svanen, Billund. Golden yellow with white head.
Dark golden with tiny short lasting head. Light malty and grainy aroma. Flavor is somewhat sweet with grassy notes. Boring stuff..
Golden with an Ok head. The aroma is like wet grain and the flavour is like the mash. It has a very light, bitter finish - yuck 1752
Bottle. Medium head with medium duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are sweet malt and hops with notes of honey.
33 cL bottle. Pours clear golden orange with a white, slight off-white head. Quite sweet malty aroma. Caramel malty flavour, minor mouldy note. Mild and slight sweet finish.
Clear golden body. Malt aroma. Uninteresting light malty taste with a little bitterness in the finish.
Dark golden colour with off-white head.German style pilsner with taste of caramel and malt watery and thin beer.
Guldig med litet skum! Maltig och lika tråkig som de flesta öl från harboe tyvärr! Inget vidare!

Bottle from Netto in Århus. Pours a darkish gold with a fast vanishing head and a cereal aroma. Malty body, light hoppiness, faint spice notes, slight bitterness in the aftertaste, a bit too gassy and sweet, otherwise it would be a decent lager.
Bottle. Clear yellow, with a small white head. Malty sweet, sort of adjuncty, bit cardboardish. Not very enjoyable; Harboe’s regular pilsener is better if you’re looking for a cheap summer beer.
Bottle from Netto. Clear gold, not much of an aroma. Nice taste, though, as a thirst-quencher this is passable. Malty, a little hoppy bite.

330 ml bottle, from NETTO. ABV is 5.7%. Golden colour, large to medium white head. The aroma has first some sweetish malts and grassy and herbal hops, and is better than I feared - then the usual Harboe notes of wet cardboard set in. The flavour is first sugary sweeet, then I get a hint of grassy hops, before the finish with dust and cardboard. Sure, my expectations were low, but I suppose Harboe would be capable of making an even worse show of it. At least the beer was cheap ...
A nice mixture of ascorbic acid and glucose syrup, which makes this otherwise ok lagers to once sugar watery beer.

Bottle.Pours clear golden with an off-white head.Aroma of malt, something strange- kinda like wet hay , fruitiness and yeast.Flavor is sweet and malty with some fruitiness.Medium body, soft carbonation.A beer that offers no resistance.

Bottle 330ml @ Hotel room, Radisson Blu Aarhus Pours clear golden with a off-white head. Aroma is malty with notes of sugar. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter. Bod is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.
08.09.2006. 0,33l Bottle. Rema 1000, Billund. Golden yellow colour with white head.
Bottle. Pours golden with a small white head. The aroma is caramel, light metal and some fruit. The flavour is metallic with sweet caramel notes. Light fruity and caramel finish.
From old tasting notes. Amber orange color. Thick foamy beige head.msoft caramel malt nose. Bittersweet toasted malt flavor. Chewy mouthfeel.

Name: Brasal Special Amber Lager Date: 06/01/2005 Mode: Bottle Source: DC dark clear amber, whispy head, sweet alcoholic aroma, thin body, big sweet malt flavor, oxidized, Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.
(Bottle) Pours a medium almonde head and a copper body. Aroma of roasted malt. Malt flavours with slight hops. Above average.
Sparkling brown,off white head. Tiny bead. malt nose. Clean smooth and malty throughout.
This was a really good beer. Too bad the brewery went belly up.............
Pleasant bocky-molasses aroma. Hazy auburn beer with no head to speak of. Balanced -- not too hoppy, too tart or too sweet. Good amber malt character.
Medium copper color, way malty!!!, 6.1% alcohol-almost a malt liquor, I got a fierce headache while tasting this. Could be better as the malt is a bit strong.

Cask Conditioned at The Peyton Arms, Stoke Lyne, Oxon. Brown red beer with thin head. Sharp, acidic cidery beer with a tinny background. Tastes like a rushed attempt to get a beer out for the celebrations, could have done with storing. (from notes)
Dark brown/ Red in colour, very small head, typical English ale. Very boring beer to celebrate the queens jubilee.

What a curious beer. Quickly dissipating head on top of a nice dark ale (I expected, as in other breweries' Jubilee beers that it would be more "Golden"- quasi lager). Rich aroma, albeit slightly metallic. Flavor packed a punch: first flavor was a protruding smokiness in the early finish that really surprised me. That mellowed, but the bitterness remained, and as I went through the pint, the sweetness (initially a nice contrast) became a bit annoying. Good body, but provided mostly by the carbonation. Once that was gone, this was less satisfying. (Bottle, albeit purchased at the brewery...rated the night of the concluding Jubilee celebrations, with a toast to the Queen).

Tried cask conditioned. This beer was brewed especially for the Golden Jubilee, in June 2002. The beer is a dark brown, with strong bitter flavours with a heavy body. It’s surprising that Hook Norton would brew a beer dark beer, similar to an old ale for this summer event. I should imagine this wouldn’t be bad in colder weather, however.

Keg at the Glanyrafon Arms, Talgarreg, Ceredigion. Amber with a thick white head. Fruity, creamy and smooth. Inoffensive, and actually not too bad for a keg bitter. Much better than I expected (although given my expectations this wasn't hard!).
My favourite pint! Like drinking milk! Absolutely gorgeous, easy to drink malty pint. Nice aroma, no long lasting after taste. Really more-ish. 10/10 would recommend.
Dark Amber with foamy beige head Mild aroma is any Flava is grainy malty Feels light to medium with little fizz(cask) Finishes mildly grainy
Very smooth clean almost no flavor. definite creamy. Easy drinking bitter. WIth no bitter. Nice lasting head.

Pint @ Constitution Hill,Aberystwyth. Miedziany kolor z delikatną ,biała,kremowa piana. Dominują słody, delikatne nuty słomy i trawy trochę orzecha ,biszkoptów i ciastek. Wszystko raczej wodniste i łatwe do zapomnienia....zwłaszcza przy takim widoku
Half pint @ Holiday Inn Express Cardiff Bay. A bit strange bitter: metallic features, some hay. Bitter but not delicious finish.

From the old notebook with beers of my youth. This was ubiquitous, in pubs also. As with all ‘creamy’ bitters of this era it was basically a beery water with a hint of hop, but this one had a touch of more caramel toffee malt than some. Still crap though.
Kobber klar skum råhvid tæt malt korn grønblomst Bitter lidt sød lidt Vandede flad @ rmc Portsmouth

Can, 500 ml. Molson-Coors, so i didn't have high expectations. Copper colour, faint clear malt nose, creamy taste. Smooth and watery palate, no aftertaste at all, don't drink this in any circumstainces.

From keg at Indian Restaurant in Leicester, 22.05.18. Hazy orange. Dense, creamy and persistent head. Some lacing. Aroma and taste of acid malt, autodialycis, oxidation, caramel and strawberry jam as the ale gets warmer. Meh-!

column2: originally Shenyang, now various locations, China
column4: China Resources Snow Breweries (CR Beer - Heineken)
column5: A very pale low-alcohol (2.5%) beer. A white, slightly frothy head. Very light with a very slight aroma of hops. The taste is of extremely mild sweetish malts without any bitterness. A very light beer with little flavour.

column2: originally Shenyang, now various locations, China
column4: China Resources Snow Breweries (CR Beer - Heineken)
column5: Bottle. Very pale golden pour, no head. Mild nose, a little malty. Crisp taste, lightly malty finish, with a light body. Average carbonation. Decent beer.

column2: originally Shenyang, now various locations, China
column4: China Resources Snow Breweries (CR Beer - Heineken)
column5: This beer is the most variable of the Chinese beers. Sometimes it passes as a half-decent pale lager, while in the worst times it can deliver an instant gag in a bottle, thick, soapy and metallic. Avoid it in cans - in them this brew tastes HEAVILY metallic.

column2: originally Shenyang, now various locations, China
column4: China Resources Snow Breweries (CR Beer - Heineken)
column5: It's good to see there are other Chinese beers out there besides Tsingtao. Anyway, this was watery, fizzy and crisp. A predictable asian beer, but the label is cool, so I recommend it.

column1: Cheshire Cat Tom Cat Brown Ale
column5: Draught. Medium amber. Aroma is lightly malty (caramel), moderately hoppy (grapefruit). Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Previously known as Hoppy Cat, for a reason. Why infect a brown ale with grapefruit juice?

column1: Cheshire Cat Fat Cat Strong Ale
column5: On tap @ Cheshire Cat poured a clear brown with a small lasting amber head. Aromas of carmel, toffee and a hint of nuts. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of carmel, toffee, toasted malt and a hint of smoke with a smooth finish.

column1: Cheshire Cat Fat Cat Strong Ale
column5: Draught. Medium amber. Aroma is moderately malty (toasted light bread, caramel), moderately hoppy (citrus - orange and grapefruit), with notes of plum and honey. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter, lightly acidic. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly bitter, lightly acidic. Light to medium body, watery texture, soft carbonation. Along with the Arrogant Brit, another accurate and pleasant English-style brew.

What can I say about this beer, it was so low-key. In a bad way. It smelled and tasted like cereal. Color was an amber-reddish hue and the head was practically non-existent. That could have been due to a bad growler fill as there was lots of space at the top. This was a boring beer and made me mad that I drove across town to get a growler. I swear their beers used to be better or my palate has changed. Either way, I did not enjoy this beer. Serving type: growler Reviewed on: 06-11-2007 21:31:02

on hand pump-pours an off white head that bubbles and mahogany color. Aroma is faint medium malt-some sweet. Taste is mild medium malt –some sweet, secondary metallic hops. Light side of medium body. May be English style, not sure, but it doesn’t work for me.
On cask @ Cheshire Cat poured a clear amber with a large, long lasting off white head. Aroma was malty and nutty. Palate was light and smooth. Flavor was nutty and malty with a smooth finish.
Cask. ......lightly malty, citusry hop aroma.......Copper, creamy, long lasting head..........Classic ESB flavor - malty with flowery hoppiness.......low carbonation, smooth........Great cask ESB!

On tap GABF '02: Clear orange with a frothy head. Light malty and hops taste. Sweet malt and flowery if you really want to know. Watery mouthfeel. Ends bitter and sour. I could see how a bitter drinker may like this, but to me it was weak, watery and not exciting in any way. Of course, I remember meeting a fellow GABF'er (that sounds obscene!) in an elevator, he asked me my favorite beers and than gasped in horror when I told him. He only really likes traditional English Pale Ales; Mild ones and then ran from me. Heh heh. Scaring people is cool.

Draught. Light amber. Aroma is moderately malty (light bread), lightly hoppy (flowers), with a light note of peach and toffee. Flavor is lightly sweet, lightly bitter, lightly acidic. Finish is lightly bitter, lightly acidic. Light to medium body, watery texture, soft carbonation. A very pleasant and delicate British bitter. Very quaffable. A little more alcohol than a typical English bitter.
Dark and clear with red hues. Low, smooth carbonation. Sweet and chewy with a bit of roast. Finish is wet and lingering with notes of chocolate and hints -- hints I say -- of fruit.
On tap GABF '02: Hmmm...Chocolate. D'oh! Flat. Wuhoo! Clear dark brown with a nice head. D'ohh! Boring light porter taste. Better than the sum of its parts.

Draught. Dark brown to black. Aroma is moderately malty (light bread, roasted grain, dark chocolate, mild coffee), with a note of raisin. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Needs more bitterness to balance it, but it's pleasant.

Draught. Medium yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (light bread, cereal), lightly hoppy (flowers), lightly yeasty (dough). Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic. Finish is moderately acidic. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Marketed as a German wheat, but the lack of clove/banana esters puts this one in the more lackluster American wheat category for me. The acidity is of the rather dull/unfresh variety, not the zesty and refreshing type, so this may have been an old keg.
Dark golden with a clean white foam. Skunky hop aroma. Fantastic hop flavor ,very clean taste, and finishes bitter. Extremely drinkable. Thinker

Had on draft at the tiny brewery. A great little joint in a cool town. Bright golden with aroma of sweet fruit and floral hops. Nice balance with a light hop finish. Crisp and citrus. More of a pale ale, but a very delicious beer in a place with low expectations. After drinking Coors products at their tour, this one sure hits the spot.

On tap at the Golden City Brew Pub. On the beer list as their ’Evolution IPA’. Poured a medium and cloudy golden color with a smaller sized off white head. Aromas and tastes of citrus, grass, with a light grapefruit finish. Light caramel as well.
tap at brewery. very crisp aroma of big citrus hops and roasted malts. Grassy hops on the palate, caramel. a little metallic in the bit but overall not to bad. nice body.

On tap at the Falling Rock Taphouse, Denver, 4/15/06: Hop oil aroma explodes to the nostrils with super strong power. Interestingly, this is still a bit watery such a big beer. It’s orange/rusty with a thin head.

On tap @ Cheshire Cat poured a clear copper with a lasting white head. Aromas of citrus, pine and a hint of carmel. Palate was medium bodied and dry. Flavors of grapefruit rind, hint of pine and light carmel with a dry, bitter finish.
Tap. Pours copper to red with an off-white head and creamy lacing. Fragrant floral hop and strong pine aroma. Hoppy and floral flavors. Medium bodied and somewhat creamy palate.

one of the less interesting ipa´s around. not sure if it was because i had just had the honey beer but i thought this tasted of honey. quite thin and sweet, plenty of evidence of hops but it didn´t really all fit together nicely

Draught. Light amber. Aroma is lightly malty (cookie), moderately hoppy (herbs, citrus - grapefruit). Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic. Finish is moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

column1: Rock Bottom Pittsburgh High Level Brown
column5: Black/brown with amber hues. Grass and malt nose, caramel. Flavor is much the same, grassy hops with a solid caramel back.

column1: Rock Bottom Pittsburgh High Level Brown
column5: Draft. Pours amber brown with an off white head. The aroma is sweet malty and a touch roasty. The aroma has sweet caramel and toffee malt notes with lighter roasted malt notes. A nice malty brown ale.

column1: Rock Bottom Pittsburgh High Level Brown
column5: This one poured a murky brown color with an off white head. Aroma was roasted malts, some caramel and toffe. Flavor was almost sticky sweet, rounded out by nice roasted malts and some bittering hops. An above average brown ale.

column1: Rock Bottom Pittsburgh High Level Brown
column5: This was the best beer here, but that wasn’t saying much. Floral malt aroma. Dark rootbeer brown, thin lace head. Roast, a little molasses, a little coffee. Dry, nutty chickory. Slightly starchy mouthfeel with a medium body. Fairly well done.

column1: Rock Bottom Pittsburgh High Level Brown
column5: On cask at the brewery. This is dubbed "Cuyahoga River Water". Opaque medium brown ruby, creamy off white head. Aroma is malt, chocolate, toffee, caramel, apricot. Flavor is less complex and is molasses, chocolate, malt, bitter.

column1: Rock Bottom Pittsburgh High Level Brown
column5: On tap at the Rock Bottom in Pittsburgh. Nice big creamy head like chocolate mousse. Great to look at. Not quiteopaque but almost. Very lovely appearance. Creamy aroma of whipped cream! Makes me attracted to this brew before I even taste it. Some roasted stout or porter attributes in the flavor. Stronger than the other rock bottom brews I’ve had. Has a slight alky bite to it that is absent in their other beers. Good example of a dark beer, dark in taste but not offensive. Friendly yet impressive. Good beer. Much better than Saranac Brown ale and is almost as good as east end fat gary. This is much darker than most other brown ales I’ve tasted. Not too sure if this is in the correct style.

column1: Rock Bottom Pittsburgh High Level Brown
column5: Dark brown, thin white head. Smelt of oats, floral hops and sweet caramel. thin, watery mouthfeel, but a nice smooth, nutty flavor with a mild hops profile. Not too bad, but nothing stellar.

column1: Rock Bottom Pittsburgh High Level Brown
column5: Growler Poured dark brownish, with small bubbly white heard. Aroma of malt, nuts, and caramal. Flavor mostly same, malt, hints of caramal and nuts, and a slight hop bite in the aftertaste. Carbonation was good. Brew easy to drink, but the body is watery.

column1: Rock Bottom Pittsburgh High Level Brown
column5: Seemed to me more a stout than a a brown ale. Poured very dark brownish black color with small offwhite head. Roasty malty nutty aroma with a very roasted malt flavor. Smooth finish. Pretty good beer.

column1: Rock Bottom Pittsburgh High Level Brown
column5: I am generally not overly into brown ales. This draft poured a dark brown color with a small tan head. The aroma was sweet and malty with a hint of chocolate. The flavor is initially sharp and bitter but some coffee, chocolate and roasted malt flavors come on as the beer lingers. Pretty good for a brown.
Excellent Koelsch beer, on the lighter side as far as body goes, nice white head, good hop character, very well balanced, great brew
I was very pleased with this Koelsch... light with a very good Munich/Vienna malt flavor and slight floral nose

A very nice beer, brewed for the masses, but I do think it's a little low on the hop flavor and aroma. Terry brews some excellent beers, and this is one of them, but he's capable of much more given a broader palatte.
Sweet vapory, citrus aroma. Very light in color, almost clear with nice head. Smooth, watery palate. Watery taste, some hops - reminded me more of a light beer than a Koelsch.
not too bad... I was expecting something spicier... more like a belgian version of a pale ale instead of a saison... perhaps some extra candy sugar and some darker sacchrified malts would help
Decent, cloudy, not much flavor, like a watered down belgian................
Weak malt aroma. Cloudy gold with small head. Smooth, watery. Like a very weak wheat beer. OK, but wouldn't drink again.

column4: Port Brewing Company / The Lost Abbey
column5: Draught at Lost Abbey/Port Brewing, San Marcos, California. Clear pale golden beer with a decent offwhite head. Malty bready aroma, caramel, grass, some citrus. Malty bready flavor, caramel, grassy hops. Thin but clean.

column4: Port Brewing Company / The Lost Abbey
column5: Draught @ Port Brewing / Lost Abbey, San Marcos, CA Pours yellowish orange with a smooth head. Aroma of juicy lemon, grapefruit, citrus and lime. Taste is sweetish, juicy and lemony with some lime and citrus. Finish is sweetish and zesty. Decent.

column4: Port Brewing Company / The Lost Abbey
column5: Draught @ the brewpub, San Marcos. Aroma has grainy malt and mild buttery tones. Feels surprisingly bulky. Flavour has buttery malt, grassy hops and some grain. Still quite bulky.

column4: Port Brewing Company / The Lost Abbey
column5: Tap @ brewpub. Pours golden color with a small head. Faint hips on the nose, buttety feel to it, grass and pale malts. Malty flavor, some hops and hay. Meh. 4313

column4: Port Brewing Company / The Lost Abbey
column5: Draught @ Port Brewing Co / Lost Abbey Brewery, San Marcos, CA. Pours a golden colour with a small foamy head. Aroma of graininess, a bit of sweet cooked corn and grass. Flavour of grassy bitterness, mild grainy maltiness, sweet corn and bit of sugary sweetness. Light bodied. A nice copycat.

column4: Port Brewing Company / The Lost Abbey
column5: Draft at The Confessional. Poured a light yellow, totally translucent color with a small white head. Some light corn flakes note with a light crisp pale malt character. Flavor was about what you would expect from a Mexican lager, but this one was pretty solid.

column4: Port Brewing Company / The Lost Abbey
column5: Type: Draft Glass: 16-oz. pint glass From: Under Belly in North Park (San Diego), Calif. Price: $2.75 with Happy Hour ($5.50 regular) Purchased: July 3, 2015 Consumed: July 3, 2015 Misc.: N/A Poured an orange, slightly murky color with two fingers of fluffy, white head when I got it. Lots of bubble streams coming up from the bottom of the glass. Very good amount of layered spiderweb foamy lacing on the sides of the glass. Above average retention. A nice looking beer. (Sight - 4.25) Smelled slight apple, cereal, corn, stale booze, faint vomit, light nuances of peach and apricot. (Smell - 3.75) Taste follows the nose. Got corn cereal, spoiled fruit, peach, apricot, grass and apple. (Taste - 3.88) Light body. Oily-to-creamy texture. Average carbonation. Long, grassy finish. (Feel - 3.75) This was pretty good for the style. I’d have it again for sure. (Overall - 3.88) 3.86 87 B+

column4: Port Brewing Company / The Lost Abbey
column5: draft at Ocean Beach, clear yellow, bubbly foam, light aroma, clean lager flavors, some lemon, a bit of malt on finish

column4: Port Brewing Company / The Lost Abbey
column5: Draft at the brewery. Pours clear bright gold with a thick off white head. Tastes like sweet corn, bready malt, and very light citrus. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like sweet corn, bready malt, and light citrus.

column4: Port Brewing Company / The Lost Abbey
column5: Tap at the brewery. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with light lacing. Aroma is cereal and meal malt, corn, spicy and earthy hops. Flavor is sweet malt dominant, light earthy and spicy hops with a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.
Backlog, from notes. On tap @ the brewpub, 12 May 2001. Roasted malts, with a light sweet taste and no bitter in the finish, more like a porter than a stout imho.

[At GABF 2004] A red-brown beer with a collapsing orange head. The aroma is very sweet roasted with notes of chocolate. The flavor is somewhat sour - is it because of the low alcohol content? but it has a nice roastyness and a dry woody end.
Nice tan head on the black beer. Really smells like a brewery, lots of fresh malt. Roasty malt flavor. A bit thin (seems to be a trend with some of the pizza port beers I’ve been trying).

Draught at Pizza Port (Carlsbad), California. Fine creamy long lasting light tan head, black body. Mild roasted malty, flowery and grassy aroma. Roasted malt in the flavor as well with smoke tones. A typical Irish stout!

(Nitro draft: Pizza Port in Carlsbad, CA) The expected dry and dark roasted flavor is certainly here, though the dark roasted flavor is fairly moderate; Bitterness is less intense than expected, but given the moderate dark roasted flavor, less bitter seems right in line; Fairly light palate for the style as well, but still with a medium body; The nose is Irish Stout all the way -- dry and dark roasted; The color isn’t black and opaque, but rather a very deep, deep ruddy brown; Creamy tan head with excellent retention as expected from a nitro tap; Head is not as thick as Guinness (can’t draw in it!), but it leaves a nice blanket of lacing

Pours a bark brown color that can be seen through when held to a bright light. The medium head is a light tan color with good lacing. Aroma is very, very roasted and malty. Flavor is mainly roasted malt with some nice nuttiness involved. Body is very watery.

Dark brown color, almost black with a big tan head. Roasted malt aroma and the same roasted malt taste that's a bit thin. It is nice and dry though. Nice lacing all the way through. Mellow chocolate finish.

This dry stout pours with a dark brown body topped by a thick head with a good amount of lacing left behind. The aroma is slightly sweet but mostly bitter and roasty from the roasted malt. The flavor is slightly sweet, roasty and malty with a slight smokiness. There is also a slightsourness in the background. Full bodied, slightly tingly and dry.
Typical stout aroma and a dark creamy appearance. Semi-sweet malty flavors dominate the body. Body is a little thin for the style. Roasty, dry and smooth finish rounds out this decent brew.

Black as night with a big thick creamy white head. A mild smokey coffee aroma to it. Sticky sweet malt turns to chalk and then becomes dry in an earthlike sense with a few hops on the side, but barely noticable. Average.
Clear red pour. No head or lace to speak of. A spicy and sugary aroma. Wheat, oak, and hop. Taste is minimal hop, sweet malt and dark fruits.

One thing I’ve always been a sucker for with BBW is their spicy beers and this one doesn’t disappoint with some oak in there, a dry mouthfeel, some malty spices (I think I prefer cardamom to coriander spice now), a peppery aroma, and a candycane finish. A good growler beer. I like the hops but they may be a bit too much for this style.
Draft sampled at brewery. Pours a dark amber with a off-white head. Aroma of oak, raisins, earth, and some notes of dark fruit. Flavor is caramel, candi sugar, fruit, and some spices

On tap at the BBW Brew Pub. Poured a deeper amber color with an averaged sized off white head. Aromas of smoke, spices, earthy, raisins, vanilla, oak, and fruity. Tastes of vanilla, ligtht wood, candi sugar, caramel, and light spices. Lacing left on the glass.

Pours a translucent golden amber with a small off white head that left some lacing. Aroma I was really picking up the spices, but more like "holiday" spices. Maybe it was the cardimom? Hard to get past the spices for me. Was picking up the same thing in the flavor. Maybe picking up some of the candi sugars in the flavor. Didn’t remind me much of a Belgian Ale. As you can tell from my rating I enjoyed it. Just wasn’t expecting what I got :)

The beer list says this is an "advanced palate beer" and I would pretty much agree. The oak is definitely present in the finish, and the flavor is rich with spices and caramel. Feels like this should have had more alochol in it, but a great offering from BBW.

Growler - Totally reminds me of a Finnish Sahti. Clear sparkling copper, thin white head. Ultra complex nose of chardonay grapes, oak, spice, must, earth and wet twigs. The flavor practically matched aroma with additional dark fruit notes and a slight hint of caramel and toffee. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, clean, light bitter and wood finish. Similar in nature to Heavyweight’s Juhlia. A very nice surprise....

Thanks to my brother in law for a growler of this. Pours deep copper with ruby edges. Aroma of definite oak, malt, bourbon, and dark fruit esters. Tastes malty, with some oak, toffee, and a semi-dry dark fruit at the finish. Very smooth on the palate. The little brother of Arrogant Bastard. I cant’ believe the variance on the ratings for this.

On tap at the BBW, this was the best beer out of the sampler, the spices come out in the aroma, with hints of the yeast and fruits. The body was a golden color and the head sat on top for the entire time it took me to drink the other 5 beers and the length of this one. Nutmeg and spices come out stong, and the back of the taste is an excellent blend of malts and hops. Body was very smooth and clean, somewhere in the middle of medium and full. I thought this was excellent.
Sampled at the Brandywine beerfest at Iron Hill in Media, Pa. Good beer. A little thin but very drinkable. The coriandor was there but real faint.

330mL bottle at Delirium Cafe Kuala Lumpur, pours a deep dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma brings out tasted caramel, with a hint of dark dried fruits, and some toffee. Flavour is on the dry side, with toasted caramel, gentle dark fruits, and bready toffee. Fruity, dry, and not too sweet. A well-put-together dubbel. Nice.
Dark and sweet. Nogthing special. If you go to all the effort of making a beer like this, you'd better jam some flavour into it.

This is how a dubbel should taste. It is damn near perfect for the style. Has the nice fig and molasses and slight liquorice flavours, Along with some dark belgian candy sweetness, good body, clear, and super clean and silky smooth. Online belgian beer factory.
Bevuta in bottiglia. Birra rossa belga. Profumata. Buona forse un po' poco corposa.
Colore ambrato scuro, schiuma persistente, dolce/acidula con retrogusto amaro, sentori di alcool.

Bottle at Delirium Cafe, Kuala Lumpur. Poured a hazy dark brown with a thin, off white head. The aroma is roasty malt, light red berry fruits. The flavour is moderate liquorice bitter with a smooth, rich, roasty, light fruit, earthy, light warm alcohol, light aromatic hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with average to soft carbonation.

Smell - quite weak, little caramel, some sweetness. Foam - low carbonation if any, some sourness ad sweetness. Taste - little sweet, some bitter aftertaste, some carbonation, no alcohol flavor. Feels a bit like beer what to drink in quantities, bit better smell and different taste though.

33cl Bottle @ Beergium, Le Roeulx, Belgium. Dark brown colour with a thin tan head. Aroma is yeast, malt, sweet, dark fruits. Taste is yeast, malt, caramel, prunes, spices. Medium body, average carbonation.
Pite w browarze Huyghe. Brak piany, praktycznie brak zapachu, ale w smaku dość miłe karmelowe i melanoidynowe nuty
From Beergium. In Grinbergen glass. Playing Avernum 3. Flat and with a slight sourish touch. At least the abv is well hidden though

500 ml bottle. Unclear golden, fluffy head. Hay, straw, citrus, bread, grassy notes. Crisp bitterness. Full bodied, oily texture, lively to soft carbonated, dry bitter finish. Very nice and crisp Zwickel.
Bottle from Landbierparadies. Clear amber colour, white foam. Grassy, hoppy, bready. Light sweet, malty but also dry and bitter. Well balanced. Nice bitter lager.
Draught at Zum Franziskaner, Stockholm, Sweden. CLear golden, medium white head. Bready malt, floral hops. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry, medium bitterness.
BA at Zum Franziskaner, Stockholm. Hazy golden. Grassy, husky nose. Mid dry with medium body and soft mouthfeel. Grassy and spicy. Bready malt. Gentle bitter finish. Nice.

Many thanks for this beer from Bierland to Mariusz from Baden. Piwo jest zlociutkie, klarowne ze srenia piana, opadajaca szybko, w smaku lekko kwaskowe bardzo malo slodowe, moze ciut wodniste niestety ale przyjemnie lekko goryczkowe.

Score: 7 / 4 / 7 / 4 / 16 500 ml bottle from Landbierparadies webshop. Golden, slightly hazy body, with a big, stable, fluffy, lacing, white head. Aroma of bread, hay, grass, flowers, fresh herbs, some honey, some fruits. Tastes similar, with some more bitter hops. Medium, a bit creamy mouthfeel, with an average carbonation. Finishes very crisp, medium bitter, floral, herbal, grassy, hoppy, hayish, bready, subtly sweet. Lovely. Extra point for the balance from me, which is really outstanding. Smooth and subtly sweet, with some creaminess to it, while also very crisp, with enough bitterness and lovely herbal and floral notes throughout. I also really like the bready notes. Great Lager I could drink all day.
Bottle. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of malty, light herbal, grassy. Loads of grassy hops, grains, caramel, light veggies.
Bocken varer lige til påske. Golden with a lasting white head. Malty aroma with bread and grain. Sweetish malty flavour with bread crust and grain and a light herbal bitter finish.
Bottle @ Lieberth, Hallerndorf. Pours clear Golden with a White head. Slight Apple pie Crust, grass, hay amd mild sulphur. Soft. Short bitter finish.
Bottle from SinH4, many thanks! Clear golden with a white head. Grassy and floral with some grains and cereal. Well executed, smooth and balanced.

(bottle) Clear, amber to copper colour with a big and off-white foamy head. Mildly toasted malty aroma with nutty and subtle fruity notes. Moderately sweet and delicately bitter flavour, light to medium bodied with a modest carbonation. Nutty malt character with shades of caramel and a discreetly hoppy touch from behind, getting slightly stronger towards the rounded sweet-bitter finish. Okay. 31.VIII.18

€-Fläschla: Clear, copper coloured, medium-sized and slowly collapsing lacy off-white head; dryish malty to toasty nose, some minerals, some fruits underneath; moderate dryish bitter-sweet flavour, quite light bodied and a bit fizzy; lingering dry malty and herbal bitter finish. Good...

Bottle 500ml. @ home in apartment, Berlin, Germany. [ As Krug-Bräu Helles Festbier ]. ABV: 5.5%. Clear medium to light golden amber color with a small to average, frothy, good lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, sweet malt, sugary, toffee. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average duration, sweet malt, caramel, toffee, sugary. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160417] 6-3-6-4-12
Bottle. Pours dark amber with white head. Aroma of caramel, dried fruits, notes of bready malts, grainy, slight phenolic. Taste is rather dusty with dried fruits, caramel, and light phenolic smoke.
Garrafa de 50 cl .Cor de cobre. Espuma média. Textura aveludada com boas notas de avelã. Delícia
Bottle @ Hopfen & Malz, Berlin. 5,5%. Pours amber copper with a small creamy white head and lacings. Nuts, toffee, caramel and dried fruit. Sweet. Chewy malts. Full bodied. Good!

Moderate sweetness of sugar nature, music test, and a little honey, caramel, slight oiliness, malt, a little alcohol, a little grass, towards the end of the spices. The finish - dry, with a note of spice, a bit short-average. Mouthfeel: Medium fullness of the body, a little oily. Carbonation - average. Mertz sweet, with moderately spicy aftertaste
0,5 l bottle red-amber, clear, frothy, brown foam, cereal, toast, herbs, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, soft carbonation,

Bottle from P&M, pours a dark clear amber with a light tan head. The smell is toasted malt, herbal roots, brown sugar. The taste is as it smells ending with a nice crispness and a touch of fruit. Light+ in body with nice, fine carbonation. Pleasant.
Strong aroma of roasted malt and hops. Taste is malty with hints of hops. Aftertaste is bitter from the start and sweet malty at the end
Yeasty coffeearoma. Nasty, yeasty taste with orange and apricot. Beuhhhh....

(2002)Dark red colour, good head. Indeed a nasty bitter finish; A pitty, my first taste impression was quite okay, a bit sweet and complex. Then it was like drinking water followed by the nasty aftertaste..

Tasted the 2002 version. Strange beer for a Meibok which is normally golden coloured and with about 6.5% alcohol. Not the worst beer from Moerenburg but still not very good at all. The aroma is old raisins, coreander and something I couldn't classify. Red color, off-white frothy head, fair lace. Initially light sweet, spicy, raisin, very full (too full for a Meibok in my opinion). Long finish with a nasty bitter taste.

Draught at the brewpub as Hümmer Maibock. Hazy dark orange colour. Small stable frothy head. The flavour is OK sweet, good maltiness with enough bitterness to balance. The bitterness is slightly rough, but OK.

Bottle, kindly sent by pivnizub. Orange amber, fine carbonation, golden cream. Strong butterscotch and toasted bread aroma. Honeyish malt base, pretty obvious diacetyl - too much to ignore, some oxidation, Herbal hop finish. Somewhat bland and sugary. Medium body, weelagered mouthfeel. Sticky aftertaste.

Bottle (purchased at the Brauerei): Fruity, presumably diacetyl, nose with a touch of sweet-malt; golden, mid-sized fluffy head; moderate bitter-sweet flavour, medium bodied, a bit sticky; short bready-bitter finish. Not very convincing, poor by franconian standards........

(bottle) Clear, deep golden colour with a medium-sized, slightly off-white foamy head. Sweet and bready malt aroma with a milky touch and shy herbal notes. Moderately sweet flavour, medium bodied with a soft and well-matured mouthfeel. Bready, cara-malty taste with light herbal hops in the background; sweet and slightly bitter, malt-accented finish with a light but balancing herbal hops character. Pleasant.
A pale bock beer. Very malty and flowery aroma. Barnyard. Very malty taste, hopbitter and caramel. Not too sweet in spite of its maltiness.

Yellow cloudy beer with foam ring. Mixture of all citrus fruits in the nose and some herbal spices. Citrus and tiny sour bits, fruity and spicy taste. Calm aftertaste. This beer is not too special, but a nicely crafted refreshing wit.

Draught at the brewpub. Hazy yellow coloured with a medium sized white head. Fruity aroma of citrus peel, coriander, celery and sweat. Fruity flavoru of citrus peel, wheat and pepper. Spicy finish. Boring.

From tap at the brewpub. Pours cloudy to hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is lemonish/citrusy. Light wheaty and yeasty note. Mild spiced, cloves, ginger and coriander. Rather unexpected spice profile. Ends mild sweet and persisting spiced.
The aroma is very fruity and wheaty. The color is pale yellow and it has no head. The flavor is hoppy with notes of coriander and wheat, but the body is thin.
Poor head. Citrusy aroma, light. Strange taste, light, not really 'classic', citrusy, not characteristic; as well as for the palate. Beers of Switzerland
pale orange colour, few head, perfumy, slightly citrusy with a touch of spices, tart and fresh, short lemon finish - easy but not bad

Fully pale, thick white foam, completely gone after very short time. Nose has a little malt,dry, sugar (?). Taste is completely pilsener, not very special, some malt body. Dry, but refreshing mouthfeel. Slightly bitterish aftertaste, typical pilsener style. Well, it's biological (Ecocert), certainly blonde - and very dreary pils.
clear very pale amber colour, almost no head, fresh, citrusy notes, very malty, dry but quite neutral, short finish
Bière savoureuse mousse semi-épaisse et agréable. une belle découverte, bière équilibrée

Kalea-Bieradventkalender Frankreich-Version 2018 Ein Bier, das wieder voll an Schwarzbrot erinnert. Das ist wohl mit "blé noir", also schwarzen Korn gemeint. Dabei hat es auch einen Hopfenstich. EIn interessantes Bier mit allerlei untypischen Geschmäckern. Vielleicht kein Top-Bier, aber man kann es ruhig mal probieren.

Une rousse avec peu de tenue et une mousse faible. Quelques pointes épicées mais aucune longueur. Le blé noir n’apporte pas de saveur si ce n’est une légère note grillée. Biere tres aqueuse, désaltérante, mais au goût faible
Maître Britt à encore frappé. Des effluves de caramel beurre salé qui caressent le palais.
Fles 33cl in Puybrun. Niet verkeerd, redelijk volle smaak, licht bitter. (8-2011).

Wazig amberkleurig bier met crème kleurig schuim. Geur: zoet, mout, granen, licht fruitig, karamel. Smaak: zoet, wat fruitig, licht kruidig. Licht maar romig mondgevoel. Medium koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: zoetig, kruidig.
Bottle from Brittany, France. Hazy amber color, white head. Malty, caramel 'oyes. Nothing crazy

Pours a bit hazy amber, topped with large, gushing frothy head, offwhite color. Quite yeasty nose, a bit vinous and fruity. Taste yeasty with some nice though sugary sweetness. A bit fruity candy like with some spiciness in finish. Lightet body.
(blé noir, bio, « française », un poil trop sucrée et beaucoup trop légère)
Pours amber with a moderate off white head. Aromas of caramel, toffee, malt, rye bread. Taste is malty and floral with some herbal notes. Mouthfeel is fairly light bodied with moderate carbonation.
Taste beerfest Namuroise 2014. Light hazy golden color, with good white head. Aroma: bit spice, sweet, little alcohol note. Taste: sweet, malts, low bitterness. Regular blonde.

Mustard beer for mustard maker Bister, with stable, sticky, off-white head and cloudy ochre blonde colour. Aroma of lemon peel, dry sherry, hay, peach, honey; taste begins with citrussy freshness and dried fruits, bready, bit sourish, yeasty, light bitter hop finish with a subtle, spicy mustard accent.

Golden pour. Small white head. Little lacing. Not much of an aroma. A little floral note but that is it. Malty taste, though watered down. A slight presence of mustard. Slight. Not as bad as anticipated.

33cl bottle @ 8ème Fête de la Bière Namuroise. Dorée blanche. Arôme malté léger caramel avec une brève note houblonnée et une moutarde qui est pour moi indétectable. Profile reste bien belge avec une moutarde faiblarde, fini grains, sec au palais avec un léger côté houblonné citronné. L’alcool malgré ces 6.5% se développe bien et réchauffe en fin de bouche. Tout comme l’avis du reste de notre table cette version est en manque de moutarde, l’ancienne mettait cette dernière plus à profit.

BB 19/04/2008 (33 cl bottle from a friend in Belgium) On March 23, 2008. Shady golden color, smallish white head. Sweet, spicy, alcohol and butterscotch scent. Sweet wort and malt tqste, sugqry. Moussy mouthfeel, low bitterness.
cloudy yellow coloured with carbonation body and a average white head a nice malty yeasty aroma a malty yeasty spicy taste and a nice spicy long finich

Hazy yellow coloured, quiet a lot of carbonation and an average white head. Sweet malty aroma, some light herbal yeasty touches. Very nice, full body, smouth with a little sprankling. Finish is light bitter with an unique somewhat tinteling mouthfeel, caused by the spicy undertone (I guess the mustard seeds).Long aftertaste, at the end more piquant. Very nice, I love this one.

(Bottle 33 cl) My version was from now defunct "Les artisans Brasseurs" in Namur - 6% ABV. Golden beer with collossal amounts of floaties, gee this is really lumpy yeast. Stable, dense and oily head - from the mustard seeds? No, this doesn’t taste like Heiz Classic Mustard, but it’s oddly spiced in a way I haven’t really tried before. Decent blond ale, although a bit flat in carbonation with a slight, bitter finish. 150799

(bottle) Hazy and pale orange colour with a big foamy lasting white head. Floral hoppy aroma with citric, yeasty and spicy elements. Medium sweet flavour and carbonation. Initially malty sweet taste with a musty spiced and smooth bitterhoppy finish. A great experience, especially the mustard blended finish.

(Bottled) Very hazy orange-yellow color with a medium, tight, lacy and creamy head. Very fruity, yeasty aroma with lemon and hay, and a hint of alcohol. Very, very fruity, slightly sweet flavor with banana and yeast. Medium-bodied, slicky palate with foamy but smooth carbonation. A very pleasant and well-balanced, quite straightforward blonde. Refreshing!

Un colore giallo opaco e un aspetto torbido. La schiuma è compatta, fine e bianca ma poco persistente. Al naso è leggermente frustrata senza essere eccessivamente invadente. Gusto piacevole, associato ad una carbonazione moderata, dove alla frutta si associa il miele. Il retrogusto non è piacevolissimo, forse un po' troppo amaro.
Lieve Aroma di frutta matura con note leggermente fenoliche. Gusto dolce, fruttato ma con un retrogusto oleoso e leggermente amarognolo (non gradito)

Pours somewhat hazy sunny oraneg colour, topped with a sizeable and creamy white head, ok lasting. Ripe banana nose, slight sweat and some spicy presence. Medium bitterness, some very faint hints of sweetness, gently spicy finish with lingering ehrbal feel. Lighter body. Not bad, but not my type of a weizen.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso è indirizzato verso il frumento. La finezza olfattiva è normale e il modo in cui permane è sufficiente. Il manto birroso superiore è caratterizzato da una schiuma dalla buona tenuta. La grandezza delle bollicine è a grana media. Il liquido è di aspetto velato. Bollicine fini costituiscono la forma del perlage. Il colore è giallo dorato carico. Il corpo è pieno. L'amaro è non invasivo e c'è anche una componente leggermente acidula. La forza gustativa è normale e si prolunga in modo sufficiente. Le sensazioni boccali finali risultano di pronta beva. Il retrogusto è di decente intensità. L'aroma in bocca porta i segni di miele, erba, agrumi e banana.

Robe dorée, fine mousse, peu persistante. Nez plus élégant, fruits jaunes, pomme, céréales. Bouche également plus équilibrée, du fruit, de la fraîcheur, une bulle marquée et une finale fraîche et fruitée. Une blanche de soif.
Weizen molto buona, aspetto ottimo, al naso fruttata, anche al palato piacevole equilibrio, poco lievito, note fruttate, carbonazione media.
Goudgele kleur met dikke witte schuimkraag. Geur is banaan en gaan. Smaak is banaan, creamy en granig Met een klein bittertje.
Pours cloudy blonde.good, dense white head. Smell is esthers (banana) and creamy. Taste is very creamy, easy drinkin. Esther forward, wheat is very prominent. Very well brewed weisse.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet in Norway, on order. Hazy golden color, good foam. Medium aroma intensity; floral, perfumey, distinct yeast. Medium body & complexity . Good bitterness and balance. Enjoyable ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Gulating Pub, Stavanger. Pours hazy weak golden with a big creamy white head. Aroma of ripe banana. Taste is also sweet banana, weak dry herbal hops in the finish, overall a bit too sweet for me.
dark brown colour, big creamy head, caramel, slightly toasted, very malty, sweet and buttery with a long caramel finish
pale orange colour, fine head, nice lace, malty, nutty, dry and bitter, caramel, licorice, dry finish - particular and complex
Darker orange, small head, aroma is yeast, herbal, fruit, taste is the same, sweet herbal, bit dusty, ok but the aftertaste is not great,
hazy orange pour. belgian like zest and fruitiness to the yeast, crisp, clean, lightly spiced aftertaste. Pleasant.
Orange color, middle foam size. Good beer, aroma and taste fit into the style.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a hazy amber with a small white head and an aroma of toffee, yeast, spices, butter, berries, lychees and sweet malts. The taste is medium sweet with a medium body and light carbonation. Nice!

Bottle. Pours hazy orangeish amber with airy but stable off-white head. Clear aeoma of honey, malt, spices and yeast. Bitter, hoppy and her al flavour with notes of malt, fruit, caramel and yeast. Rough, estery aftertaste with botter and herbal notes and malty touches. Well-balanced and very nice.
330 ml bottle. Lightly hazy orange/amber color with cream foam. Aroma of apple, gains, earthy and slight ginger notes. Taste of sweet malty notes, some earth, hints of apple and ginger.
A: Dark orange with a medium off-white head. N: Spicy and earthy. T: Full-bodied. Lots of subtle spicy notes. P: Full. O: Different, but totally enjoyable.
Aromat zbożowy, słodowy. W smaku lekki karmel, zboże, lekkie. Bardzo pijalne.
Az egyiptomi sör? Nem rossz ötlet, de hát a megvalósítás? Hagy némi kívánnivalót maga után.

I haven’t had a Baladin beer in awhile. Apparently this was made with Egyptian Kamut grain, orange peel and myrrh. Baladin Nora 7% Orange gold with a thick light beige head that does not linger for long. The aroma is reminiscent of a Belgian Wit with orange peel, ginger and chewy wheat (Kamut?). Full bodied, raspy carbonation and a big sweet orange marmalade flavor then ginger in the finish. Tangy sweet orange marmalade is a flavor I really wasn’t expecting, fun though I find the carbonation a touch abrasive.
Hazy orange color with small white head. Yeast and light malt aroma. Bitter and sour taste.

Robe blonde, légèrement trouble, fine mousse. Nez sur les céréales, la farine et les fruits, assez simple. Bouche à l'attaque acidulée, une belle fraîcheur, une bulle discrète et une finale courte. Blanche de soif

Exp. dat Aug. 2016. Pours hazy dark golden with a minimal white head. Lively carbonation is visible. Nose is yeasty, malty and a bit murky. Bit bland, nothing that special. Flavor is remarkably sour. Clear citrus notes, some wheat as well, faint banana touch. Love the sourish aftertaste. Okay and drinkable brew. Would not say it is a weizen though, as there are some commonalities with the Flemish sours either. Thinnish texture, medium bodied, lively carbonated.
Golden coloured and hazy. Has a white head. Moderate sweet, faint sweet aroma. Flavor starts sweet, faint spicy, light acid.
Clear blond, white head Banana, yeast and hops, coriander and citrus Cereals, some citrus, hops

Bottled. Pours a hazy lemon color with a medium sized frothy head. Good head retention. Aroma of wheat, soft citrus, grapes and faint spice. The taste is soft wheat, citrus and herbal notes. Medium bodied.
Colore giallo chiaro, schiuma poco persistente. Molto forte all’olfatto, in bocca prevale un gusto fruttato con sentori di agrumi.

Bottle 750ml. Unclear light to medium yellow color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is light malty, paper notes, moderate yeasty, banana. Flavor is moderate sweet and light light acidic with a average to long duration, citrus acidic, yeasty. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20100910]
Bottle at Papsø. Cloudy golden coloured with a medium sized white head. Fruity aroma off spices, citrus and bananas. Fruity flavour of citrus and bananas with notes of spices. Spicy finish.
Hazy golden with a medium white head. Sweet and yeasty aroma with wheat and lemons. Flavor had yeast, wheat and hints of banana.

column1: Meantime Wheat / Sainsburys Bavarian Style Wheat Beer
column5: Robe blond orangé, légèrement voilée, mousse assez faible. Nez « moelleux », avec une touche de banane, de fruit doux. Bouche très acidulée (60% de froment), tellement qu'elle manque d'équilibre, et qu'elle perd ce bon goût de banane typique des levures de weizen et présent au nez. Dommage.

column1: Meantime Wheat / Sainsburys Bavarian Style Wheat Beer
column5: Bottle at PoW, Farnborough. Spice and caramel aroma - less of the stereotypical banana. Opaque orange amber. Bubbly white head soon shrinks away. Overly chilled - this may well contribute to the low key impact of the taste. Light sour. Citrus. Light bodied. Watery. Fizzy carb. Abrupt finish. Perfectly drinkable but far from a great example of the style.

column1: Meantime Wheat / Sainsburys Bavarian Style Wheat Beer
column5: Dorée orangée, moyennement effervescente, fruitée, fruits jaunes doux et banane, que je n’apprécie pas, douce, sucrée. Assez spéciale, pas désagréable mais peu à mon goût. Bouteille 33cl achetée chez Monoprix, Paris, France, bue le 08/04/2017.

column1: Meantime Wheat / Sainsburys Bavarian Style Wheat Beer
column5: Couleur dorée, très légère mousse. Nez de cidre... Gout de cidre (un peu citronné et pomme), aigre et astrigent. Vraiment pas mon style

column1: Meantime Wheat / Sainsburys Bavarian Style Wheat Beer
column5: Bottle. Cloudy orangey-brown colour. Fruity (orange, banana, apple). Spicy (cloves). Yeasty and wheaty. Sweetish throughout with only mildly bitterness in the finish. Drinkable. (2008)

column1: Meantime Wheat / Sainsburys Bavarian Style Wheat Beer
column5: 330ml bottle at home on 17 Dec 2016, from Edward Wylie, Glasgow, yeasty, wheat aroma, golden amber with a rapidly disappearing head, cereal, yeasty, faint banana, grainy texture, sourness in the flavour, wheaty aftertaste.

column1: Meantime Wheat / Sainsburys Bavarian Style Wheat Beer
column5: Cloudy golden wheat color. Hint of clove. semi-tart bananas up front with a drier clove bit at the end.

column1: Meantime Wheat / Sainsburys Bavarian Style Wheat Beer
column5: Pours it has a golden with thin white head. Nose is yeast and wheat. Aromas are fruity esters, yeast, coriander. Average carbonation, medium body. Medium sweet and spicy finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column1: Meantime Wheat / Sainsburys Bavarian Style Wheat Beer
column5: Nez: Froment, orange, acidité Bouche: Froment, orange, épicée, acidité Pas mieux que la IPA...

column1: Meantime Wheat / Sainsburys Bavarian Style Wheat Beer
column5: Couleur ambrée, mousse généreuse mais qui disparaît immédiatement. Pointe d’acidité au nez, couplée au blé. En bouche ça sent le CO2, avec une acidité faisant penser au Champagne, mais avec un relent métallique derrière. La carbo disparait rapidement et au final on se retrouve avec une bière plate à tous les niveaux. Nulle, la moitié de la bouteille a fini à l’évier...

column1: Thwaites Lancashire Brown Ale / Co-op Strong (Brown) Ale
column5: Bottle. (Brief tasting notes and rating from old records) - Very malty (burnt caramel) sweet dark ale. Lightly hopped finish. OK. (Backlog)

column1: Thwaites Lancashire Brown Ale / Co-op Strong (Brown) Ale
column5: 500ml bottle from the Co-op, Paisley - clear dark brown, bubbly tan head, sweet caramel malt aroma, sweet malty flavour, smooth, easy to drink

column1: Thwaites Lancashire Brown Ale / Co-op Strong (Brown) Ale
column5: Bland and featureless own brand ale with hardly any taste or flavour on offer.

column1: Thwaites Lancashire Brown Ale / Co-op Strong (Brown) Ale
column5: Sharp when first put into the mouth as though its waking the Taste buds. Then swooshed around the mouth covering the back of the tongue and the cheeks. Leaving it before you swallow to saver the smooth taste. This is not one to rush. Make it last and enjoy. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column1: Thwaites Lancashire Brown Ale / Co-op Strong (Brown) Ale
column5: Aroma is mainly sweet caramel. Texture is quite soft, thick and oily with a light carbonation. I imagine this is how beer and cola taste when mixed. A nice sweetness on the lips but on the whole rather bland.

column1: Thwaites Lancashire Brown Ale / Co-op Strong (Brown) Ale
column5: A - Fermented dry fruit with light toffee A - Dark brownish-red with thin cream coloured head T - Sweet with little to no bitter P - Medium and soft O - Not very memorable

column1: Thwaites Lancashire Brown Ale / Co-op Strong (Brown) Ale
column5: Bottle from Co-op. Pours dark brown with reddish hue when held to light. Nose is malty and chocolatey. Taste is chocolate malt with very subtle hop bitterness. Nice balance of sweet malt and hop bitterness. Some dried fruit flavours in there too.

column1: Thwaites Lancashire Brown Ale / Co-op Strong (Brown) Ale
column5: (bottled)"Strong Brown Ale" It is brown , but strong? 5 % is session stuff in my opinion .For context sake , I had TommyKnocker Imperial Nut Brown ale at the GBBF in the summer -that was 9% , i’d all that ’ robust brown ale’. the beige head was shy , hiding after the pouring , nice deep, burnt brown color. nose is syrupy ..malt caramel and dark fruit esters , similar to an Old Ale. also some earthy plastic for some reason . it drinks with malty rich caramel like notes , a dark fruit complexity ..with a mix of a.chocolaty roast and resiny hop bitterness . palate is pretty syrupy and cloying , sticky stuff . interesting beer . better than I’d thought , there’s kinda a depth here.

column1: Thwaites Lancashire Brown Ale / Co-op Strong (Brown) Ale
column5: Impressive and very flavoursome brown ale. My initial thoughts were ’meaty’, if you can apply such a description to a beer, but that was my impression and reminded me of my first taste of Bartemans XXXB. A good sweetness that lasts, a beer full of body.

column1: Thwaites Lancashire Brown Ale / Co-op Strong (Brown) Ale
column5: Bottle from co-operative. Brown to black coloured, minimal head. Aroma: barley, alcohol. Tastes somewhat bitter, sweetish, furthermore not so special.
Cask Stillage at the Community Centre, Frodsham 25/05/2002 Amber golden coloured and slightly rich on the palate. Bitter with a dry lasting finish.

Casl Conditioned at The Horse & Groom, Caulcott, Oxon. Mid brown beer with thin white head. Average malty beer with dry bitter character, a little boiled hop character. A bit of a non entity which matches the singer perfectly.
A good bottle conditioned beer. Bitter and floral hops are present in both aroma and taste. Allow to settle down because this can explode when opened. All over your jeans. Happy birthday, Hump!
Bottle at the brewer’s tap. Pours golden, nose is citrus, floral, little vegetive, taste is similar, crisp, light bitterness.
Bottle bbe Oct 2015. Tap House, Paisley. Pours clear golden with a thin white head. Aromas of toffee, caramel. Taste is sweet, more caramel. Faint tingle of herbal hops on the finish.
Bottle. Sour unhappy malt with a muddy yeast and hop flavour. Not particularly good.

500ml Bottle from Aldi Supermarket, Scotland (£1.99): Subtle earthy malts & sweetness, vanilla & butterscotch with background fruits, burnt sugar & hints of floral too but the sweetness seems to dominate with a little help from the light malts & touches of bitterness. Very light & clear amber, almost watery with a 0.5cm head that’s foamy & frothy before disappearing almost completely. Citrus & lemon initially, sweetness follows with vanilla too. The aftertaste is very strange with some smoky flavours coming through that aren’t all that dissimilar to that of a rauchbier. This one was all over the place really & other than the sweetness at the start it wasn’t a good one at all. Light to light-medium in body, it’s a fairly smooth beer with a slight citrus tang and the smoky/sweet aftertaste was weird to say the least, with a lingering & smoky feel right at the end as well. Another beer I picked up in Aldi that was a little all over the place, this one with a poor beer but had a pleasant smell; the taste definitely let this one down in a big way.

500ml bottle from Aldi, Prestwick Toll, Prestwick - clear straw coloured, thin lively head, citrus, hay aroma, no lacing, lemon, citrus flavour with some creamy maltiness, fairly well balanced with a decent hop finish

Bottle from Tomlinsons, Inverness. It clear golden with a small white head. The nose is fresh, floral, light citrus, hay, grainy and dough. The taste is lemon, lime, doughy, straw, floral and nice crisp bitterness with a dry finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Crisp and refreshing. Nice golden.

Lively CO2. Light brown toast, roasty a bit grass like light yeast and hints of citrus. Pale orange, bit hazy white head. Light sweet, medium bitter and very light sour. Prickles on tongue and flattens out nicely, fullbody well balanced texture, chewyat the end. screams for peanuts to go with.

Bottle. Amber with a nice head. The aroma is hoppy with a perfumed, floral note. the flavour is sweetish with notes of fruit and caramel, and the bitterness is moderate. It’s easy to drink, but a bit light in the overall impression.
Light hazy orange colourwith a small white head. Malty, light caramel sweet aroma with a hoppy fruity note. Malty, caramel sweet flavor with a light hoppy pine note.
Slightly cloying nose. Pours pale gold. Flavour is yeasty and sour with a nasty finish. Poor.

Notes from early 90s. 30 cl bottle. Clear dark golden color. Aroma’s of caramel malts, sweet malts, some fruit. Flavor is moderate sweet with light bitterness. Medium bodied. Lingering finish without any new flavors. Nice enough.

Meibok (Spring Bock) is not quite my style but I liked this one. Vanilla aroma. Amber color, off-white frothy head, nice lace. Soft, sweet, moderate full, flowery, bit sticky. Moderate long finish which is light hopbitter.

Bottle from Marks & Spencer, Halifax. Very lightly hazed copper-amber with a thin head. It's a grainy-malty bitter with a low bitterness and surprisingly some activity in the palate. Has a somewhat grainy nose too. It's tasty enough without being spectacular. Earlier Rating: 1/5/2013 Total Score: 2.6 Marketed via a Marks & Spencer issue, this is a deeper golden coloured ale with an initial frothy head. It’s got a good body but also a fair bitterness to it which makes up a greater part of its character. Has a slight roasted aftertaste.

Bottled, 500ml from Marks & Spencer's in Banbury, Oxon. Gold to amber with white head. This proved to be a soft, light, malty beer, some sweet toffee notes, sweet biscuit, light grain. The caramel note lingers through the beer. It's a simple, light beer and it's okay. Earlier Rating: 9/29/2003 Total Score: 3.7 Cask Conditioned at The New Inn, Cropton. Red Brown beer with chunky head. Nicely balanced bitter with good roasted malt flavours, yeasty bready notes and a fresh tangy hop, bitter finish. A very pleasant bitter.
A session bitter really biscute and toffee malts gently hopped. Slight metalicy tinge and a touch thin. But otherwise very decent.

It looked pleasant and there was no real aroma coming from the tankard. The flavour was that of a basic bitter, light biscuit malt, a lick of bitter hops and that was about it. A nice mouthfeel from the malt and a very short flavour. It's a session bitter and was pleasant to drink. That's about all I can say.

Bottle.. Dark copper brown appearance - no head. Malt (caramel / roasty) dominates the aroma. A burnt sweetness with a bitter balance on the taste. Medium bodies but flat on the tongue. Drinkable but their cask is better.

Bottle. Clear amber body with a thin off-white head. Steady carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of wood, dried grass and dirt. Flavour of red apple, earth and wood. Thin body with a watery texture. Soft fizz. Simple and easy to drink.
Bottle. Dark brown bitter. Dominant roasted buttery maltiness, with a hoppy character. Dry malty roasty finish. OK. Drinkable. (2008)

F: big, light off-white, average retention. C: deep gold to amber, clear. A: caramel malt, biscuit, toffee, grassy/floral. T: malt, caramel, light toffee, bread, grassy, good bitterness on the palate, medium body, low to medium carbonation, good one, 0,5l bottle from M&S in Brussels.

500ml bottle from M&S. The aroma is predominantly caramel though the taste is more biscuity sweetness. This is mixed with quite a bit of hop bitterness that takes a few sips to acclimatise to. Once you do you realise this is a decent example of the style. For a beer below 4% ABV this has plenty going for it.

Bottle at home picked up from the Watford M&S. A clear amber copper coloured pour with a lasting thin beige head. Aroma is sweet toffee and nutty malts, little buttery biscuit. Little bread and butter pudding on the nose as well. Flavour is composed of twiggy malts, woody toasted toffee, dried fruits, strawberry shortcake, little vanilla. Decent English yeast character. Palate is semi sweet, moderate carbonation, little mineral in the finish.
Bière rafraîchissante, légère amertume en arrière goût. Bière légère. Alcool 5,5% et non 6 comme indiqué

33cl bottle (5,5%) from E.Leclerc supermarket in Pierry, France. F: huge, egg-white, good retention. C: blonde to pale gold, hazy. A: malty, sweet fruity, floral, bit yeasty, caramel. T: medium malty base, nice mellow fruity, bit spicy, yeasty, caramel, decent bitterness, medium carbonation, not bad for the buckwheat beer, enjoyed.
33 cl bottle poured into a glass. The beer is a lighter hazy gold with a white head of foam. Eating lemon and dry, pithy bitterness. Medium body and medium carbonation.
Blonde légère. Petite amertume à la mise en bouche, vague note fruitée. Sarrasin introuvable. Corps qui disparaît vite.

33 cl. bottle @ home, gift from Jan-Willem. Light hazy light yellow with a white head. Yeasty fruity aroma with some citrus. Also some spicy creaminess from the buckwheat. Sweet taste with a light bitter finish. Nice fresh blonde.

Kalea Bier-Adventkalender Frankreich-Version 04.12.2018; Trotz des etwas erhöhten Alkoholgehaltes ist es ein leicht schmeckendes, spritziges Bier. Dieses fällt besonders durch seine Fruchtigkeit mit Geschmack nach Melone auf. Fast schon glaubt man amerikanischen Aromahopfen zu finden, aber als Spezial-Zutat wurde stattdessen Buchweizen hinzugegeben. Der erwartete Brotgeschmack blieb aber aus. Ein wirklich interessantes, fruchtiges Bier.
Dégustation sympathique, une bonne bière assez simple et au caractère assez passe-partout. Peu à en dire si ce n'est que j'en goûterai à nouveau avec plaisir.
(paille orange, nez ~malt (rien d’autre), bouche où le sarrasin (ad) se fait μ-sentir, puis tout s’affadit : eau arrangée)
Bottle from Brittany, France. Hazy yellow color, white head. Yeasty, spicy, à bit sour. Ok
Couleur jaune avec la tête blanche. Arôme et goût du pain, du malt, de la paille et des fruits.
Dark brown nearly black body with tan head. Aroma is roasted malts caramel. Taste is malts caramel grains hints of honey. Aftertaste is is sweet malty.
Bottle from my father, bought in Austria. Light smell, bready malty with some caramel. Similar taste but stronger. Light bitterness.

Bottle, 0.5l. Clear deep ruby pour with one finger off-white head. Soapy looking, regular retention and lacing. Malts on the nose, a bit grainy. Slight caramel. Some roastiness. Thin to medium body, medium carbonation. Average texture, perhaps a bit thicker. Malty sweet taste with mild bitterness later on. Aroma is mostly malty, sweet caramel and toffee. Slightly roasted, bready. Developing into mild hop bitterness paired with some metal acidity. Herbal aftertaste, short finish. Overall, a bit bland but easily drinkable. Average.

500ml bottle. Pours translucent black with little head. Aroma is chocolate, vinegar and a little of the savoury cheese notes that I usually dislike of the style. Flavour is savoury caramel with almost some Cola fruitiness and a clean finish. Essentially ordered in panic at a restaurant, and it’s not a style I’m fond of, but much better than it could have been.

0.5 l bottle. Pours full black color and no head. Slight aromas of chocolate, roasted malts, some coffee and sweet malts with metallic notes. Sweet chocolate, earthy notes and some other sweet taste at the end of the nip that i cant identify. Nice dunkel.
Klare dunkel orange braune Farbe, mittelgroße beige schaumkrone. Geruch dezent süß malzig, karamellig, würzig hopfig. Geschmack süß leicht röstmalzig, nussig, Karamell, leicht metallisch hopfig.

Bottle: Reddish brown/amber color, creamy brownish head. Malty, carmalic, sweetish and light roasty aroma. Flavor is sweetish, malty, caramelic. Light cacao and roasted malt notes. Ok but too sweetish for me.

Seems that this isn’t retired anymore. Bought a bottle a few days ago in a supermarket in Vorchdorf, near the brewery. Dark red to brown, clear body, with a big, frothy, beige head, that isn’t very stable. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, nuts, red and dark berries and also some metallic notes. Taste with about the same aromas, but sweeter, with the fruity and caramel notes more present and with metallic notes again. Mouthfeel is medium, slick, with a low carbonation and it finishes sweet and slightly roasty-bitter. Firstly, the metallic notes aren’t really pleasant, but at least they disappear more and more the more this beer warms up. Otherwise this is an average Dunkel, that isn’t bad, but, as many other beers of this style, too sweet for my liking. Overall decent, but not as good as I expected.
Drunk from bottle in Schloetgen, Austria. Very dark and quite sweet beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500 mL bottle had in Vienna on 6/3. Darker brown color of any other dunkel I had while in Europe. Nutty, roasty aroma. Flavor was nutty and caramel. Lightly dry finish. Carbonation was lively on the tongue but not overdone. Definitely the best dunkel I had while in Europe and one that I wouldn’t mind drinking again.

Draught @ the 7th Ave Sun, San Diego, CA. Pours a clear golden colour with a small foamy head. Aroma of grainy malts, some mild floral notes and white bread. Flavour of mild grainy maltiness, mild bitterness and some weird off-flavours. Maybe soap. Light bodied.

Draught at the brewpub in San Diego. Clear golden beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Grassy hop aroma, floral, citrus, biscuits, some caramel. Fruity hop flavor, bready, caramel, hay, citrus, peach notes. A bit thin.
Draft @ the brewpub. Pours a golden color with a white head. Has a fruity malty grainy aroma. Fruity malty grainy flavor with weak hoppy hints. Has a fruity malty grainy finish.

Draught Very pale gold, fine white rim. Grapey nose, green grapes; very demure, whiff of acetone. Quite sugary, but with a hoppy revenge/finish, that itself is fast gone again, falling flat. Light body, but reasonably refreshing. Well OK, it wasn’t designed to be a world beater.
I thought this was a nice gold ale that had a good color and nice head. The taste was sweet and malty and it went down smooth. Pretty good beer for a brew pub.
On tap at SD Brew Co. Crystal clear amber yellow. Nose is very light- almost unable to pick up surrounded by restaurant smells. Light honey sweet. Taste just meh. Hints of ammonia. Not very good.
Draft: Part of a 7 draft beer sampler at the brewery. Smooth and light but flavorfull. Food Pairing: Hot Wings.

Draft. A golden beer with a lazing white head. The aroma has primary notes of malt, but also lighter notes of sulphur and brewmash. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt and straw, as well as lighter notes of sulphur, leading to a bitter finish.
Draft at the brewpub. Clear gold, white head. Grain, malt, light hops, and crisp. Easy drinking blonde, non-offensive.

Tap @ SDBC. Pours a deep crystal clear gold with a small white ring. Faint hops and some cereal grain on the nose. Nice full flavor with corn, grain, and light hop bitterness on the finish, very crisp.
Draught at San Diego Brewing Co. Clear amber beer with a small offwhite head. Hoppy citrus aroma, sourish, grassy notes. Hoppy citeus flavor, grassy, hay, slightly sourish.

Draft @ the brewpub. Pours an amber color with a white head. Has a fruity malty caramel aroma. Fruity malty caramel flavor with weak hoppy hints. Has a fruity malty caramel finish with weak hoppy hints in the aftertaste.

Poured from a tap into a pint glass at the San Diego Brewing Company. Color was reddish brown with about an inch of head. Plenty of film left over. Smelled dark brown, light nutty. Reddish. Fairly average and non-descript. Tasted malty with some caramel in there. Nutty. Overall better than the smell. Fairly good aftertaste. It was consistent throughout. Probably average on the carbonation. Decent mouth feel.
On tap at SD Brew Co. Clear orange. Light, subtle nose. Again, almost non-existent while surrounded by the restaurant. Taste has hint of vegatable and spice. Juniper berries? Not great.
Draft @ San Diego Brewing Company: Part of a 7 sampler set. Tasty, malty caramel notes. Nice. Food Pairing: BBQ Pork Sandwich.
Draft. An amber beer with a thin beige head. The aroma has notes of malt and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, and fruit, leading to a dry and bret’y finish.
Draft at the brewpub. Clear amber, white head. Sweet malt, caramel, light citrus hops. Average, average.

A: The pour is the standard color for the style: amber. The head is slightly off-white and is a bit creamy in texture. S: A pretty decent nose on this beer, actually. Creamy caramel sweetness with a bit of toasted malt and burnt marshmallows. T: There is a slight buttery quality to the flavor which is a bit off-putting, but otherwise not too bad. A mildly toasty note with the rest of the taste being made up of some semi-sweet caramel. M: Pretty average in terms of mouthfeel: medium body and in terms of carbonation. D: Easy enough to drink, but not outstanding in anyway. Your typical brewpub offering, here.
Tap @ SDBC. Pours a clear medium amber / red with a small off white ring. Faint nose of roasted malts with some herbal hops in the background.

On tap. Clear amber golden with a creamy off-white head leaving a pretty lacework. Sweetish aroma of roasted malt and caramel. Medium body with a smooth mouthfeel, good and solid maltiness with caramel accents. The finish is dry and lightly hoppy. 070709

column1: San Diego Old Town Nut Brown
column5: Draft. Pours deep brown with a beige head. Toasted and lightly sweet, low bitterness, and just a touch worty. Fine.

column1: San Diego Old Town Nut Brown
column5: Draught at San Diego Brewing Co. Clear deep amber beer with a nice beige/brownish head. Roasted fruity aroma, grapes, hay, caramel, chocolate notes. Roasted chocolate flavor, grapes, figs, cacao nibs, some licorice. Decent beer.

column1: San Diego Old Town Nut Brown
column5: Brown with off white head - Malt aroma with hints of sweetnass - Good malt body - Malt goes into the finish - This was ok

column1: San Diego Old Town Nut Brown
