Notes from early 90s. From 33cl bottle. Amber color. Aroma’s: spices, candy sugar. Flavor: light malty sweet. Medium bodied. Long finish without any new flavors. Like most 3 Horne beers, this was more like a Belgian ale than anything else.
Pours an orange unclear beer with a good white head. Smells malts, honey. Tastes sweet, honey and caramel. Bleh. Low carbo, thin body and a sticky texture.
Oranje kleur met een volle kraag. Ruikt hop, mout en iets kruiden. Smaakt bitterzoet, zacht, iets kruiden.
Bottle 0,33ltr: Hazy orange coloured brew with some floating yeast. Taste is kind a fruity sweet bitter taste.

Bottle @ home shared by Dutchdrebus. Hazy opaque dark orange to reddish color, small off - white head. Yeast residu. Smell and taste malts, some fruits, some fruitpeel and sweetness. Average body and carbonation.
Bottle @ benzai. Hazy orange filled with yeast chunks, head doesn’t last. Smells sweetish, slightly fruity, malts. Tastes slightly fruity, sweet, raisins.. Could be worse. Medium body, nice carbo.
Poured a cloudy light amber with a small white head. Aroma of sweet grainy malt and grass. Medium body, quite lively, flavour of sweet orange, creamy with a sweet end.
Bottle@tasting (1998), 300ml. Head: some off-white foam. Colour: hazy, brass. Aroma: yeast, sweets. Taste: some bitter-sweet. Palate: small bitter-sweet finish. Overall: ok

Bottle: Small to medium sized white head, changes quick into a thing lacing/ring on top of a hazy orange colored beer. Aromas of peach, yeast, hops, roosvice, a light hint of glue and malts. Flavours of malts, fruit, yeast, herbs, light chalk, light hoos and citrus, creamy and a hint of wood. Aftertaste fruit, yeast, bitters, hops and plants. Low carbo, soft mouthfeel, medium body and a texture between watery and creamy.

Bottled (backlog). Kind of ambery orange colour with a mediumsized off-white foamy head. Aromai is spices, ripe fruits, sweet malts and also some mild earthiness. Flavour is herbal, grassy, spicy and some sweet malts along with sweet fruity notes. Tasty, but not very bocklike.
2012 - 05 - 11 330ml bottle.ruby-brown colour. small creme head. dark fruit in aroma. sweet taste

Mahogany reddish brown, with beige creamy body. Toffee, raisins, cereal, apple and dusty yeast. Spiced too. Very sweet but balanced by spices and small but lively carbonation. Straightforward, but with the yeast it gets a more interesting (yet bit amateurish) character. Nice still. More autumn than spring... (33cl bottle, reasonably priced)
Hazy dark orange color, head dissappears fast. Smells pretty fresh, fruity, like blossom. Taste sweetness, malts, little fruit. Low body.

Süßer, etwas klebrig-malziger Antrunk mit leichter Gerstennote. Danach schnell milder, fast wässrig werdend, noch leicht hellmalzig. Bevor das Bier endgültig aufgibt kurz hopfig. Langweiliger Bock. 13/8/7/5/6/6
33cl bottle from ABCBeers. Timed out so I lost my review. Not happy!

Bottle @ OD’10: Quick disappearing white foamy head. Hazy dark orange color. Smell malts, fruit (apple), sugar and hint of alcohol. Taste sweet, malts, fruit, hints of hop and spices. Very sweet with hints, just very slight hints of bitter. Stays sweet with a touch of fruit, malts and sugars.

Bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Nice fruity notes. Moderate bitter fruity flavor. Nice citrus notes. Oily palate. More like a belgian ale than heller bock.

Bottle 330ml. Clear medium orange amber color with a average, frothy to creamy, good lacing, fully lasting, light beige head. Aroma is moderate to light light light heavy malty, caramel, orange, berry - raisin, plum, prune. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20091113]
Bottle, 6.5%. Strange baking yeast aroma. Cloudy amber colour. Small stable white head. The flavour is nicely caramelly, seems to come from hops. Has some baking yeast to the flavour, but it is OK.
Bottle from Landbierparadies. Clear golden colour, white foam. Medium sweet, grassy, bitter hoppy finish. Nice and well balanced pils.
Flaska från Landbierparadies. Gyllengul klar vätska med högt stabilt vitt skum. En klassisk ganska torr pilsner med medelstor kropp. En hel del gräsig humle med tydlig beska, lite salt bröd. Gott
Golden. Aroma is herbal, a little chalky, dried grass. Taste is light caramel with herbal tart hops. Tart and quite drinkable. Good.
Bottle. Clear glowing golden color with white head. Aroma is grassy, herbal hops, pale malts. Taste is grassy, not too sweet, crackery malts. Dry, oily mouthfeel with natural carbonation. Nice one!
Yellow gold, light but fine head. Spicy clean pils aroma, traditional hops. Great smooth flavor, I really like the mild bitterness and drinkability of this pils. Perfect all-night drinking beer.
Bottle. Clear golden, low white head. Herbal grassy, light flowery nose. Medium body, light ckalky, chewy, a hint corn, light metal. Nice.
Táp @ porch, Bayreuth. Hu micsoda könnyed pils, hózen koncert előtt tökéletes alapozas

500ml bottle. Crystal clear, yellow-ish golden colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Minimally grainy and strawy, malty aroma, some malt spiciness, grassy-spicy hoppy counterpart. Taste is mildly dry, herbal-grassy hoppy, sweet-ish malty, minimally grainy and strawy, a touch of sage; oily texture, smooth, soft, silky palate.
The beer has got a deep clear golden colour with an airy head and medium body. Aroma of hops and citrus. taste of hops, citrus, malt and bread. Mild bitter finish.
50 cl bottle. Straight from the bottle while in a house party.only numerical values.

Flaska från Landbierparadis. Relativt klar bärnstensfärgad vätska med en låg skumpuck. Maltiga dofter med karamell, mjölkchoklad, limpa, mjuk pepparkaka, pop corn. Ganska söt brödig smakbild som saknar lite fyllighet och smakdjup. Ok
500ml Bottle - Dark amber in colour, almost no head. Caramel, nuts and popcorn in the aroma. Caramel, popcorn and walnuts all feature in the malty and slightly sweet taste. A bit of a buttery finish.

Bottled, from Hier Gibt's Bier. Clear mahogany colour, brief head. Bready, caramelly nose. Mid sweet with medium body and rounded mouthfeel. Bready and lightly fruity, slight notes of chocolate. Low bitterness.
Táp @ porsch, Bayreuth. Before the hozen koncert. Arany barna szín édeskés.

resin, floral, grass, spruce, citrus, herbs, caramel, bread, hay, cereal, chocolate, light sweetness, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium sourness, light body, medium body, creamy, sticky, average carbonation, astringent,

Bottle. Clear brown-ruby color with off-white head. Aroma is grainy, straw, nutty, dusty malts. Taste is nutty, grainy, caramel, bready yeasts, some fruity notes. Silky mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Quite pleasant!

Bernsteinfarben im Glas mit minimaler Blume. Der Antrunk ist angenehm malzig, der Körper hat eine feine Röstnote und ist gut mild, nicht wässrig! Im Abgang ist eine leichte fruchtige Säure zu verspüren die sehr wenig Hopfenbittere enthält.
Bottle @ Bayreuth. Pours amber with a small white head. Bread, caramel and Dark fruit. Medium bodied. Rustic in a way. Short bitter finish.

Bottle at home. Pours hazy brown with a white head, Aroma of caramel, light grains, marzipan, dried fruits, slight toffe. Taste is rather sweet, loads of dried and caramel, lightly bitter, light dusty, but i think it has some qualitys.

My Bottom Line: Apricot jam and caramel limp towards a sweetish finish in this lacklustre Zwicklbier. Further Personal Perceptions: -A sheet of foam covers the clear amber. -Mouthfeel is slick and bubbly. Doesn’t really serve the subtle flavour profile all that well, methinks. -More herbal hops wouldn’t hurt in the back. -This doesn’t have the character of a typical Franconian Landbier; it is well made, but tastes somewhat generic. On tap at Café Kraftraum, Bayreuth, as Stöckels Zwickl.

Flaska från Landbierparadis. Har paserat BBD för några veckor sedan. Disig gyllengul vätska med högt vitt skum. Medelsöt. Banan, bubbelgum, plåster, nejlika, jäst. Aningen fadd och lite metallisk eftersmak som kanske kan bero på att den stått för länge. Annars trevlig och stiltypisk. Gott.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 10A). Bottle 50 cl - Batch unknown (BBF 20.08.19). AROMA: medium clove and slight bubblegum notes with a medium wheaty-sweet malt background. APPEARANCE: light gold color and slightly hazy. medium-large moussy white head with good retention. TASTE: initial medium clove and slight bubblegum notes, followed by a slightly sweet medium-low wheat malt background. faint citric note. medium-low bitterness with a semi-dry to dry finish and slightly wheaty. PALATE: medium body with medium-high to high carbonation. slight fluffy texture. OVERALL: although its best before date is already gone, this weiss is still very good.
0,5l bottle Nürnberg- superhazy golden with a white fluffy head - aromas of banana hopfen and lemon - tastes thick and sweetbitter with all the previous and a touch of spicy - a nice weisse

500ml bottle. Cloudy, dark golden colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Wheaty, fruity aroma, notes of banana, hints of pear, a lemon dash, sweet-ish, minimally bready, wheat malty basis, slightly leafy, grassy, hoppy overtones. Taste is minimally sweet wheaty, fruity, minimally diluted hints of banana, pear, a lemon dash, dry, slightly leafy and minimally grassy hoppy counterweight; well balanced, very refreshing - nice!
Pours hazy golden with a foamy white head. Cloves, lemon, banana and some earthy notes in the aroma.

Draft @ Schäufelewärtschaft, Nürnberg. Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy banana aroma. Fruity wheat malty spicy banana flavor. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy banana finish.

Bottled, from Biershop Bayern. Cloudy golden, rich firm head. Generous aroma of banana and bread. Mid sweet with medium body and well rounded mouthfeel, spritzy carbonation. Phenolic with banana and cloves, some bandaid. Low bitterness. Authentic, drinkable weizen.
Bottle at Griese. Hazy blond-orange. Very spicy, banana and yeast. Taste is wheat and a touch of fruit tartness. Highly carbed. Decent and quaffable.

Bottle at Griess. Really ropy, cloudy yellow pour with thick white head. Aroma is really spicy, not just clove, some allspice and pepper in there as well, light banana, really yeasty. Taste is yeasty, spicy, bready finish, pretty sweet. Intense carbonation makes it a bit hard to drink. OK.
Bottle looks simple but okay. Beer in the glass zippy, small head. Starts intense malty-yeasty, modest sourish, not very dry. Finish malty-bready, still sourish, unbalanced. Not so good.

Old notes from 2003. Not sure were from as I didn’t necessarily note that down back then. A quite dark coloured best bitter. Has the usual Rebellion fruity malt profile but enough earthy hops to prevent it from straying too far in that direction. Fairly full bodied.
Cask Handpump at the Penny Black, Northwich (JDW) 23/05/2002 Mid brown coloured with citrus and floral aromas. Dry finish.
Tested cask-conditioned. Suffer's, like other Rebellion beers from a cloying sweetness. At least this beer has some bitterness to match. Good.

Sampled cask conditioned. Chestnut brown. Nice aroma of red berries. Medium bodied, fruity, malty, vinuous. Medium bitterness in the finish. An interesting and well balanced ale with a unusual touch of berries.

Sampled cask conditioned. Golden coloured, very slightly hazy. Wonderful spicy aroma with a touch of grapefruit. The flavour is breaking abruptly with the aroma as it is bordering to be overly sweet and rather light bodied. The finish is nicely bitter and a tad resiny.
Hazy yellowcolor with a foamy white head. Big banana clove nose. Big flavors of banana, clove, puffed wheat and some lemon tartness in the finish. Nice traditional Bavarian wheat.
On tap. Murky golden color with one finger head. Banana and clove aroma. Tasty is of cloves and a little watery. Not bad.
Pours a cloudy pale yellow color. White thin head. Aroma of Belgian yeast and citrus. Taste has a slight tang. Great hefe.
Cloudy yellow... Aroma of wheat, flavor with notes of cloves and bananas... Rich wheaty flavor... Decent ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
My favorite of the sampler flight, so I ordered another. Pours hazy yellow. Banana and clove on the nose, slightly sweet taste, some gumball notes. Clean short finish.
Pours golden from tap. This is one of the clearest Hefeweizens I’ve yet had. A bit of banana on the nose. The notes are a bit more muted on the tongue. Clean finisher.
Slightly hazy pour. Nose is fairly fruity. Light clove with a distinct pale malt sweetness. Light astringency on the finish. Soft wheaty palate. By-the-number, but okay.
tap @ Church - musty, cloves and estery banana. Yogurt and nuts. Hazy orange pour, no head. Smooth caramel, wet sweet malts, finishes with a nice hoppy bite.
Lacked proper glassware, fairly light in flavor and body, nice traditional ode

On tap at Church on our way to RBSG. Pours a gently hazy browned yellow amber with a medium sized white head. Light sulfur, bananas and yeast, wheat. Smooth. Lots of banana flavors. Quite smooth. Banana and oxidization on the finish.

(cask-conditioned). dark brown , near opaquecolour beige head that leaves some lace. aroma of burnt plums and dfry fruits, taste is sweet but understated, lots of fruity tastes in this with a defined caramel character. good creamy mouthfeel. ends with a bitter finish

On draught at the Grays Tied House just west of Madison, Wisconsin. Pours a hazy, unfiltered golden pale brew with a fast dissolving white head that leaves behind a thin white ring and no lacing. Aroma of coriander, cloves, some banana esters, orange zest and a touch of bubble gum. Taste is medium bodied, very light carbonation with flavors of mostly yeast, whet malt, coriander and a touch of orange zest. Finish is semi-dry with a lingering yeast and light wheat malt aftertaste. A touch heavy on the yeast flavor but still a nice dry witbier.

Date: 08/07/2008 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: opaque yellow, fine white head, streaks of lace, Aroma: sweet orange aroma with lots of spices, Flavor: sweet malt flavor, lots of orange, an abundance of spicyness balances the sweetness to give it a dry finish, Overall: perfect summer wit Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 13/20 Rating: 3.1/5.0 Drinkability: 9/10 Score: **+/4

I do believe this is the first time I’ve seen this beer. Sampled on draught at the brewery. Poured a cloudy golden colour with a large white head. Aroma is fruity, wheat- orange peel, coriander and spice on the nose. Taste is pleasent. Plenty of wheat and creamy flavors on the palate.

english pint / spicy, orange, grain aroma. fizzy pour. slightly active, slightly hazy, straw body. big, airy, and loud white head. fizzy mouthfeel, a bit prickly, a bit cloying--not smooth, and i almost have to chew it down... ugh. slightly spicy wheat with orange. nothing special, nothing great, but not bad.
I usually like the Witbiers, but for some reason, this one was not that impressive. Just a nice light beer with the orange peel flavor. Nice.

Very pale straw color, quickly dissipating effervescent head. Stale, grainy aroma of old coriander. Flavors are a little better; sweet orange and slightly malty. A bit stickier than this style should be.

It seems that Belgian and Belgian style beers are a problem for me. This beer looked good in the glass but beyond that it was not to my tastes. Whether it was the sweetness or the spices, I don't know. Just didn't like this.
Dull hay color, huge head; looks weak to me. Nose faint, fresh grass and lemons. Weak yeastiness, caramel and lemon going down; rather soda-like.
Sampled this as part of a three witbier sampling and found it to be very nice. The aroma is very earthy, as is the flavor. Good, cloudy, medium gold color, and white head. A pretty nice wit!

Sweet, juicy citrus aroma, some lemon, orange, wheat malt and coriander spiciness, with some clove and light banana esters. Light, hazy golden yellow color, lots of particulates, with a fading head. Sweet, fruity and lightly tart flavor profile, with generous amounts of orange and spice. Finishes abruptly. Light bodied, with a watery palate. Highly drinkable.

Aluminum bottle for real Madrid football club fans pffff. A clear golden beer with medium head, nose on pils malt, nutty, grain touch. Aroma on sweet pils malt, hight carbonated, still nutty, blond caramel some bitterness, better than expected , wet paper finish.
Bottle from Intermarche, Budens, Portugal. Golden coloured with a thin white head. It has a grassy and woody flavour with fruit on the gentle earthy and corn finish. Ok.
La bière de Madrid, légère mais reste une lager très rafraîchissante ! Bien commander un tercio
Clear, medium head, malty, watery, served cold goes realy well. Like water.
Can. Barely smells of anything, light grain. Taste is not much, but rather easy drinking and slightly refreshing
Pale with a small white head. Smells metallic and corny. Taste is watery lager, bitter finish. Can taste the alcohol. Not much going on otherwise.
Bottle drunk at home. Clear golden appearance. Aroma is sweet and malt. Flavour is sweet, malt, metallic and corn.
330 ml bottle. Clear color withe easy head. Sweet lager smell. Kind of metalic taste, bad, not easy ending. Bad beer :(

Dieses Bier hat nicht nur mehr Alkoholprozent, sondern überhaupt mehr Körper als das Mahou Clásica. Besonders vollmundig jeinde ich es trotzdem nicht. Ein gemütliches Bier, das keine Probleme macht aber auch keine Begeisterungsstürme.
Meget let og tynd øl. Ikke det store på smags oplevelsen. Minder en del om sam miguel
Cerveza industrial de estilo lager negra sin cuerpo y un sabor muy leve a torrefacto
this was okay. some dark malt flavors but overall not that great. perhaps too light at times.
No tiene cuerpo ni sabor necesario para considerarse cerveza negra. Muy floja en general, una decepción.

BBE 27-12-19. Ruskeanpunertava väri, medium äänekäs poreileva vaahto, suutuntuma makean nektariininen, lievää onttoutta, hernettäkin. Ei niin makea kuin tyypilliset balttidunkelit, sekä hyvässä ja pahassa.
Cerveza estilo Dark Brune, aroma tenue pero sabor fuerte a café y maltas tostadas el retro gusto persistente.

Аромат хлебный, слегка дрожжевой, приятный, похожий на квас. Цвет не особо темный, скорее темно коричневый. Вкус по началу радует, хлебный, немного солодовый. А вот послевкусие полное разочарование. Кислое, противный кофейный оттенок, а также горечь. В общем вообще не то.

Bier zo zwart en helaas zo dun als inkt, zonder enig kenmerk van schuim. Het aroma is niet erg spannend, in de smaak zit gelukkig wel pit: mout, zwarte olijven, koffie en tja...dat was het eigenlijk wel. flesje gekocht voor het etiket: bleek het een sticker te zijn, die er niet in zijn geheel af ging.
Pour is coca cola brown with little to no head, aroma is nutty malt and some chocolate, flavour is malty smooth, light coffee bitterness
Blid og rund. Tydelig duft af ristet malt. Mørke brun i farven. Let med en god sødme.

Una de las peores Dark Beer que he probado... Aunque para ser de Mahou, es algo pasable. Queda mucho que mejorar. Sensación algo aguada, espuma mediana y poco persistente aroma flojo,regaliz,cacao...casi inapreciable.Sabor caramelo , tostado.. Cuerpo medio. ¿Tiene colorante? Porque no me extrañaría.
Bright golden beer with almost no head. Ricy dry taste lacking any type of recognizable aroma.
On tap somewhere in southern Spain. Tasteless, alcohol bearing refreshment. Better not allow to temper, it gets even worse.
Pale yellow. Fizzy and thin, no maltiness, very little butterness. No fun...

Draught and bottle. @"random place", Murcia (Spain). Backlog. Clear yellow with a medium white head. Aroma is soft bready and malty. Taste is almost the same. Light watery and corny finish. Next one please!
Op een terras in Valencia, bij de lunch, twee flesjes. Gouden kleur, helder. Prima fris pils.

Color amarillo cobrizo, cristalina. Dos de espuma con buena retención. Aroma muy discreto a cereal. Gusto a cereal, maíz, ligero cartón y notas metálicas, amargor medio de extracto de lúpulo noble. Cuerpo acuoso. Pale Lager industrial, cansina y con más notas negativas que positivas.

Color dorado transparente con espuma media blanca de buena retención y residuo medio. Aroma mineral y a cereales con notas a metal y lúpulos nobles. Sabor a cereal blanco, maíz y minerales con notas a cereal poco tostado y ligero caramelo. Amargor medio y neutro de corta duración. Textura acuosa, cuerpo ligero y carbonatación alta. Una Pale Lager española del montón. Quita la sed y ya está.
Una lager como muchas otras, sabor un poco más marcado pero no mejora respecto a cualquier marca blanca. Exceso de carbónico, con 2 quintos tienes la barriga llena
Bottle. Golden color, white foam. Aroma and taste: malt and a light hint of hops, almost pure, nothing special.

Bottle 0.33l from Supersol, Granada, Spain. 01.06.2017. Pour it clear golden color with small white head. Aroma light honey note. Taste watery, easy drinkable, light sweetness, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, okayish.

On tap at Palma 60, Madrid. Pours bright golden, very nice clean-white head that lasts just a moment and leaves a long-lingering ring. Aroma is very low: mainly iron filings, accompanied by a hint of honey and a tinge of porridge. Taste is very metallic, watery, nice on the freshness side but very low on the bitterness. Surprisingly long-lasting aftertaste.

Clear, golden, the foam firm and pleasant for the eye. That's all the advantages. Smells of cereal, corn, some faint hops, also iron, but most of all cough syrup. Sweet, dense cough syrup. Baaad. Malty, medium full, still this cough-syrupy thing .burns in the throat. Even more iron. I expected a bland, watery lager, I got a wide range of flavours, of which not even one is pleasant.

330 ml bottle. Pours clear golden with a decent yet rapidly dissipating white head. Aroma of slight pale barley malt with a very slight note of corn & hay. Taste is semi-sweet with a low bitterness. Flavors of slight barley malt, grain, slight hoppiness. Medium body, slick crispy texture, average to low carbonation. A pretty average pale lager, though this one doesn't have any siginifant flaws. Una cerveza mediocre. ;)

(bottle) clear golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of heavy manure and salted wheat, with lots of barnyard, some caramelized grain and powdered sugar. flavour is more straw and barnyard, very rustic, with a touch of grain and some floral hops in the light-bitter finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.
Clear yellow. Aroma is lightstruck, hay malt, some peas, some wheat. Taste is not inspiring, some tart dust, more vegetables with a hint of murky sourness in the finish. Medium body, not enjoyable.

Bottle. Clear yellow color with white head. Aroma is earthy, a touch buttery, cooked peas. Taste is dog food, peas, veggies, earthy. Watery mouthfeel with crisp carbonation. I don't like it. Seems a bit lightstruck as well... Weird for a locally bought brown color.
Bottle. Yellow, white lace. Lightly skunked grassy hop nose. Light body, foamy, mellow mouthfeel. Hayish maltiness, ckalk, minerals, DMS, somewhat one-dimensional bittering hops. ok.
50cl bottle. Pours clear golden colour with a huge most good lasting white head. Aroma of grainy malt, mild grassy hops. Taste of grains, mild grassy and spicy hops, nothing special.
(Bue sur place): Une pilsener filiforme très sulfureuse et minérale qui contient l’essense du pamplemousse. Une finale légèrement ferreuse n’empêche pas une buvabilité exemplaire.

My Bottom Line: This dry and bubbly Pils shares bitter herbs and mild hay alongside sulfury components and mineral edges. Further Personal Perceptions: -A veil of foam covers the clear pale straw blond. -Drinkability is there even though this is not a memorable example. -This brewer has got a distinctive signature. -The mouthfeel enables big gulps. On tap at the brewpub.

Der Gruch ist süßlich-wässrig. Das Bier an sich ist ziemlich herb-vollmundig. es hat schöne Hopfenaromen, ist schön blumig. Nur der Nachgeschmack ist ziemlich schnell "weg" - das einzige, was lange auf der Zunge verbleibt, ist eine Herbe Note ohne irgendwelche anderen Aromen. Da fehlt einfach noch was! Insgesamt aber ist es gut trinkbar und sehr erfrischend!! Test vom 8.3.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 12,8,11,4,12,8 - 8,45
Bottle. Pale golden colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, malt, hop, grass. Flavour is fruit, malt, hop, grass. Medium body. Ordinary beer.

Bottle 500ml. Clear medium orange yellow colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, hay, toasted, light straw, light to moderate hoppy, dusty grass, keller. Flavour is moderate sweet and light bitter with a average to long duration, sweet malt, straw. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120217]

"Hufeisen Kellerweizen", Flasche vom Hufeisen-Getränkekeller, Pottenstein. - Gut trübes Hellgelb; feiner Schaum. - In der Nase prominente Gewürznote (Nelke und dgl.), herbe Orangenschale, milde Hefe über weichem Weizenmalz. - Antrunk weich und schlank weizenmalzig mit feiner, angenehmer Zitrusfrucht (Orangenöl) und sehr dezenter Nelke. Zarte Restsüße, ganz wenig (leicht unreife) Banane. Mild rezent, nicht zu hefig. Sortentypisch milder fruchtig-herber Abgang mit leicht unreifer Banane. - Sehr schönes, schlankes Hefeweizen, nicht so breit weizenmalzig und fett bananig wie viele sondern spritzig und elegant zitrusfruchtig. Schmeckt auch einem Nicht-Weizenfreund wie mir.
Hazy golden. Aroma is very green, some artificial banana gummy bears, maoam. Taste is sweet melisse and banana, gletschereis. No tart counterpoint. A bit unbalanced.

(bottle) murky golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of lemon juice and pizza dough, slightly rotten, with a touch of canned peaches and tomato concentrate. flavour is mostly banana pulp and wheat, with a hint of sugar icing and a rather dry grassy finish. medium-bodied with lively carbonation.
Bottle. Cloudy orange-golden, white layer. Very spicy aroma - clove,allspice overdose. Medium body, foamy mouthfeel. Spicy, lightly vegetal, gunpowder, vanilla finish. Not thrilled.
Bottle. Hazy yellow-golden color with white head. Aroma is bananas, dough, sweaty, spicy yeasts. Taste is bananas, mineralic, dough, cloves, cream. Silky mouthfeel with medium carbonation.

Bottle 50cl. from Total gas station @ Pottenstein. Poured into a weizen glass. Hazy to cloudy straw golden, tall frothy white head, receding slowly, fair lacing; light aroma, bit sourish, wheat, light banana, yeast; light sweet and sour taste, fruity, watery, yeasty; mainly sweet aftertaste with light sourish and bitter notes; light body, watery texture, soft carbonation; a very mild weizen, quite drinkable.

Fläschla: Pale golden, hazy, small persistent white head; mild to moderate sourish-fruity nose of bananas, wheat and yeast; mild to moderate sourish-sweetish flavour, light bodied and a bit tartbarnyard, lingering sourish-bananey finish with yeast and a tinge of cloves. Drinkable, but not a glorous Weizen
50cl bottle. Pours hazy pale golden colour with a mid-sized white head. Aroma of sweet banana and yeast. Taste of sweet banana and yeast, boring!

(Bue sur place): Banane, citron et meringue forme littéralement une tarte liquide aux accents minéraux et floraux. Quelque chose de maladroit à propos de cette bière m’empêche de l’apprécier davantage.

My Bottom Line: Flowers and banana esters can’t exactly shake off underlying phenols and their rubbery edge, yet the personality of it all remains engaging and drinkable. Further Personal Perceptions: -A creamy head of foam covers the cloudy beige. -Mineral angles appear here and there. -The cushiony effervescence matches the sweetish cereals. -Like their three brews tried that day, this one was decent but a tad clunky. On tap at the brewpub.

“Lübzer Pils“, Flasche. - Pilsgelb, klar. - Im Antrunk kräftige zitronenschalige Hopfenherbe. Gut rezent, schlank. Derb bitterer Abgang mit krautiger Hopfenherbe und feuchtem Laub. - Derbes Industriepilsener, immerhin gut bitter und erfrischend. (25.10.2019.)

Jasnozłote, idealnie klarowne. Po otwarciu czuć było trochę ziołowego chmielu, po przelaniu już mniej, do tego słód i nuta mokrego zboża. W smaku czysta słodowość z nutą chmielu. Goryczka jakaś jest, szkoda, że nie ciut wyższa. Do dobrego pilsa trochę brakuje ale jest całkiem w porządku

(500ml can, 0.58 EUR, Berlin) AROMA: light pils nose, leans a bit towards a good american lager, APPEARANCE: pretty golden/honey yellow, average head TASTE: grain/malt, moderate hops, hints of grainy bread, crust PALATE: light/medium body, crisp, clean, middle of the road feel OVERALL: a respectable cheap pils. better than most mass lagers, a bit simple and straightforward, but an easy and fresh drink.
Draught @ Rest. Torschliesserhaus, Altstadt, Stralsund. Nice pils: straw and herbal features.Pleasant bitter finish. On the downside, some metallic aroma. Went well with a schnitzel.
Not too interesting, just average beer of pilsener type. It felt a bit weakush and waterly to me.

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.
22-06-19 // bottle at at Strand Trassenheide at Usedom. Paired with a fresh "Fischbrötchen" this Pils was really nice and refreshing hoppy bitter.

Standard pilsener. semi sweet malt and a little lemon. The taste is OK but use a mug as the beer has completely no foam.Standard pilsener. semi sweet malt and a little lemon. The taste is OK but use a mug as the beer has completely no foam.
33cl bottle at Anomalie, Berlin in the early hours on 25-May-2019. Pilsener, with flavours of grain, malt and citrus.
złote o całkiem bujnej pianie, nie utrzymującej się. Złote o aromat słodowo-słodki. Smak słodki wodnisty. Słabe
Flaska. Klar guldfärgad med ett vitt skum. Smaker och dofter av gräs, bröd, malt och en lättare kryddighet. Frisk och fräsch.

This beer is coming from the Swiss dining car, drinking and judging this beer, at home, in Epalinges, for the Christmas day, 24th december 2018. Not my favourite, but it is drinkable without any problem, a bit boring, gold color, clear, average carbonation, thin and white foam. There is a side of malt, bready, discreet touch of hop, it could have more aromas.

Neben vielen eher durchschnittlichen Bieren, freut man sich wenn man bei einer Brauerei einmal ein wirklich gutes gefunden hat. Dieses ist sicher auch keine besondere Spezialität, aber sehr fein zu trinken. Möglicherweise ein gewollter Effekt, damit die speziellen, hochwertigeren Biere deutlich merkbar besser schmecken und man dann leichter einen höheren Preis verlangen kann. Den Schweizern wärs zuzutrauen.
Taste is like edelspetz or Lager Hell just with a bit fuller palate (due to corn?) and a better minimal white head. Herbal finish.
Pours golden, sparkling, average head. Aroma of caramel, grain, hops. Taste of caramel, hops, grain.

Geschmacklich (fast) identisch mit dem Säntisbier. → Süffig-getreidig. Nicht zu tief, etwas neutral in der Herbe. Malzig-würzig mit einer leicht süßlichen, neutralen Herbe, die lange auf der Zunge bleibt.

Pours a clear golden color, topped with a fairly decent white head. Malty aroma with some grassy and grainy notes in there. Taste is sweet and grassy, some bitterness in the finish, otherwise pretty average.
Bottle from Brauerei Hofstetten: Golden color, lively carbonation, low white head. Grainy aroma with notes of hops. Flavor is also quite grainy, bit cheap flavor, corn, grassy hops. Bit weak.

(Flasche) Es hat eine goldgelbe Farbe, ist klar filtriert mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist süß, malzig, mit Honig und Blumenwiese. Der Geschmack ist schlank, bisschen süß, getreidig und die Bittere ist mittelstark. Der Abgang ist fast samtig und es bleibt ein kribbeln auf der Zungenspitze zurück.

Bottle from Quack_Duck, dekuji. Golden color with medium white long lasting head. sweet malty aroma with notes of red fruit and honey. Taste, sweet malty, some herbs, caramel, hints of coffee (?), light bitterness in finish. Drinkable beer.
Three Hearts Sommar Brygd Light blond color. Very weak aroma. Watery body, strong bitterness (hop extracts) with just a hint of hop aroma.
Bottled. Pale golden. Rather malty, though soapy aroma. A bit thin with some maltiness and hoppiness.
Golden, thin head. Aroma is metallic and also brings iron and grass. Metallic flavor with touches of honey. Some hops. Mild finish, a little watery.
My bottle was named "Sommarbrygd" only, but I guess it is pretty much the same beer. Golden, small head. Has a weak malty aroma, with some bread. Flavor is metallic and it has a grassy finish.
Slightly hoppy and spicy aroma. Pale low head. Slight aromahops in flavor (citrussy - cascade?). Quitelight but refreshing in a good way, a good summer beer in my opinion.
Good bitterness but not much else. Goes well with the matjessill though.....
Pale yellow. Neutral aroma. Light- to medium bodied, moew malt than expected from the abv. Creamy mouthfeel. Rather low bitterness. A well balanced, but perhaps not overly exciting lager.

Pours with a small head and a clear orange/red color. Malty aroma with a hint of smoke. Slightly sweet ale with a bit of smoke. Don't be expecting a huge in-your-face smokefest like Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbier Urbock. Pleasant enough and a good introduction to the style.

22Oz bottle: Pours a dark orange/red color, with a quickly diminishing head. Malty/wood nose, bland malt taste. Hops are barely noticable. Ends a bit sharp, maybe because of the oak chips it was fermented with.

“Will-Bräu Helles“, Flasche von tegut, Marburg-Wehrda. - Satt goldgelb, blank. - In der Nase eher stumpfes helles Malz, wenig Hopfen. - Antrunk angenehm weißbrotig hellmalzig mit milder, schwach kräuteriger Hopfenherbe und zart süßsäuerlicher Malzigkeit. Mild rezent, weich. Im Abgang recht blasse, etwas stumpfe Herbe. - Wie die meisten Hellen ziemlich fade gehopft aber rund und angenehm im Malz. Durchaus trinkbar.

50cl MHD08/2018, Maruhn DEsampler en route to bocky Einbeck. - - One of the gentler, impressionistic, instantly forgettable clean Helles of the innocent Bavarian kind: basically barley malt perfume that seeks to inspire religious devotion for the cleanliness of its brewing water. Pillowy & Pointlessly flawless.
As Will-Bräu Helles. Pours a clear golden color. Grainy malty start, quite light-bodied malty character, with some shy but good hops towards the finish.
Einfach gestrickter herber Antrunk mit sich leicht ausbreitender Getreidigkeit. Etwas süß, wenig aromatisch, simpel. Trinkbar. 9/8/7/8//8

Draught at the brewpub. It’a golden with a creamy, white and lasting head. The aroma has notes of grain, malt and flower. The moderately ti light sweet flavour has notes of newly harvested grain, malt, flower, and it’s soft and extremely easy to drink.
Bottle. Pale blonde. Malty bready aroma with a hint of flowers. Malty soft flowery, slightly soapy flavor. Hint of apple. Flowery soapy aftertaste.
Abit nicer than the pils, Bready, abit metallic, aftertaste is on the sweet side, not bad, but not worth seeking out.

Light brownish gold in color with a rapidly retreating head, this has a caramel & bread aroma with some grassy, herbal hops. It’s both watery and slightly oily in the mouth. The flavor is sweet caramel with an earthy bitterness that turns tinny in the finish. Not destined to be a favorite. Mainstreet Wine & Spirits, Countryside, IL

Hazy, golden/amber with a small head and light particulate. Aroma is very caramel-heavy right off the bat with grassy hops adding character. Sweet Ovaltine malt in the background amidst light mustiness. Malts appear first in the flavor on top of a spiciness in the palate. It’s a downward spiral from there, however, with middle flavors turning earthen & mineral and a finish that is sour and metallic leaving a phlegmy film on the throat. Mainstreet Wine & Spirits, Countryside, IL 60525

(500 ml bottle: $1.89 at Hi-Time Wine Cellars in Costa Mesa, CA) Probably the least sweet imported beer of this style, it’s actually not sweet at all. There isn’t a whole lot of flavor, but the light breadiness is under control, and in the process, only a mild bitterness is necessary to keep this beer balanced. Because this lager isn’t sweet, and the bready malt is light, this light bodied beer is quite clean throughout, and the mild bitterness and slight citrusy tartness keep the palate crisp and fresh. The nose is also mildly bready and not sweet. Medium straw in color, but the beer is very hazy. The small white head settles to a wide ring, and leaves only spots and a few slashes of lace on the glass. Not enough flavor to hook me, but it’s a nicely made lager that is easy to drink, doesn’t pound the tongue with sweetness, and doesn’t leave a bad aftertaste.
0,5 l Flasche. Goldenes Bier, stabiler Schaum, schöne Gardine. Riecht und schmeckt sehr hopfig, frisch, könnte noch etwas herber sein.
Had one in Aken, Germany, on tap. Not bad, nice aroma and tail, it is also easily drinkable.

“Auerhahn Pils“, Flasche von tegut, Marburg-Wehrda. - Goldgelb, blank. - Schlank, blaß malzig. Recht kräftige, eigenwillig krautige Hopfenherbe mit Eukalyptus und zarter Honignote. Leicht holziger Abgang. - Durchaus trinkbares Pilsener.
Klare goldgelbe Farbe, ordentliche weiße Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr hopfig, leicht grasig, dezente Bitterkeit. Geschmack floral hopfig, süß malzig, wenig Honig, dezente Bitterkeit, ok!
* Old rating, 0,5l crown-top-bottle, best before 27.11.02. Mild-würziges Bier. Nicht zu tief, aber nett getreidig-herb. Feinherber, kaum süßliche Nachgeschmack. Nett.
Leicht hopfiger Start, steigende Getreidigkeit. Trocken herb, hell, geringe Malzigkeit. Wenig bitterer Ausklang, brotig. 9/9/8/8/9/9

Clear pale golden colour, firm and steady small white head. Dense malty aroma with grassy hops. Bittersweet flavour, light to medium body, quite balanced malty and hoppy taste; slightly bitter and a bit sticky finish.
On tap. Golden colour with a small white head. light aroma and taste of malts, citrusand grains. light german pilsener

Draught. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Light malty and moderate hoppy aroma. Grassy notes. Moderate bitter very grassy flavor. Moderate bitter average finish. Great bitterness. Oily palate. Excellent pilsener.

Rerate from tap:8 4 7 3 13 Golden, white lace. Nice flowery aromatics on straw malt Basil, flower entry, hay and cracker malt, grassy, minty finish. Light flowers retronasal. Old rating: 5 2 6 3 11 Bottle. Light herbal citrus nose. Golden, low head, low carbonation. Light body, sparkly, hayish malt, citrus and grass hops. Grainy aftertaste.

Golden with a moderate head. The aroma is hoppy in the typical Greene King way - and the flavour also leads my thoughts in that direction. it has light notes of caramel, fruit and aroma hops. The bitterness is moderate. It’s a nice and uncomplicated beer.
Flaske. Yderst kedelig, en svag duft og smag af citrus, men ellers er det bedste jeg kan sige om denne øl. Kedelig.
Pale gold with pale bubbly head. The aroma is burn’t, caramel and dry. Flavours are thin caramel malts with sweet lemon. Spices follow with a bitter.

Bottle, from Morrisons. Gold, thin but lasting white head and moderate condition. Gentle sweet caramel and flowery hops in the nose, good solid hop resin and fruity caramel in the mouth with a background dry smokiness that is more tobacco than wood, quite dry yet oily in the finish with some fruitiness and hops lingering.

Pale amber with a low head. Citrusy hop aroma against a cookie-like malt background with notes of toffee and oranges. Medium bodied with a long hoppy bitterness. Considering it came in a clear bottle and was three and a half month past best-before-date it was surprisingly good.
Bottle.Golden and clear. Some dryness and left some aftertaste and lacing.Does this brewery find it impossible to brew anything that is not average and mundane?
26 May 2006 - Sweet toffee light smokey hop aroma. Clear brown-amber colour, poor head and OK lacing. Smokey sweet malt hop flavour. Smokey malt hop finish.
Bitter hop malt aroma. Clear red amber colour with fair head and lacing. Bitter malt hop flavour. Fizzy palate.
Bottle. Golden colour with a small white head. Light caramel malty aroma and a sweet hay, butter taste. Light body with a light sweet finish.
Bottle. Clear yellow coloured with a white head. Skunky aroma of malts and fruits. Flavour of malts, fruits and hops.
500ml bottle present. Almost black, reasonable head. Mild toffee malt aroma. Light & sweet.
From a 6 beer box of Greene King beers that I got from Tescos. 3% VOL I shouldn't like this but I really do. Sweet malty beauty. Very refreshing
Cask: Poured a brown translucent with off white head. Aroma is malt. Taste is nice malty full body.

Sample@GBBF2018, London, with the Malmö crew - Dark brown pour with a beige head. Toasted and light roasted malty with notes of caramel and toffee, some vague dark dried fruit, medium body, toasted sweet malty close.

Subtle, malty, and highly drinkable at this strength. Initial impressions are of a bland brew, but the dark roast malts quickly assert themselves. Hops balance, but don't dominate, in what is a genuine dark mild. Pretty good. Cask GBBF August 2018

Cask at Live & Let Live, Kings Lynn. Pours clear dark brown with a beige head. Aroma: light roast malts , nutty, vegetables. Taste: light sweet & bitter, nutty, bready, a touch of caramel. Light body, moderate carb, light dry finish

Cask at the GBBF 2018 day 1 07/08/2018. A clear nut brown coloured pour with a a halo of white head. Aroma is nutty apple, mineral, light veg.. Flavour is composed of nutty malts, green veg twig, yeast is fucked. Palate is green apple, light tan lowish
Cask half at the Volunteers Arms, GBBF. Pours clear dark brown with an off white head. Aroma of malt with fruit. Fruity taste. Sweet finish. Surprisingly tasty for a 3% beer.

Cask, Free Press Cambridge. Deepish brown mahogany colour, white foam. Expectations were low but this was actually in pretty good nick and I quite enjoyed it, some chewy malts and just enough bitterness to keep it drinkable. I guess the GK aversion to wasting money on anything as frivolous as hops matters less in a mild, and the fermentation here felt a bit cleaner too.
Tap @ Woolpack, Chelmsford. Nice head with good duration. Color is bown. Aroma and taste are roast malt, caramel, fruits and hops.
*Old rating, best before 05.09.06. Nettes röstmalziges Schwarzbier. Nette Aromen von Lakritz gepaart mit Röstmalz. Schön trocken und trotzdem gut süffig. Leckeres Schwarzbier.
Это пиво вкусное. я, конечно, рекомендую его всем, что любит хорошую Craft пива!
Tastes like a Schwartz beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 50 cl. Pours a clear reddish brown with a beige head leaving laces. Lightly burned malt aroma. Medium body, lightly sweetish roasted malt with a whiff of vanilla. Dry, lightly burned finish. 221108
Dark brown with red glimts and a beige head. Sweet aroma with notes of roasted malt, caramel and hints of rye bread. Flavour is somewhat sweet with roasted malt and caramel notes. Finished sweet.

50 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden deep amber with a diminished tan head. Mild roasted aroma with a mild acidic touch. Smooth roasted malty flavour with a nice breadish malt flavour. Smooth into the finish emitting a bit of acidic flavours.

The best before was 3 weeks ago, but it seems of no difference for this beer. The color is brown/black and the head is huge, nice and creamy. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, cocoa and a little licorice. The flavour has a light sweetness, notes of roasted malt, cocoa, a little licorice and the finish is dry and citrussy. It’s a nice schwartzbier without too much sweetness.

Bottle. Clear dark red brown color with a large, frothy, good lacing, fully lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate malty, roasted, burnt, light chocolate. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium to light, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. (170408)

[Bottle from svoger.] Great label telling something gonna happens. Fine aroma with loads of ingredients hoping for a great moment next minute. Flavor is in the direction of a Köstritzer which is rare seen, but maybe I’m the only one, hahaha. Roasted malts and an almost black nice liquid with a great creamywhite head. Creamy, bread, schwarzy fullbodied and caramel. Wanna try it again. Good schwarzbier...and I’m looking forward to see it changed in its style!

Bottle, 5.3%. Very weak malt, fruit, and brown sugar aroma. Almost black colour with a red/brown shine. OK stable, medium-sized, creamy light brown head. OK roasted flavour, slightly sweet, with a thin finish.

Friend of mine had this one in his fridge. Pours amber with thick white head. Aroma of wheat, light hops and malt with some kind of additional spice. Flavor is quite mild with no one ingredient stealing the show. Interesting, but not bad... even in winter.
2004 Autumn Brew Review: Coudy. I’ll Go with Straw Coloring. Big Head. Thar Be a Different Sort of Summer Ale...Wheat, Hops and Some Spice to it. Fruit. Would Like to Try Again.

Autumn Brew Review 2004. Strange brew... Dark straw color with a good sized head. Weak aroma of wheat. Kind of a wheat and malt taste, but some spice and hops that aren’t in a typical wheat. I stick by my original comment: strange...

(12 oz bottle) Very mild wheat flavor, somewhat sweet and spicy like a Belgian with a subtle pale maltiness lurking in the background; Bubblegum finish; The spicy, light bubblegum nose has a Belgian character to it, but the nose is also a bit on the sweet side; Light bodied with a modest zip on the palate, but generally not all that exciting; Hazy pale yellow with a very small head on the pour, and absolutely no head within maybe 15 seconds; Only a handful of carbonation bubbles slowly rise toward the surface; No lacing; Different type of American summer brew, almost a Belgian Light beer, and while not great, it's decent enough and I appreciate that it's not just a boring light wheat beer like most American summer beers

Thirsty, I reached blindly into the fridge, grabbed a bottle, popped the top, and poured it into a pint glass, giving little thought to what it was, but thinking it was a hefe weizen. As I finished it, I mused that it must've been a mighty weak weizen, with little hefe and scant wheat texture...then I noticed the bottle, and read the label...partial wheat malts...not far off the mark...interesting... So, the beer...appearance:slightly hazy, orange/amber color, short, disappearing head. Aroma:very sweet and fruity, sugary, a distinctive character, with orange chief at first, and banana gaining prominence later on. I kept my nose in this one for a while, very nice. On the palate, though, the sugary sweetness goes a bit too far, and comes close to cloying. Extraordinarily light in every respect, and an ideal summer slammer. Banana/clove aspects peep up, but never fully form...it's like a half-born hefe weizen. Lacking quite a bit, but neither does it pretend to much, either. A nice little summer ale.
Slightly cloudy. Aroma of a hefe weizen, and one of the few beers where I can actually find banana in the aroma. Flavor of a mild hefeweizen. Thin. ok.

Cloudy straw color,nice aroma of wheat,spice and yeast with a slight citrus side to it.The taste was very nice,wheaty with a good spice content along with a nice mellow citrus that didn't get to out of hand like on some others i've had.The after taste was much the same as the taste with a little more note on the hops and spice coming through.I have to agree with Nuffield that as it warmed it got a little rough to drink.This might be a set back but as far as i'm concerned i prefer this one ice cold for a good experience.The brew is all in all good and worth trying.

Not the best summer ale IMO. More like a Heffe but not too heavy on cloves as are some. Poured light yellow with small head which barely hung around. Did leave some lacing and had OK carbonation. Spicy overtones with definite but not overpowering cloves. Not my favorite but not the worse either.

A hefe profile came through for me, with the clove aroma having something like artificial watermelon candy as well. Mostly clear, just a bit of haze in the dirty yellow color. This was disappointing flat in appearance and palate, with only the fact that I was eating some rather salty rice pilaf able to compensate by stimulating a nice secondary fizz in my mouth. As it warms it ends somewhat limp in the mouth. Acceptable, but with much disappointment.
Crisp yeastiness and noble hops. Tasted rather kolsch-like to me, with a clean maltiness.

Dark brown (a little thin) and I can re-coax a creamy tan head by swirling. Rich chocolatey/dark fruit aroma with mild coffee roasts and dry, oaty background noise. Mostly full-bodied, but it turns watery by the time I swallow. Dark fruits and bitters in the flavor with a light touch of plastic. Ends quickly. On draught at Barleys’s Ale House #1, Columbus, Ohio 43215

Had on tap at Alehouse #1. Poured a very dark brown, very slight creamy head. Smelled like roasted coffee and taste was much of the same. A very slight, creamy sweetness was present as well. Another very good stout from this my favorite home town brewer!
Smells like coffee and taste is almost the same, with some roasted notes. Pretty good and not too thick, though I don’t like coffee too much. Maybe a bit over-rated.

6/8/07: On tap @ Ale House #1 Rich black-opaque body with a small, nice deep tan head. Lace slightly clings to glass. Chocolate malt nose. Yum! – malted milk ball flavor with a mix of roasted coffee and hops. Nicely balanced, finish has a nice hop bite. Glad to see this one re-surface.

On draught at Ale House #1. I really didn’t think this one would come around again considering I first heard of it 5 years ago and never saw it in rotation since. Needless to say it was a pleasant surprise to find it over the weekend. The beer is a flat black color with a medium ivory colored head that retains pretty well. Patchy lacing on the glass. Aroma of sweet malt and roasted coffee beans. Rich, smooth body with a nice roasted character. Flavors of malt, coffee and sweet chocolate, along with a touch of hops. The finish is smooth and milky with a sweet malt and chocolate flavor. Leaves a bit of bitter coffee on the tongue in the end. Solid all around.
Dark brown color with a big tan head. Aroma of roast and sweet fruitiness. Flavor of roasted malts, a little chocolate and cherries.

Firkin @ the Alehouse: Dark brown in color with an off white head. Aroma, roasted malts, some brown sugar. Flavor, bittersweet chocolate, roasted malts, on the sweet side, and the body was kinda milky. Pretty good.

On the firkin at barleys. Black with an average light brown head. A pretty solid aroma with some chocolate and roastiness to it. Flavor was pretty good also but the body was very thin. Pretty solid stout actually.

On firkin at alehouse #1 Pours black with a short tan head. Aromas of bakers chocolate and roasted malts. Flavor includes bakers chocolate, roasted malts, some good dark fruit notes and a slight hop finish. Medium bodied with a soft mouthfeel. This one was pretty tasty!!! Great that a kid already has a beer named after him too!

This is a beer named after one of the brewers that they had in the featured "cask conditioned" flask they keep at the bar. It had a nice body and smell to it. I loved the flavor and hope they decide to include it in their regular rotation.

column1: Bert Grant's Harvest Festival Hop Ale
column4: Yakima Brewing And Malting Co./Bert Grant's Real Ales
column5: Another hoppy amber winter seasonal. While this beer was good, I feel that this same style is done by a lot of brewers for the winter seasonal. Not unique, but still a good brew.
hands down, the worst beer I have ever had. It was so bad I kept a can to take for my friends to try (I have a wicked sense of humor).
cloudy pale orange colour, few head, fresh and buttery, light citrusy, sweet balanced by some acidity, short finish - quite a free interpretation of a pils

Draught @ GEIB, Grande Esposizione Italiane della Birra 2012, Nuova Fiera di Roma, via Portuense 1645, Rome, Italy 00100. ABV: 7.5%. Clear medium yellow orange colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted - caramel, pale malt, sweet malt, light to moderate hoppy, fruity hops, moderate yeasty, sharp yeast. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter with a long duration, sweet yeast, sharp yeast. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20121215]
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.
500ml bottle. Clear golden color. Small size, white head, stays. Sweet, vitamins in aroma. Sweet, artificial sweetener, chemicals in taste. Fcukin awful! Never again!

500ml bottle (Tesco, Zywiec) Basilica aroma, some aloe. Not good. Pale, brief head, fizzy shit. Total abomination in the mouth, those aromas are still there and they’re awful, but on top of that, or should I say below that, there’s horrific artificial sweetener. Well into to horror. Artificial sweetener finish. So deeply in the horror zone I feel proud to have ticked this. World class horror.
Goldenes Getränk mit wenig Schaum. Geruch fruchig, säuerlich, Limette. Geschmack nach Limetten, säuerlich, überhaupt kein Biergeschmack.
Clear golden color. Medium white head, disappears. Citrus, lime, sweet floral aroma. Sweet, sugar, lime in body.
Didn’t find this a wrong beer at all. Pours a nice golden color with a big white foam head. Has indeed very malt aroma with a string tequila and lemon flavor. Good beer for a hot day.
6,0 Mild muffiger Antrunk, wenig aromatisch. Langweilig, nicht bierig. Das Getränk wird zu allem Übel noch muffiger. Die Milde Form von dem, was man beim Anblick der Flasche erwartet. /4/6/5/5/5

Bottle, 6%. Sweet, caramelly radler aroma. Clear golden colour, OK white head. The flavour is quite sweet and radler-like, but with more beer than usual. Alcohol bitterness, probably from the tequila. Good mouthfeel. Bad beer.
pours yellow with some darkess to it.I must agre it has soap on the nose with lime.Taste like i am drinking lemon cascade.Sweet with a small bite and finishes soapy.
Blond color. Lime and soap aroma. Quite sweet, with a lemon note (and washing product as well). Anti-beer.

It’s dark golden with a very light grey hue and a rapidly vanishing head. The aroma has notes of malt, light syrup and light fruit – mostly apple, actually it seems a bit oxidated. The moderately sweet flavour gives me the same thoughts and notes, and it’s not really pils-like much more lager...

Bottle, 5.0% bought at the brewpub. OK fruity hop aroma. Clear dark golden colour. Small stable white head. The flavour is quite bready and slightly skunky, probably due to age. Was already too old when the brewpub sold it to me. Seems malty enough with low to medium bitterness. Could have been OK.

Draught at the brewpub. Bright straw colour, brief head. Faint grassy nose. Medium dry and light bodied. A dat watery or diluted, somewhat astringent with long resiny bitterness. Feels a bit unbalanced with it’s almost watery body and heavy bitterness.

Bottle (bought at the brewery): Golden, quite persistent white foam, sweetish-grainy aroma with a tinge of oaky hops in the background; light to moderate bitter-sweet flavour, light bodied; sweet and slightly oaky hoppy finish. A decent brew with a quite "heavy" rural touch...........

(bottle) Clear, greenish golden colour with a small but persistent foamy white head. Sweet and grainy malt aroma, cereal-like with a light herbal hoppy touch. Sweet flavour, light to medium bodied with a very soft mouthfeel. Grainy, slightly bready and a bit chalky taste with light herbal notes; medium-dry, sweet and malt-accented finish with a tinge of hoppy bitterness. Not very Pilsener-like, but it will do as a decent Helles.
Standard lager color, no head. Mildly cloudy appearance. Fruity, mildly hopped and alcoholic aroma. Medium bodied. Strongly fruity flavor with sweet tones, some hops in aftertaste. Round ending.
Only faint malt- and barnyardaroma. Medium bodied. Neutral taste with some apple fruitiness. Bland and unconvincing, but drinkable.

The color is beautiful bronze and the head is small and white. The aroma has notes of syrup and dark bread (not rye bread) san malt. The slightly sweet flavour has notes of syrup, malt, dark bread, dry citrus and the finish is really dry.

Bottle, 5.0%. Mild aroma, a little sweet malt, hint of bread. Clear orange colour. Small stable white head. The flavour starts off bready, does not taste entirely fresh. Not past BB date, unless it is over a year, as there is no year on the label. The flavour turns more malty after a few sips, with a mildly rough, grassy hoppiness. A rather complex beer for Germany, would love to try it fresh vom Fass.

Bottle thanks to ronnie! Wow, what a beer! Darker for a lager, amazing soft carbonation, makes it incredibly drinkable, theres some caramel flavours and grassy herbal hop, very well made and balanced. Awsome stuff id have happily had it all nite, but others were to be had.

Bottle (purchasaed at the brasserie): Amber coloured, mid-sized, slowly collapsing off-white head, sweet dark-malty to toasted-malty nose with hops in the background and presumably a tinge of smoke; soft MF, light to medium bodied, moderate sweet-bitter flavour; lingering, dryer hoppy and toaste-malty finish. Very decent franconian brew..........

(bottle) Clear, chestnut colour with a short off-white foamy head. Sweet malt-accented toasty nose with caramel and a whiff of liquorice and a light hoppy touch. Moderately sweet flavour with a balancing level of bitterness, light to medium bodied, soft on carbon. Toast-malty, slightly (dark-)bready taste with caramel. Medium-dry, malty and toasty finish with an aromatic herbal hoppy blend and a lasting aftertaste with caramel and notes of chocolate. Good !
No head at all, almost no carbon. Reddish-amber colored. Liquorice in both aroma and taste. Some hopbitterness. A bit skunky. There are much better beers of this type.
Kupljen u Holandiji. U redu je. Bolje nego tipični lager il pilsner u Srbiji. Ima aromu. Slabu aromu, no barem je ima. Nema baš neki ukus, poput tipičnog piva, malo bolji. Pitko.

Redelijk moutig, redelijk bitter en bovenal goed doordrinkbaar. Voelt wel wat waterig aan hierdoor net ff iets te weinig body om het premium te mogen noemen. Vrij neutrale moutige geur voor een pils. Goeie gele gefilterde kleur maar een lichte witte schuimkraag. Volgens mij was dit een biertje wat we vroeger in het oosten van het land altijd op voor en najaar vakantie kochten. Lekker goedkoop maar toch met een "redelijke" smaak voor een budget biertje maar in me herinnering was de smaak beter.... Proefglas
33cl blikje via Plus, Maastricht Alcoholpercentage van 5% Gedronken uit blikje Pilsener conclusie: redelijk voor een budgetpils
destijds gekocht voor het etiket, ik zou niet eens weten of het bier überhaupt nog bestaat. vroeger was het al bocht. Type Katerpils.
Blik gekocht bij de Spar in Burg Haamstede. Het is een goudgeel bier met een dun schuim. Het heeft een moutige geur en smaak.
500ml can in Amsterdam. Aroma is very light oats. Pale yellow. Dull and watery. Drinkable.
Kremete, grei karbonering. Rar bismak som jeg ikke får i andre. Smaker generelt ikke så mye. Ikke den beste billig-ølen 4,2/10 180701

Een mooi, helder geel pils met een mooie schuimige witte kraag. Het aroma is hop bitter, en toch enigszins verfrissend. De nasmaak is echter oppervlakkig en blijft niet lang hangen. A nice clear, yellow lager with a nice, foamy white head. Is has a hop-like aroma, but still somewhat sweet. The taste is hop-bitter, but somehow still refreshing. The palate however is somewhat shallow, and doesn't hang on.
Kostet fast nichts, Sieht ganz ok aus, riecht merkwürdig, schmeckt überhaupt nicht, im Regal stehen lassen!
Ganz nettes süffiges pils, recht klassisch, angenehm herb malzig leichter Hopfen, nicht so schlecht
0,33l Bügelflasche mit 5,0%! Sehr helles Gelb. Weisser Schaum. Zitroniger Hopfenduft. Kastanienhonig. Zu süss im Antrunk. Zitrone, Honig, Getreide.

33 cl bottle @ Timo A. BBE 02.03.2018. Pours pale clear golden color with a small white head. Nice grassy hoppy aroma, subtle citrus, faint malty notes. Flavor is bitter hoppy, grassy dry, some citric fruity notes, faint herbal tones. Nice and refreshing Pils. 2424
33cl bottle. Pours clear golden colour with a huge most good lasting white head. Aroma of mild grassy hops, noble hops. Taste of intense hops, grassy, a bit spicy, floral, nice!
Flasche 33cl. Herbfrisches Pils mit feiner Hopfennote. Leicht trinkbar. Über dem Durchschnitt, lässt allerdings an Raffinesse vermissen. Hopfen könnte noch deutlicher akzentuiert sein.
Bottle. Pale golden, white foam. Flowery hops. Medium light body, mellow sparkly body. Hayish malt, very fresh grassy finish, nice.
Strandslag 10, de fles kwam mee van thuis. Lekker pils! Backlog from 2015/08/05.

33cl bb11/2015, newly labeled (containing lots of brewing info): new recipe "Vier-Sorten-Hopfung", at 5%. Thanks to DBB for the Ulmer haul. - Fresh golden pour, good body and foam. Fresh green bouquet, chlorophyllic green grasses, herbs and hay layered with apple peel and citrus rind. Nice bite to the textured pilsner malts, near Bohemian style (edgy "sawdust"), soaking up assertive Tettnanger’s herbal zing. Unusual lingering bitter finish. Great character - previous raters must have had older 4,5% recipes or jaded palates.
Cervesa refrescant i lleugera, té un petit toc àmarg a l’entrar a la boca. Cerveza refrescante y ligera, tiene un pequeño toque amargo al entrar en la boca.
Draught. It’s golden with a huge, creamy head. The aroma is mildly floral and malty. The flavor has a light sweetness and notes of flowers, grass, spicy hops, malt and the finish is slightly dry.
Bottle. Gold. Soft rye and floral notes. Rye, a hint of citrus and soft floral notes in the flavor. Medium bodied. Drinkable, nothing more.
Fruchtiges, malzaromatisches Aroma. Bernsteinfarben, leicht opal. Malziger Antrunk, weich, etwas metallisch. Schmales Mundgefühl, zarte Bittere. Süße dominiert. 6.12.17 Flasche

Bottle. Clear golden body with white head. Aroma is malty fruity with some floral notes and maybe some honey in the background. Taste is malty bready with some biscuits. Aftertaste is nice balanced between hoppy bitterness an malty sweetness.
Reddish color with average white head; aroma is malty slightly spicy with some yeast; taste is medium sweet with spice and a very soft hoppy note;

33cl bottle. Pours clear dark golden colour with a huge most good lasting off-white head. Aroma of sweet grainy malt, caramel, dry fruits. Taste of dry hops, metallic hops, sweet grains, pale fruits, caramel.

330 ml botte as "Schlägl Bio Roggen" from a wholefood shop, bb 02.06.16. Golden, clear body, with a medium, dissipating, frothy, off-white head. Aroma of grains, rye, bread, flowers, some honey, some fruits. Tastes of grains, grass, herbs, flowers, some spices, some biscuit, some rye, slight citric fruits. Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation. Finishes medium bitter, quite dry, grassy, herbal, floral, a bit spicy. OK, but I was expecting a bit more. Tastes quite boring, with the rye just in the backgroung. Not the most distinctive Roggenbier and there are better beers by this brewery in my opinion.
Bottle. Clear golden pour, with a white head. Malty, biscuit, rye, corn flakes, and a bit sweet. Not bad, quite drinkable.

Bottle pour at Malt and Vine. Pours a really cloudy golden color with a unique, orange juice like aroma. Fruity. Flavor is orange fruit flavors with some bread, rye and a little banana. Interesting beer here. Liked it, and glad I tried it. Decent beer.

33cl longneck as "Schlägl BIO Roggen" (5,2%) from FR-Denn’s - bb06/2014. Aroma of Biobrot, sawdust, glue, quince jelly and vegemite: very odd for a top-fermenting specialty grain...Taste is same, with retronasal herbal notes, more as in a capsule of vitamin supplement than in wild honey, and popcorn roast. Very odd indeed, keeps the sensory system busy. Palate is ecobreadcrust-dry, mildly spicy rye aftertaste.

Bottle from trade with Geiserich. Label says Bio Roggen. Clear golden color with small white head. Fruity, malty aroma. Sweet malty, fruity taste with honey, rye(?), bitter hops. Light hoppy bitterness in fruity finish.

Klare, goldene Farbe mit großer, weißer Schaumkrone. Getreidiger, fruchtiger Geruch. Geschmacklich malzig getreidig mit mittlerer Süße, leicht bitter mit dezent fruchtigen Aromen. Leichter Körper mit sanfter Kohlensäure. Erfrischend, gut.
Goldgelbe Farbe, blank. Hopfenaromen. Schlanker Körper. Ausgewogen. Gutes Lager. 0,5l-Flasche am 24.12.17
Bottle. Clear gold with a big white head. Grains, honey, some fruit (apple, pear), dough. Crisp, light sweetness and light bitterness. Medium carbonation on a light body. Decent.

Bottle. Honey, apple, caramel malt and straw aroma. Golden yellow with small head. Moderately sweet apple. caramel malt, and mildly bitter straw flavor. Good body. Decent - probably quite a bit better fresh.
Bottle: Almost clear, deep gold, with a small white head. Grain malt, mild apple aroma. Fruity, grain malt, toffee malt taste. Very sweet....malty. Nice body...pretty tasty.
Bottle. Golden body with nice large lasting white head. Aroma is grains an slighty fruity. Taste is nice grains and bisquits. Aftertaste is nice sweet and bitter. Nice Lager.
Ok drinking. Not a lot of flavor here. Golden pour. Crisp finish. Average carbonation. Bottle.

500 ml bottle from Klosterladen Schottenstift, Vienna. Deep golden, clear body, with a big, frothy, lacing, white head. Aroma of bread, grass, ripe fruits, honey. Taste follows this, with some more citric notes and some herbs. Medium, a bit creamy mouthfeel, with an average carbonation. Finishes bitter, a bit dry, hoppy, citric, grassy, herbal. Nice one. Definitely not an average Helles, pretty aromatic for this style, with interesting fruit notes, but still easy and fresh. Another great style example from this brewery.

August 14th, 2013 - The previous beer in the Schlagl panel was the Doppel Bock, and the next in line is the Kristall. No, not the fabulously decadent symbol of wealth, but a demure brew showing off the power of subtlety and parsimony in brew crafting. The head is a web, mottled mess, and the body is a deep honeycomb orange with a shifting sand style of haze. In the smell I catch honey and white grapes, though the vapors aren’t spritzy enough to carry the full implication of freshness that the scents express. The taste is also quite light, with a touch of white peach flesh, honey, and apple juice, served on a delicate yet sudsy palate. Another fitting entry, and an under appreciated bottle.

Bottle [from Euro Swap 7 thanks to Sebilinz] @ home. (Note: even after consulting Erich / Sebilinz we weren’t sure which beer it was, but we’re guessing this one. Bottle said "helles" but also 5.0% ABV. Barcode was not in the database so no way to tell for sure.) Clear light yellow color, small white head. Smell and taste malts, hayish, decently bitter. Suitable body and carbonation. Quite clean and crisp. Nice.

Je ne fus pas à la fête avec cette Kameleon Triple, qui est réellement très médiocre, que ce soit sur l'équilibre notamment avec un alcool mal intégré ou les arômes peu intéressants voire même peu appréciables (on est d'ailleurs très tournés sur les herbes). Robe blond doré trouble et mousse blanche de 3 mm en verre, rien de particulier à signaler. Le nez nous donne le cap : de l'alcool, des herbes (quasi médicinales !), de l'orange et du caramel. L'alliance n'est pas spécialement fantastique. L'attaque se poursuit par des déséquilibres sur la structure en complément de celui sur les arômes : petite acidité doublée d'un alcool (8,5 % Abv) mal intégré ; Les arômes restent quant à eux ceux découverts au nez. La deuxième bouche varie peu, l'acidité disparaît mais laisse place à une alcool ressortant davantage et déséquilibrant la bière. L’arrière bouche, linéaire est quant à elle peu ample. La troisième montre alors le maximum d'amertume (celle-ci restant modérée) avant un final moyennement long sur l'alcool et les herbes. Bref, triple particulière mais surtout pas réussie.
Hazy golden/yellow liquid, large head. Soft aroma of tripel. Light body, strong carbonation. Taste is bitter.
from bottle in bl. poured gold, botnof head. fruitcake and spice but plain.

330 ml bottle into chalice, no bottle dating. Pours slightly hazy/cloudy pale golden/yellow color with a 1 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big lemon, orange, peach, pear, melon, red apple, pepper, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, herbal, grass, light banana/clove, and yeast earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of fruity/spicy yeast and pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big lemon, orange, peach, pear, melon, red apple, pepper, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, herbal, grass, light banana/clove, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate yeast spiciness and herbal/grassy bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of lemon, orange, peach, pear, melon, red apple, pepper, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, herbal, grass, light banana/clove, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice complexity, robustness, and balance of complexity of fruity/spicy yeast and pale malt flavors; with a great malt/bitter/spiciness balance, quite clean with no astringent flavors after the finish. Light-moderate dryness from bitter/spiciness and carbonation. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately crisp/bready/grainy, and lightly sticky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Minimal warming alcohol for 8.5%. Overall this is a delicious tripel. All around nice complexity, robustness, and balance of complexity of fruity/spicy yeast and pale malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and quite refreshing to drink. Likely less than a year old on this one. Nice yeast vibrancy and hop presence; with very pale malt character and color. A very enjoyable offering, and spot on style example.
Bottle at the sisters. Hazy yellow colour small white head. Nose is low banana. Taste is low banana, bubnlegum. Really similar to nzq. Fat finish, booze in the mouthfeel.
33cl bottle shared with maakun and Kermis. Thin white head. Very hazy golden pour. Herbal aftertaste.

Bottle shared thanks to Deanso’s cellar elimination program. Clear golden with nice white head. Sweet malts and honey, lots of strong bitter herbs and dried flowers, cornflakes, grass, light paint remover. Medium sweet and very bitter. Medium bodied with alcoholic finish.

33cl Bottle from Prik&Tik Baelus. Hazy golden colour, white head. Aroma of plastic, dead yeast, herbal, some nice Tripel notes underneath. Flavour is the same, acrid plastic bitterness. Medium bodied, some alcohol. Bad.
On the dry side for a tripel, though appropriately-so for a hoppy version, with some champagne/cider-like character.

Pours clear blonde. Ok to small white head. Smell is rathe sweet, but also has a cloride aspect ( what? ) taste is mildly bitter. Some aromatic malts. Bit sweet in the back, but a weird sweetness... Strange beer. Ok though..
Keg at the brewpub. Clear amber, medium creamy tan head, good retention. Aroma of toasted malt, herbal hop, mild caramel. Taste is caramel, toffee, toasted malt, dry herbal hop. Medium bodied, crisp.
On draft at the brewpub it is a clear Amber color with a slight head. The aroma is malt and the taste is slightly sweet and fruity.
On draft at the brewpub. Pours a clear amber with an off white head. Aroma of taosted malt. Flavor of stone fruit. Slight sweetness to the finish.

22 oz bottle notes from a year ago (not sure how old the bottle was). Pours a clear golden amber color with a medium sized white head. The aroma and flavor have mildly sweet malts, hints of a hard to place fruity character, slightly bitter, toasted bread a hint of earth. This is not a big beer at all, nothing memorable and I wouldn’t drink this again.

From a bomber. Slightly sweet aroma and perhaps some perfumy hints of citrus. Yellow and sortah brown maybe orange inthere to. Wew, quite a impact at first, seemed a little bitter for a fest but after the session continued, it got a little better. Decent co2, yes, cleans up after you drink it for a while. Some sweet cloying attributes but never rude. A little better than most fest beers.

On tap during Ohio Brew Week 2013, taster from Tony’s. Clear golden color. Little white head. Couple bits and ropes of lace. Light to medium body. Smooth, lighter, kind of soft carbonation, more dry texture. Good peppery breadiness, light hay. Moderate bitter taste, minimal sweet. Solid lager. Nothing special for me. Decent marzen, though.

Light biscuit aroma, pours a clear light amber with a half glass of white head. Slight bitter taste, then a touch of tartness, finishing with the biscuit notes. Not a Buckeye beer I’ll be getting again, their other offerings have been much better.

Probably not the best critic on this one. I believe the style deserves the high rating but overall this wouldn’t be a go to beer or even an occasional beer for me. Appearance & color was nice. It looked appealing. Liquid is hazy Head is solid in retention, just off white.

Sample at Buckeye Beer Engine on 9/11/12. Clear amber to copper pour with a medium beige head. Malty and caramelly nose with some roast and crisp fruit notes. Malty and fruity flavor with some caramel and a mild, light toasted finish.

Pours a translucent gold with a thick, frothy head. Perhaps over carbonated Sweet, lightly malty aroma appropriate to the style. Sour, overly effervescent taste suggesting some infection in this batch. Numerical scoring here represents what i hope is an anomaly. Will rescore when I can try another bottle. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On draft at the brewpub. Pours a clear copper with an off white head. Aroma of pine. Flavors of mandarin orange and caramel. Moderately bitter finish.

22 oz. bottle purchased at Buckeye Brewing Co.’s Tapstack, Cleveland, OH. Dark orange pour with a short off-white head. Aroma of wet grass, faint citrus, and damp pale malt. Decent flavor with hop forward tangerine and grassy hops but there is plenty of sweet, almost sugary, caramel and toffee malt to be found as well. A little too sweet for an IPA as far as I am concerned but by no means a bad beer.

Aroma: Rich floral and resin hops. Appearance: Light amber with a light head. Taste: Medium bitterness throughout. Palate: Medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation, soft finish. Overall: This is interesting. There’s big aroma of hops, but in the flavor, it’s mellowed and much more drinkable than many of the more acerbic IPA offerings. The balance is intriguing, and there’s enough there to catch my attention.
On draft. Cooper color with one finger head. Citrus and slight caramel aroma. Taste is similar with some floral in there too.
Caramel in color... Minimal hop aroma... Nice malty flavor, decent hop balance... Not terribly hoppy but a decent IPA

Bottle brought back from Ohio. Orange pour with large fluffy off-white head. Citrus hop and caramel aroma. Caramel malts balanced well with the hop bitterness in the taste. Good clean bitter and toast in the finish.

22 oz. bottle from notes. Pours a hazy deep amber color with a medium sized off white head. The aroma and flavor had floral hops, lightly toasted bready malts, caramel, orange citrus, hints of pine, grapefruit. Medium bodied. Better than I thought this would be as I may have found a pretty fresh bottle.
Hate to say it but just not my cup of tea. Lots of malt and sweetness and just wasn’t looking for that. Not super toasted but a bitter finish. Ok overall.

Bottle thanks to fatknitty. Pours a mostly clear copper-amber with a medium off-white head. Aroma is citrus, some tropical fruit, fruit-flavored candy, and some bready malt. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter, quite malty. Bitter finish. Nice, big, atypical IPA.

Wow... this beer had a freakishly active level of carbonation. It took a half hour to pour this beer before my wife and I were able to drink it. It looks slightly hazy, with a dark/medium pale orange color and an off-white, wickedly billowy head. The lacing is thick and frothy, and looks like it’s sticking to the glass with super glue. The nose is clean and lightly hopped with somewhat fruity, with Cascade hops dominating. Gently. In the mouth, well, I’m actually feeling a little let down here. My wife thinks it’s skunky, but I think it’s just... odd. Cascade greets the tongue as it enters the mouth, followed closely behind by rich caramel malts. Its body feels just a little too full, and it makes that caramel feel very heavy on the palate. It’s good, don’t get me wrong, but where it seems odd to me is mostly in the finish, which is bitter - just lacking. There’s definitely a strong yeast character that seems to have stuck around. Most likely this excessive yeast was also to blame for the beer’s excessive carbonation. Maybe a thinner body and higher alcohol would help... or maybe less caramel malts. Or maybe a different yeast strain. I’m not sure, exactly, where this is off, but it could go in a few directions for improvement. It’s definitely a heavy IPA. Good, but misses the mark.

column1: A1A Ale Works Porpoise Point Pale Ale
column5: Tap at brewery. Pours hazy amber. Aroma and flavor are honey, pale malt, corn, floral hops, and faint toast. Medium body.

column1: A1A Ale Works Porpoise Point Pale Ale
column5: Draft at the brewpub. Pours hazy amber with a fizzy off white head. Tastes like grapefruit hops, toasted malt, and grassy with light spice. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like grapefruit hops, toasted malt, and grassy with light spice.

column1: A1A Ale Works Porpoise Point Pale Ale
column5: Draft at the brewpub. Dark brownish-amber with little head. Medium citrusy hoppiness. Flavorful but light enough for a couple at lunchtime before walking around town.

column1: A1A Ale Works Porpoise Point Pale Ale
column5: Not bad but neither too bitter. Was part of the flight and was quite easy to drink and enjoy with a burguer.

column1: A1A Ale Works Porpoise Point Pale Ale
column5: Draft. Clear dark gold with a light white head. Mild ark a and flavors, served too cold to let flavors come thru maybe

column1: A1A Ale Works Porpoise Point Pale Ale
column5: On tap at the brewpub. Pours deep amber with a slight haze, a with very good head and lacing. Aroma: sweet citrus hops; hints of toffee. Flavor: Nice citrus=toned hops. Has a moderately bitter lingering aftertaste. Feel: Near medium body with carbonation that could be a touch higher.

column1: A1A Ale Works Porpoise Point Pale Ale
